loans.name: Segivao

texts.en:
Segivao I. is 34 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Segivao has 3 years of experience in this business.  Segivao needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical vegetable garden in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/VegetableGarden#

In 2007, Segivao joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Segivao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Segivao I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.6 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 29 años, es una hombre muy trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejora su calidad de vida. Por lo que considera que tiene la edad suficiente para trabajar y ganar su propio dinero, y dejar de ser una carga para su familia. Es así que todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano trabaja en las chacras que le heredaron sus padres y de esa manera lograr que sus cultivos de papa y arvejas tengan los cuidados necesarios, por que sabe que al momento de venderlos, serán rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, siendo esta actividad su única fuente de ingreso, por lo que lleva 3 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus siembras de los cambios climáticos que afectan mucho su productividad. Más adelante, desea comprar más terrenos para extender sus cultivos. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de arveja, abono e insecticidas, para llevar a cabo una exitosa siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel, 29, is a very hard-working man. He lives in his parents’ house and his greatest desire is to improve his quality of life. He feels that he’s old enough to work and earn his own income and stop being a burden for his family. So it is that every morning he works the fields his parents left him so that his potato and pea crops will have the proper care that will insure their speedy sale once they are harvested. What he likes best about his work is the planting; this activity is his only source of income and he’s been in this line of work for three years. The most difficult part of his work, he thinks, is caring for his plants so that they are protected from the climate changes that so affect productivity. Later on, he’d like to buy more fields so that he can expand his growing area. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he is sure the loan will be of much benefit in the development of his activity. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is highly respected as a result of this. He will use the 1500 new soles requested to buy pea seed, manure and insecticides so that his crop will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Manith

texts.en:
Mrs. Manith N., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sophat Noun, 31, have been married since 2004 and have two sons. One of them attends school and the other is still young and stays at home. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Manith has been selling fish for over one year and also raises pigs at home. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: David

texts.en: Davit Malkhasyah is from the village of Lernakert in Shirak Marz in the Republic of Armenia.  He is a mechanic by training and is married with a daughter and 3 sons.  He tries to help his less well-off relatives with some of the produce he grows.  He has been involved in agricultural work for 19 years and considers himself a self-reliant, honest worker.  He was born in Lernakert and has strong ties to his family and fellow villagers.  He is looking for a loan to raise cattle and grow vegetables.  He will use the loan proceeds to purchase livestock, feed and seed.  This loan will allow him to continue to grow his small business.  He expects to increase his monthly income by 30% with the loan and will use some of the proceeds to expand his cowshed and do some minor repairs in his house.  The remaining part of his additional income will go back into his business to improve its sustainability.

loans.use: Livestock, Animal Feed

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B., 52 years old, is from the village of Lumbia Cagayan de Oro City. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Betty makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Betty joined HSPFI in 2010 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients for her products. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her products.

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou N., 55, is widowed and resides with her daughter in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells fish at a local market for an income of USD 13 per day. Her daughter is a garment factory worker, earning an income of about USD 2.6 per day. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her sixth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N. appears in the photograph in a short-sleeved shirt with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Sorry For We Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sorry For We” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Memunatu M. who is pictured on the left. She is age 32 and was born in Makeni. She is married with two children. Her husband is a businessman and one of her children is attending primary school while other is not of school age.

For many years now, Memunatu has been selling fried food, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans, etc. She will use her share of the loan to buy more vegetable oil, fish, meat, flour, palm-oil, beans, etc., in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable oil, fish, meat, flour, palm-oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Mechie

texts.en:
Mechie C. is from the town of Banga. She is 50 years old. Mechie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mechie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mechie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Mechie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mechie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mechie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mechie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil L. Sr. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 32 years old, married and has 1 infant. Ramil owns and operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Ramil has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Ramil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramil is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ramil from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Mwatumu

texts.en:
Mwatumu B. is forty-three years old, married, and has three children aged between twenty and fourteen years old. Her business is located at Kakamega.

She has been selling vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge she has is these goods are highly perishable, and because she does not have any refrigeration facility, the vegetables go bad. There is also scarcity of vegetables during dry seasons, making them expensive for the consumers. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 15,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business.

She hopes to grow her business and be able to supply a variety of groceries. She describes herself as ambitious, polite, and patient.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Bellieza

texts.en:
Bellieza H. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 44 years old. Bellieza is engaged and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bellieza owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing boarding house rental to local community members. Bellieza has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately PHP18,000 gross a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bellieza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bellieza is requesting a new loan of PHP20,000, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Bellieza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely  tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, desde entonces trabaja a diario en los terrenos que le fue heredado por sus padres, sembrando principalmente papa, maíz, arveja y flores, en tanto su esposo se encarga de realiza los trabajos más fuertes, mientras que vende los productos ya cosechados. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en la agricultura porque le permite tener siempre disponible en su despensa los alimentos necesarios, por otro lado cría animales como carneros, cerdos y cuyes. Su pan próximo es procurar aumentar la productividad de lo que cultiva, es por ello que desea extender el espacio que siembra así podrá aumentar su cosecha. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Nely, 26, lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. Since childhood she has been a farmer. Since then she has worked the fields daily that her parents passed on to her farming primarily potatoes, corn, peas and flowers. Her husband does the heaviest work and sells the harvested crops. She states that she likes farming because it allows her to always have food available. She also raises small farm animals like sheep, pigs and guinea pigs.Her future plan is to increase farm productivity so she wants to expand the area she plants. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always demonstrated responsibility in her repayments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting which will be very useful for her business’ progress. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy sacks of manure and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and seed.

loans.name: Luis Salvador

texts.es:
Luis Salvador C. V. tiene 42 anos. Vive con sus hijos en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 15 anos. 

Luis es un socio de la ventanilla rural Progreso Comunitario, que está ubicada a dos horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura. Es productor de cacao. Vende y compra sus productos en San Jose del Tambo. Solicita el crédito para el mejoramiento de sus huertos de cacao. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría mejorar a su economía. Su sueno es agregar su vivienda y mejorar sus huertos de cacao con buena producción. Las plagas y enfermedades afectan bastante sus cultivos. 

Le gusta pasear a lugares donde no conoce, jugar deportes, y participar en los festivales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Luis Salvador C. V., 42, lives with his children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has two children who are 17 and 15 years of age.

Luis is a member of Progreso Comunitario (Community Progress) communal bank located two hours from Chillanes.  It has 11 members who are mostly cocoa bean farmers or small businessmen.

Luis is a farmer.  He grows cocoa beans.  He sells and buys his products in San José del Tambo.  He is asking for funds to improve his cocoa bean orchards.  With financial support he will be able to improve his economy.  His dream is to enlarge his home and improve his orchards with good production.  Plant infestations and diseases affect his crops quite a bit.

He likes to travel to places he hasn’t visited, to play sports and to participate in his community’s festivals.

loans.use: To buy cocoa bean farming supplies.

loans.name: Lumumba

texts.en:
Lumumba Achieng' is 48 years old, married and has one child who is fourteen and attending school. He is a dairy farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for six years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces milk which he sells to the local market. He is also a lecturer in animal husbandry and treats animals in his area. His biggest challenges in farming have been the lack of enough animal feed, stiff market competition, loan facilities being rare and the purchasing power of clients being very low.

Lumumba has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. (He comments that Juhudi should widen the loan products available to individuals and keep up the spirit of lending to the low-income groups in society.) The extra income from this loan will improve his income and his living standards. In future, he would like to increase the number of his dairy cows, improve his artificial insemination service and open a small agrovet.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Begaim

texts.en:
Begaim S. is 44 years old and lives in Panfilovka village in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She graduated from medical college and currently works as a nurse in the local hospital. Begaim has two children: one daughter who is 19 and a son, 23 years old.  Her husband works as a fireman in the local boiler house. Begaim has very close-knit family, where all members support and help each other. 

In 2000, in order to cover the family’s expenses, Begaim decided to engage in cattle breeding, using an initial capital of 3,000 Kyrgyz Soms. She bought cattle and managed to enlarge her herd to four cows, two bull calves, and six sheep.  

Begaim plans to use the loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by purchasing one milch cow and two bull-calves. With the revenues from this investment, Begaim plans to buy a car for her family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Dembagnouma (La Bonne Mère) Group

texts.fr:
Dembagnouma est un regroupement de femmes de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien  et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes, des poissons, des habillements et du maraîchage. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Sétou C. est un membre du groupe Dembagnouma qui vend des condiments alimentaires de toutes sortes : les épices, de l’oignon, l’ail, du Sounbala, des tomates, du sel de cuisine, de la poudre du gombo etc. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, ces condiments en gros à Bamako. Elle vend les condiments en détail et au comptant au  marché de Darsalam Koko à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les membres du groupe Dembagnouma comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Sétou C. compte réaliser 160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Dembagnouma is a group of women from the city of Koutiala who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are, on average, 37 years old, married, and have at least four children. 

This group of women deals in various articles such as condiments of all kinds, fish, clothing, and fresh produce.  

In order to increase their business activity, the members decided to participate in the credit program through Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. They are on their seventh group loan, having repaid all the previous loans. 

Sétou C., a member of the Dembagnouma group, sells condiments of all kinds:  spices, onion, garlic, Soubala, tomatoes, table salt, okra powder, etc. 

She plans to use her loan to buy condiments wholesale in Bamako.  She sells them at retail for cash and on credit at the market in Darsalem Koko to a varied and diverse clientele. 

While the other members of the Dembagnouma group plan to make an average monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA each on this loan cycle, Sétou C. plans to make 160,000 FCFA.

In addition to repaying their loans, they will use a part of their revenue to meet daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. is from the village of Paz Village, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Gina is separated from her spouse and has four adult children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, instant noodles & junk food in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Paz Village, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Dilrabohon's Group

texts.en:
Dilrabohon M. is 40 aged woman.  She is married and is bringing up three children together with her husband. The youngest children are school pupils.

The adult members of this family earn their livelihood in different ways: the head of the family is a private driver, Dilrabohon is a school teacher, and the eldest daughter adds to the family budget by working as a dressmaker.

The family wants to purchase construction materials in order to build a new house.  This is the main goal of obtaining a loan. In the future, Dilrabohon is planning to prepare a dowry for her daughter. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to build new house

loans.name: Dogbo

texts.fr: Mme Dogbo  a 41 ans et est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants.    Elle est née à Aného et habite Tokoin Cassablanca, elle fait la vente du jus et glaçon. Elle fait cette activité il y a de cela 3 ans et achète  les ingrédients au marché local de Gbossimé. Pour satisfaire plus de clients, elle demande un prêt pour acheter un congélateur.
texts.en: Dogbo is 41 years old and married with two children. She was born in Aného and lives in Tokoin Cassablanca. She sells juice and ice-cubes, and has being doing this for the past three years. She buys her ingredients at the local market in Gbossimé. She is requesting a loan to buy a freezer so that she can satisfy more customers.

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny, de 27 años, es una mujer muy alegre y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cecilio (38)  y sus cinco pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y maíz, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de Pichanaki, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Pichanaki, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, tiene planeado  comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones.Este es el segundo préstamo de Marleny con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.Con los mil soles solicitados, invertirá en  limpiar su chacra y contratará peones, para que la ayuden en el cultivo, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Marleny is 27 years old.  She is a very happy and kind woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Cecilio (38) and her five young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through a lot of hard work, Marleny has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows coffee and corn which she then takes to the market in Pichanaki to sell wholesale.  What she most likes about her work is taking care of her crops.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products to Pichanaki since the sacks that are very heavy and make her very tired.  In the future, she plans to buy new land to expand her plantations.

This is Marleny's second loan with MFP and she would like to be punctual in making her repayments.  She takes part in her community bank's activities and is always up to date on the agreements that the group has reached.  She will invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested in weeding her farm and hiring laborers so that they can help her with her crops.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To pay laborers to help improve her crops

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 45 years old, a widow with four children who are seventeen and twenty-four for the youngest and oldest respectively. Currently, four of her children attend school.

Vestine sells fish, which she has done for ten years. Vestine will use this new loan to purchase more fish to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Vestine is expecting to build a house. She wishes to have a big sum of money in the future for the growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy enough volume of fish to sell

loans.name: Kymbat's Group

texts.en:
Kymbat R. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tup, a small village in the Isykul region. She is 59 and married. She and her husband have raised three daughters and two sons, all now married. In order to earn money to cover their personal expenses, Kymbat breeds cattle and sells milk. Her husband works as a driver. With money received from this loan, the family wants to purchase a bull calf to resell at a higher price after fattening. In the future, Kymbat dreams of building a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Agustin

texts.fr: Augustin U. est travailleur de centre de sante, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est ne a Rwanda, il est marie, et il a 5 enfants entre 6 mois et 15 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école, et Augustin a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Il va utiliser ce prêt pour le paiement des minervaux de ces enfants, et l’achat de l’aliment pour sa famille.  Il voudrait éduquer ses enfants pour qu’ils terminent leurs études, et avoir la bonne vie pour sa famille.
texts.en: Augustin U. is a health care worker and has been a client of ACB since 2007. He was born in Rwanda, is married, and has five children, ages 6 months to 15 years of age. Four of his children attend school. Augustin himself has completed six years of primary schooling. He is going to use this loan to cover the school fees for his children and to buy food for his family. He would like to educate his children, so that they complete their studies, and to provide a good life for his family.

loans.use: Paying the school fees for his children

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen members. Mrs. Phan, a 33 year old married woman, is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. While each member of this village will use their portions of the loans to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Phan and her husband are pig breeders who are able to earn a small income to help support their family's costs of living. In order to support this business, Mrs. Phan would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding. Aside from being a pig breeder, her husband is earns his living by woodcutting. 

This couple has four children: two are attending in the local school and the others two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pig food for pig breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to rent a shop and start his business in the shop and vast his business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny forma parte del banco comunal “Visión al Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel.
Ella se dedica a la repostería desde hace 6 años. Realiza sus productos desde su casa, preparando dulces, masas de pizza, picarones, facturitas, alfajores, queques, entre otros. Jenny vende sus productos los días viernes y domingos en un carro que traslada desde su casa al centro de la ciudad. Mientras que los días miércoles, vende sus productos a los trabajadores de un hospital y  la municipalidad de Coronel. Quienes son sus clientes frecuentes.
Su mercadería e ingredientes los compra en distribuidoras y un proveedor llega a su misma casa a vender mercadería. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería al por mayor, específicamente; harina, levadura, margarina, huevos, polvos royal y manjar, ya que así podrá trabajar con mayor tranquilidad, sin que le falten ingredientes para sus productos de repostería.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda realizar, ofrecer y vender sus productos.
Jenny vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 18 años de edad, ambos anhelan estudiar en la Universidad. 
Sus sueños son poder superarse en cuanto a su negocio, para generar mayores ganancias y así gozar de una mejor situación socioeconómica. Además de que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Ella está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Además participa de las reuniones, con la esperanza de superarse.
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Jenny is part of the “Visión al Futuro” communal bank in the city of Coronel.  She’s been making desserts at home for six years and makes candy, pizza dough, picarones, facturitas, alfajores, and cakes among other things.  Jenny sells her products on Fridays and Sundays from a cart that she takes from her home to the city center.  On Wednesdays she sells her products to the workers at a hospital and in Coronel.  They are her steady customers.  She buys her merchandise and ingredients from distributors and a supplier who goes to her home to sell.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients in large quantity, specifically flour, yeast, margarine, eggs, baking powder, and various delicacies.  In this way she can work calmly without worrying about running out of anything.  Her goals are to have a shop where she can make and sell her products.

Jenny lives with her husband and two children, ages 19 and 18, both of want to study at university.

Her dreams are to succeed in her business in order to earn more and enjoy a better financial situation.  She also wants her children to have professional careers.  She is very grateful for the loan through Fondo Esperanza, which will allow her to invest into her business and increase her earnings.  She also attends the meetings in hopes of being more successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre joven de  28 años de edad,  vive con su novia y su pequeña niña de 3 años de edad. Ellos viven en casa de los padres de Daniel, quienes son agricultores y en algunas épocas del año realizan esta labor en la sierra de Cajamarca. La casa donde vive Daniel y su familia se encuentra en la zona rural del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz (un distrito conocido por ser zona de comerciantes) en Chiclayo.

Daniel tiene varios años de experiencia trabajando en el área de transportes. Él cuenta con una mototaxi (la mototaxi es un servicio de transporte público muy común en el Perú, sobretodo en las pequeñas comunidades; consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera  donde se pueden transportar pasajeros), con la cual da un servicio dentro de su distrito.

Sin embargo el crédito que solicita Daniel, no es para invertirlo en su trabajo sino es para mejorar los servicios básicos de su hogar.

Daniel solicita un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, a Edpyme Alternativa, que necesita para realizar las instalaciones de agua y desagüe en su casa.

Daniel siempre ha trabajado con Edpyme Alternativa, comenzando con créditos pequeños que le ayudaron en su  negocio  y ahora éste préstamo le servirá para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel, 28, is a father living with his girlfriend and 3-year-old daughter.  They live in Daniel’s parents’ house.  His parents are farmers and sometimes during the year work in the Cajamarca Mountains.  The house where Daniel and his family live is located in a rural area of José Leonardo Ortiz district in Chiclayo, a district known for having many merchants.

Daniel has several years experience working in transportation.  He has a mototaxi (transportation vehicle that’s very common in Perú, especially in small communities, consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin in the rear in which passengers can be transported) that he uses to provide transportation services in his district.

However, the loan Daniel is asking for isn’t going to be used to invest in his business but, rather, is to improve his home’s basic utilities.

Daniel is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that he needs to install water and sewage services at home.

Daniel has always worked with Edpyme Alternativa starting out with small loans that helped him in his business and now this loan will be useful for him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to install water and sewage utilities at home.

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita is 31 years old and married, with one 5-year-old child.  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  She supports her family by working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day.  

Ramita has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Kiva partner Patan BPW.  She will use the current loan to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Ramita plans to improve her family's economic situation.  She thanks you for your support.  

About pasals, small grocery stores in Nepal:

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario  es una jovencita que vive en un municipio llamada Villa Sebastián Pagador de la provincia de Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba, ella vive solo con su hermano mayor, ellos dos alquilaron unos cuartos y viven solos, Rosario y su hermano mayor, ellos están solos porque sus padres se divorciaron, cuando su mamá se fue a España a trabajar para darles una mejor  situación económica, ahora su mama se encuentra en España y no saben nada de su papa, Rosario trabaja en una estación de servicios como vendedora su trabajo se encuentra a 8 km de su casa y no hay mucha movilidad desde su casa hasta su trabajo, ella necesita del crédito para poder comprarse una motocicleta con la cual pueda llegar a tiempo a su trabajo y regresar a medio día a su casa para poder cocinar y almorzar junto a su hermano.
texts.en:
Rosario is a young woman living in Villa Sebastián Pagador in Cercado Province, Cochabamba Department.  She lives alone with her older brother.  They rented rooms and live alone.  They are on their own because when their parents divorced her mother went to Spain to work to give them a better economic situation.  Now, her mother is in Spain and they don’t know anything about their father.  

Rosario works as a seller at a service station.  Her job is located 8 kilometers from home and there isn’t much public transportation available from home to work.  She needs the loan to buy a motorcycle so that she can get to work on time and come back home at noon to cook and have lunch with her brother.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bodesmus

texts.en:
Bodesmus is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, in Western Kenya. He has been in farming for 5 years, producing and selling eggs and milk to the local market. He is married and has 2 children, aged 6 and 3. His eldest is already attending school.

Bodesmus has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. He will use the funds to purchase poultry birds for 40,000 KES and to build a poultry unit at 20,000 KES. He believes the poultry project will provide for the family and enable him to educate his children.

Bodesmus says animal diseases are the greatest challenge in farming. He remains hopeful that he will be able to service the loan and acquire more.

loans.use: to pay for poultry birds and to construct a poultry unit.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married and has no children.

Cheryl has a store where she sells dried fish. She has been operating this business for 2 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell. Cheryl became a member of PMPC this year.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 55 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Clarita runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy additional items such as soft drinks, noodles etc. to sell in her store.
Clarita has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her variety store for 21 years and also earns an income from e-loading and computer gaming. Clarita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as soft drinks, noodles etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Specoise

texts.en:
Speciose is a 49-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with eight children between the ages of five and 23 years old.  All her children are in school. Her husband works as a driver.

She has been selling beans wholesale for the past 11 years.  This business has enabled her to feed her family and pay for her children’s school fees.  

She needs this loan to buy more beans and stock them for when the market is better in order to maximize her profits.  

With the profits, she will buy different items and turn her store into a general store with more of a variety of goods.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos y también venta de cds de música y de pelicula,ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Urubamba y trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de desayunos y venta de cds de música y películas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar los desayunos como quinua, leche y panes y también para comprar cds al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Carmen belongs to the "Sayhua 3" community bank in the district of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. She is 26 years old, married and has one son. She makes a living selling breakfasts as wells as music and movie CDs at a post in the Urubamba market. She works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. These businesses have helped her make headway for her son. Carmen wants to expand her businesses and is requesting the loan to purchase products to make her breakfasts, such as quinoa, milk and bread, and to also buy CDs at wholesale. She feels happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase products to make breakfasts, such as quinoa, milk and bread, as well as to buy CDs at wholesale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 37-year-old single mother of four children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a boutique in Fort Portal town and it's from this business that she has earned her living for 11 years. Her major challenge has always been untimely debt settlements, which in turn affects her business plans. Her dream is setting up another boutique. Rose needs the loan to buy shirts, trousers, dresses and skirts for resale.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, dresses and skirts for resale.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen de cincuenta años de edad vive con su madre en una localidad muy concurrida de personas, ella posee una sala de belleza y es muy visitada por las personas del lugar, María realiza planchados, pistoleados, tintes, cortes entre otros, su trabajo es de muy buena calidad las personas siempre regresan porque les gusta el servicio que les ofrece también vende productos de belleza en el local y a domicilio ya que tienen varios clientes fijos, claro todo a precios bajos; María del Carmen es una mujer activa siempre dispuesta a trabajar, trabaja sin descansar un sólo día, pues su sostenimiento depende únicamente de esta actividad productiva,  para ella la constancia en el trabajo es el mejor secreto para llegar a los triunfos en la vida, es por eso que quiere permanecer constante y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tintes, cremas, cosméticos, acondicionadores, shampo etc. María del Carmen tiene la esperanza que así podrá llevar a su hogar la seguridad económica que necesitan.
texts.en: María del Carmen is fifty five years old. She lives with her mother in a very busy area. She owns a beauty salon which is frequented by a lot of people in the area. Maria does hair straightening, blow outs, coloring and hair cuts, among other things. Her work is of a very good quality and people always come back because they like the service that she offers. She also sells beauty products in her locale and delivers them to people, since she has a lot of regular customers. Of course, her prices are low. María del Carmen is an active woman who is always willing without resting a single day. Her productive activity is her only support, and for her consistent work is the best secret for triumphing in life. That is why she wants to be consistent and is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to bye dyes, creams, cosmetics, conditioners, shampoo, etc. María del Carmen hopes that in this way she will be able to give her home the financial security they need.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, cosmetics, conditioners, and shampoo.

loans.name: Sunshine

texts.en:
Sunshine is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Sunshine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Sunshine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sunshine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Takku Ligguey 5 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement a pour activité principale le commerce, elles évoluent dans ce domaine depuis plus de 20 ans. Avec ce prêt qui est destiné à l'achat de marchandises, elles vont achetées des produits maraîchers, halieutiques et autres (poissons séchés, choux, carottes) pour les revendre  aux clients. Avec ce crédit, elles veulent faire augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat pour avoir une activité continue
texts.en: The Takku Ligguey 5 Group is made up of saleswomen who have been working in retail for over 20 years. This loan will allow them to stay in business by increasing their purchasing power. They will use the money to restock on food products for resale, including vegetables (cabbages, carrots) and dried fish.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
El señor Aquiles tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Reparto de la ciudad capital y se dedica a prestar los servicios de transporte, posee un Taxi, tiene mas de cuatro años de experiencia con este tipo de negocio, su unidad esta asignada en un Centro Comercial de la ciudad, el cual es visitado diariamente por miles de personas y que son los que le solicitan el servicio, el credito lo utilizara para pintar su unidad ya que la pintura esta en mal estado y la entidad estatal de transportes les obliga a que las unidades esten bien pintadas.
gracias a este negocio puede sostener a su esposa e hijos y cumplir con las obligaciones adquiridas.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 46 years old, lives in the Reparto neighborhood of the capital, and offers transportation services for a living.  He has a taxi and more than four years of experience in this kind of business.  His taxi is assigned to the city's commercial center, which is visited daily by thousands of people who are among those who use his services.  He will use the loan to paint his taxi since the paint is in bad shape and the state transportation authority requires taxis' paint to be in good condition.  

Thanks to this business, he can support his wife and children and fulfill the obligations he has acquired.

loans.use: to buy materials and paint for his vehicle

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a thirty-four-year-old married man with seven school-going children. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Bakari has operated a retail shop for the past six years. His potential clients are his relatives and friends. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 he wants to purchase ten bundles of maize flour and four gallons of cooking oil for his shop. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase ten bundles of maize flour and four gallons of cooking oil for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, para invertirlo en mercadería y  mariscos, ella se decidió por este financiamiento, para poder fortalecer el negocio, y tener disponible efectivo, ella comprara pescado fresco de varias clases, filetes, camarones, ostras, conchas, para ofrecer a la clientela.
La condición de María ha mejorado, ya que con el dinero de los préstamo, compra producto para la venta, que sean frescos para agradar a los clientes y así las ventas sean mejor.
texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan to invest in her small business selling groceries, fish and shellfish.  She decided to request this financing so that she can make her business stronger and have cash available.  Maria will purchase fish, shrimp, oysters and other shellfish to offer to her customers.  Her situation has improved with these loans, and the money from the new loan will allow her to purchase fresh products to offer to her customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish, as well as shrimps and oysters to sell.

loans.name: Bertilio

texts.es:
El señor Bertilio, tiene 51 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 2 hijos,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de San Jose, Comayagua.
Las edades de sus hijos son de 16 y 20 años, su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos.
Don Bertilio desde hace 18 años se dedica a la agricultura, produciendo café y granos básicos (maíz y frijoles). 
Solicito un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes químicos (urea y formula) para abonar la finca de café, comenta que ya ha tenido experiencia trabajado con préstamos  agrícolas y con las ganancias obtenidas ha mejorado su vivienda y su condición de vida familiar.
Considera que la producción a obtener va ser mayor que el año anterior, por lo que espera obtener mayores ingresos, aprovechando los precios altos que se registran a nivel  internacional.
texts.en:
Bertilio, 51, lives in a common law relationship with his wife and has two children; he lives in a rural community in San Jose Municipality, Comayagua.  His children’s ages are 16 and 20 and his wife does domestic chores.  For 18 years Bertilio has been working in farming growing coffee and basic grains (corn and beans).

He requested a loan to buy chemical fertilizers (urea and formula) to fertilize his coffee plants.  He comments that he’s had experience working with agricultural loans and with profits obtained he’s improved his dwelling and his family’s living conditions.

He feels that the harvest he’s to obtain will be larger than last years’ so he expects higher income because of the higher prices currently in force internationally.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 47 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a government employee, but he still helps Remedios to manage their family rice field. Remedios is also engaged in a hog-raising business for additional income. They work hard to lift their children out of poverty. As responsible parents, they want to educate their children so that they are able to find good jobs someday. 

Remedios and her husband would like to expand their rice plantation, but they do not have adequate capital. Therefore, Remedios is asking for additional capital in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay labor costs required to plant rice. They believe that this loan will be a enormous help for them to increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay labor costs required to plant rice

loans.name: Ada Francis

texts.es: Ada Francis tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de materiales de construcción. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer admirable, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad bajo su cargo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde tiene una gran afluencia de clientes, las ganas de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ha hecho que todos los días Ada luche constantemente  por mejorar sus ingresos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro, bloques, entre otros productos que son necesarios para la compra de sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: 38-year-old Ada Francis sells building materials. She has always been an admirable woman, and has two small children in her care. Her business is located in her home, where she receives a large influx of clients. Ada wants to improve the quality of life for her family, which motivates her in the daily struggle to improve their income. This loan will be used to purchase sand, cement, gravel, iron, blocks, and other necessary materials required to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, gravel, iron, blocks, and other necessary materials

loans.name: Estrella Del Mañana (Azogues) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Estrella del Mañana está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades, trabajos que les permiten ayudan a mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares. Viven en la ciudad se Azogues en la provincia de Cañar, patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Angelita, tiene 46 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 21, 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segunda hija trabaja y ayuda económicamente y su ultima hija  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, también cuida de un sobrino desde que tenía los 3 años de edad hoy tiene 15 años y estudia en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María Angelita se dedica a la venta de pinchos (carne en palito), esta actividad la realiza hace 9 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche.
  
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne, salchichas, papas, verduras y pinchos de madera para la elaboración de los pinchos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.  

El señor que está en la foto con chompa ploma y camisa crema es esposo de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Estrella del Mañana” (Star of the Morning) communal bank is comprised of five women and one man.  They work at different business activities.  Their work allows them to help improve the financial situations of their households.  They live in the city of Azogues in the Cañar province, the site of the architectural and cultural heritage of Ecuador. Its people are kind and gentle. They maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

María Angelita is one of the members of this group.  She is 46 years old, divorced, and has three children; ages 24, 21, and 14.  Her first daughter is married and lives independently.  Her second daughter works and helps financially.  Her last daughter goes to the city high school.  She also has been taking care of a nephew since he was three years old.  His is now 15 and goes to high school.  She does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives.

María Angelita sells “pinchos” (meat on a little stick), and she has been doing this for nine years.  She works Mondays through Saturdays from three in the afternoon until eight at night.

This is her first loan in the communal bank, which a friend invited her to join.  She will use the money from the loan to buy meat, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, and small wooden sticks to make the pinchos.

Her dream is to have her own house.

The man in the photo with the gray jacket and cream colored shirt is the husband of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, and small wooden sticks to make pinchos.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 40 years old and is married with two children aged 4 and 15 years old. Juvenal has four years' experience selling various goods like soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. The hours of his business are from 6am to 8.30pm per day each week and he currently employs one person to help him.

Juvenal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as: soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Juvenal would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and to start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as: soap, cooking oil, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 42 years old, married and has three children. With one child in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan for 19000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Wilma has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snacks and other groceries. 

In the future Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Solidario Roma Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Teodora mujer de 62 años de edad, casada, su negocio es la venta de variedades como ropa, perfumes, leche agria, hielo desde hace 10 años, su esposo le ayuda económicamente  para la leche agria y la venta de hielo. Tiene 10 años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo solicita para invertir en comprar pacas de ropa usada, perfumes de varón  y perfumes de mujer. Ana mujer de 52 años de edad su negocio es la venta de cosméticos y Ana Cecilia mujer de 51 años de edad y su negocio es una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
This group consists of three enterprising members. One of them is Teodora, a 62 year old married woman. For the past ten years her business has been selling a variety of things like clothing, perfume, sour milk (similar to yogurt) and ice. Her husband helps her economically with the sour milk and sale of ice. She has been a member of ADIM for 10 years now. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bales of used clothing, cologne for men and perfume for women. 

Ana is 52 years old and sells cosmetics. Ana Cecilia is 51. She has a small store.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing, cologne for men and woman's perfume.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, three of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.
She has been operating a clinic for humans at retail for the last eight years, working six days a week. She also keeps poultry as another source of income.She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 150,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more injections, pain killers, oral dehydrating salts and malarial preventive and curative drugs. Her challenges include seasonality and collecting money from debtors. Her dream is to acquire land and put up premises for both office and residence. She joined MCDT because she did not have enough money to run her clinic.She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buypoultry vaccines

loans.name: Urugero Group

texts.en: URUGERO is a group led by Julienne, who is 29 years old. The group name means “Example” in English. She is married and has one child who has 10 years. She sells clothes and has been doing this business for the past 6 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With this loan, she would like to buy more t-shirts and shorts for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts and shorts for sell.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: JOSE ALEJANDRO: Es un señor luchador de 43 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos menores de edad. Debido a la carencia de un empleo formal y con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos, su esposa desde hace más de 6 años elabora refrescos naturales y reposterías de manera artesanal, él vende de manera ambulante en un triciclo dichos productos.  Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia su propia vivienda, con gran esfuerzo poco a poco han iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de mini falda de concreto. Solicita su primer financiamiento para complementar los materiales de construcción: madera, cemento, bloque y arena; ya que son los ingresos que generan se les ha imposibilitado concluir con la construcción de su vivienda. Actualmente, habita en casa de familiares. Sueña con terminar de construir su casa de concreto (cemento).

loans.use: para complementar los materiales de construcción: madera, cemento, bloque y arena

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Mrs. Isoken I. a 26 years trained hairdresser. She believes in self-reliance and optimists that her business will expand to the extent of employing workers to help her manage it. She is anxiously waiting for the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more driers

loans.name: Poupouvi

texts.en:
Mrs. Poupouvi A. lives in Agbanakin where she has an aluminium products business. A mother of three children, she takes care of six other people and lives with her husband who has been without employment for two years. With nine years in this business, Mrs. Poupouvi A. has acquired a considerable amount of experience. She is well known in her region because of her mobility, since she sells from door to door and is often very tired.

Wanting to settle, she is asking for a loan of $700 to build a hangar where she will display her products. Moreover, this will provide her with the capital which will enable her to regularly buy supplies and to improve her income and precarious living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Poupouvi est domiciliée à Agbanakin où elle mène ses activités de commerce de produits en aluminium. Mère de trois enfants, elle a en charge six autres personnes et vit avec son mari qui est sans emploi depuis deux ans. Avec neuf ans d’ancienneté dans cette activité, Madame A. Poupouvi a acquis une expérience non négligeable en la matière. Reconnue dans toute la localité par sa mobilité, parce qu’elle vend de porte à porte et souvent très fatiguée. Voulant s’installer, elle sollicite un montant de $700 pour construire un hangar sous lequel elle fera son étalage. En plus, elle aura un fond de roulement qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner régulièrement et d’améliorer son revenu et ses conditions de vie précaires.

loans.use: Construction and supply of hangar

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This enterpreneur is a carpenter with a small business in Kirkuk. He works with three employees, and make chairs for sale in the shops. The entrepreneur is 39 years old and has a big family. He is responsible for the care of his old parents and the rent of his house.

He wants to get $1000 to buy a new carpentering machine and hire three additional laborers to work with him on this new machine. He is looking to obtain more loans in the future to develop himself and increase his income.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture,, etc.).

loans.use: To buy new carpentry machinery

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.en:
Savri is 45 years old. She was married and has 5 children. Several years ago her husband died, and Savri was compelled to find a job to support her big family. The hard life conditions made Savriniso stronger and self-reliant.

She started working at the knitting workshop in 1982. Her business is to buy half-finished details of knitted garments and sew them into clothes ready to wear. The profit of her business depends on the number of products she sews to sell in the market. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. The loans from this organization gave her the opportunity to enlarge the number of her products so she could increase the turnover of her working capital. Now she plans to spend her future loan to purchase the next batch of details. She needs $500 to make this purchase.

loans.use: Purchase of knitting details

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell, and to build a shop to store them in

loans.name: Maine Santa

texts.es:
Maine is 35 years old and lives with her two children. She lives in the province of Recuay in the district of Catac-Ancash. She is a member of the Communal Town Bank of Tourism of Catac. Maine sells food and gives room and board to the employees of the National University of Santiago Antunes of Mayol in Catac. Maine earns a substantial amount, but it comes in spurts each month. She uses the loans of Manuela Ramos in order to pay for her grocery expenses. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of $500 (which will be paid in 6 monthly installments) Maine will buy wholesale rice, sugar, noodles, milk, vegetables and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maine tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, vive en la Provincia de Recuay, Distrito de Catac – Ancash. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Villa Turística de Catac, se dedica a la venta de comida, dá pensión a los trabajadores de la UNASAM (Universidad Nacional de Santiago Antunes de Mayol) en Catac, sus ingresos son muy buenos pero el pago es en forma tardía (a un mes) y los prestamos de Manuela Ramos le sirven para que pueda cubrir los gastos de la compra de los productos. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,500.00 soles ($ 500.00 aprox.) el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará Arroz, Azúcar, Fideo, Leche al por mayor, además de Verduras y Papas.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries.

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru:
A. Gafur is 34 years old, married and has a daughter. Since he was young, his hobby was making jewelry, and when he was older he became an apprentice of a professional jeweler. After achieving good results Gafur moved to Russia where he worked for five years. Now he has come back to Tajikistan and wants to open a small shop where he will manufacture and repair rings and other jewelry. Gafur needs sufficient funds to purchase the necessary equipment and decided to turn to MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Алиев Гафур,возраст 34 года женат имеет дочь.С малых лет увлакался производством ювелирных зделий и был в юнности учеником у умелого ювелира.После достяжения хороших результатов он уехал в Россию и проработал там 5 лет,и теперь вернувшись на Родину хочет открыть свой ларек по ремонту и изглтовлению колец и различных изделий.Для этого у него нехватает финансов для приобретения необходимого оборудования.И гафур решил кредитоваться в Микроинвесте.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for jewelry manufacturing.

loans.name: Faau

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Faau is divorced from her husband and she has three children in school. She is responsible for looking after her children by herself. She joined SPBD last year, receiving her first loan of WST$ 750, and started a business. Now she is applying for her second loan in the amount of US$475 and is looking forward to expanding her ice cake (homemade popsicle) business.

Faau sells her ice cakes 7 days a week and earns about US$ 50 daily from from them. That’s helping her to send her children to school and with other family expenses like monthly bills for food, etc., and also allows her to make her loan repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags, Koolaid, and sugar for her popsicles and also cement, sand, timber, and pop corn oil

loans.name: Sutriyani

texts.id:
Sutriyani is a widow who lost her husband due to dengue fever and typhoid. Now, she is working along with her in-laws to support her child and provide for his future. To launch a fried chicken business she needs a loan of about Rp. 800,000 . Her hope is to bring in Rp. 60,000 each day (USD equivalent $6). She will sell in front of store premises that are not occupied during the evenings. Her one-year old child needs a lot of care and he is not currently getting this from his elders in spite of the fact that they are well-intentioned.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva Volunteer.

Sutriyani adalah janda yang ditinggal mati suaminya karena sakit demam berdarah dan tipus. Sekarang ia berusaha bersama kedua orang tuanya untuk membiayai hidup dan masa depan anaknya. Untuk memulai usaha Jual Ayam Gorengnya ini ia memerlukan modal awal sebesar Rp 800.000,00. Harapannya keuntungan dari usaha ini akan sebesar Rp 60.000,00/harinya. Dia berjualan di depan halaman toko yang pada malam harinya tidak dipakai. Anaknya yang baru berumur 1 tahun tentu membutuhkan perhatian yang tidak sedikit baik secara materi maupun kasih sayang dari orang tuanya.

loans.use: To purchase chicken for her fried chicken business

loans.name: Salelavalu Uta Centre - Group 1

texts.en: The village of Salelavalu Uta is known for growing fresh vegetables that are sold in the Salelologa market.  Most of the households in Salelavalu Uta are engaged in vegetable gardening. This group of women who have joined the SPBD program want to improve their businesses by building roadside vegetable stalls in front of their houses. The vegetables they produce will be displayed in these stalls so that passersby can easily stop and make purchases.  This is a good alternative to going back and forth to the Salelologa market, which is about 15 kilometers from the village.  The group has undergone training from SPBD and are now ready to avail the loans for their vegetable stalls.

loans.use: to purchase timber, roofing, cement, vegetable seeds, and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is mother of six children living in Offinsu, Ghana. She earns a living by selling cosmetics, such as body lotion, hair pomade, perfums, and soap. With her earnings, she has been able to send three of her children to trade school so that they will have future profession. Her other children are currently in school.

Ama has applied for a loan of $925 U.S. dollars to purchase more products so she can increase her sales. She hopes to one day be able to rent a store, so she will no longer have to carry the loads on her head. With the additional profits, she hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more body lotions, hair relaxers, soaps, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
It has already been 2 years since we started building our has but we have not been able to finish it because we still need to put in the exterior finishings and flagstone. I am asking for a loan of $1,2000 to lay flagstone which is the most important because the rainy season is coming soon and my family will thus be protected.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.
Tengo ya casi 2 años que empezamos a construir la casa pero no hemos podido terminarla nos esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y losa para ya tener mi casa terminada. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la colocación de la losa que es lo más importante ya que se viene la temporada de lluvias y así  estará protegida en la familia.

loans.use: To lay flagstone in her house

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou G. is single and was born in 1971 in Thies. She lives near the Moda Kane bank in the Senghor sector of Thies. She is requesting this loan for the purpose of bolstering her commercial business. With this loan, she expects to buy bags of chili peppers in Mali that she is going to stock for retail sale to her loyal customers, who are at the central marketplace in Thies.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

FATOU G. EST UNE CELIBATAIRE NEE EN 1971 A THIES .ELLE HABITE PRES DE LA CAISSE DE MODA KANE AU QUARTIER CITE SENGHOR DE THIES .ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES COMMERCIALES .AVEC CE PRET ELLE COMPTE ACHETER DES SACS DE PIMENT AU MALI QU ELLE VA STOCKER POUR LES REVENDRE AU DETAIL A SES CLIENTS FIDELES QUI SONT AU MARCHE CENTRAL DE THIES/

loans.use: Commerce in chili peppers

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is an enterprising woman who, over the years, has been an important source of financial stability for her family. She has provided for the needs of her children, who are now grown men and women. Maria continues her work alongsiD. her husband, who tirelessly provides her with support. Maria’s wish is to increase the merchandise she offers in her shop to better serve her clients. Please help Maria continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Doña María es una mujer emprendedora que con el paso D. los años ha sido parte importante en la estabilidad económica D. su familia, y así, sostener las necesidades D. sus hijos que ahora son hombres y mujeres D. bien. Ella sigue adelante con su trabajo al lado D. su esposo, quien la apoya incansablemente, su deseo es incrementar la mercadería D. su tienda, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Apoya a María a seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty I. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. Beauty buys table water from dealers in bulk and then she supplies the table water to retailers. She has been in this business since 2001. She learned this business from a friend. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more table water for supplies and for sale. She says thank you to all.

loans.use: To buy more table water for distribution to retailers

loans.name: Zalfa's Kina Mama Bora Group

texts.en:
Zalfa is 22 years old and is married. She has been tailoring clothes since 2005. She works everyday from 8am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Zalfa now requests a loan in order to buy more tailoring materials for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Laila.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales. Maria es casada, tiene 55 años y 4 hijos, Maria vive en la comunidad D. La Vega que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D.
