Ayacucho, en donD. tiene una tienda muy surtida D. abarrotes, verduras, carnes, cereales, bebidas, medicamentos básicos. Además los días sábados y domingos venD. comida típica y en algunas oportunidades lleva pedidos a la ciudad D. Ayacucho. También Maria brinda servicios D. preparación D. comida para diferentes eventos.

Maria necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideos. Los sueños D. Maria son construir su casa, implementar una botica para que trabaje su sobrina y dedicarse a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the the Communal Bank Los Trigales. Maria is married, is 55, and has four children. Maria lives in the community of La Vega which is located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho, where she has a store full of fods, vegetables, meets, grains, drinks, and basic medicines. Also on Saturdays and Sundays she sells typical food and on some opportunities she takes orders to the city of Ayacucho. Maria also provides preparation services for food for different events.

Maria needs a loan of 900 sols which will be invested in buying sugar, rice, fideos. Maria's dreams are to builda house, implement a boutique so her niece can work, and dedicating herself to agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 900 soles to buy ingredients

loans.name: Prossy Lutaaya’S Group

texts.en:
Prossy is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children aged between 10 and 3 years. All three children go to school. Prossy doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She is a very responsible member within her group. She resides in a six-room house where she is staying with six people. They have electricity and piped water at home.

The family gets three meals a day. Prossy resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Prossy has a poultry farm at her home. She has at least 350 birds on her farm and she gets 10 trays of eggs daily. She sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail.

Prossy receives an average of 20 customers a day. Her main challenges are poultry diseases and thieves. Prossy works seven days a week and has been with MCDT for nine years, servicing her eighteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to expand her business and aspires to having 800 birds.

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Vun Y., 26, is married and has two young children. Vun Y. and her family live in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She also  takes care of her old mother who stays at home. Vun Y. earns income selling fish at a market, making about US$2.5 of profit per day. Her husband (pictured in the photo) is a fisherman, providing fish for Vun Y. to sell, as well as selling some of the catch to other fish sellers, thus earning about US$4 per day. In a typical month, the family spends US$ 66 on food and US$21 on utilities.
Vun Y. is currently asking for a loan of US$400 from Kiva via Credit MFI, a local partner, to be able to purchase a wooden boat for her husband's fishing business. She believes that the loan will help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of a wooden boat

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is 31 years old. She is a wife and the mother of three kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She loves selling foods and other goods. She has been selling bags of maize for four years to support her family. Maize is one of the favorite cereal foods that supplies carbohydrates in the local diet. She takes delivery of the stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. 

With this loan, she wants to buy bulk maize to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Akua is a member of a community group called Revelation Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to resell

loans.name: Dam Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đàm Thị năm năm nay 23 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Sóc Sơn- Hà Nội. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ thu nhập của hai vợ chồng chị chủ yếy dựa vào kinh doanh bao bì bằng nhựa nhưng sau khi vào tham gia Quỹ tình thương được vay thêm vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua máy tái chế nhựa để tạo hạt nhựa cung cấp cho các nhà sản xuất. Hiện nay công việc của gia đình chị đang ngày càng phát triển và cho thu nhập ổn định ( 5.000.000đ/ tháng). Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho kinh doanh và mua phế liệu về tái chế.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dam Thi is 23 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children at Soc Son District, Ha Noi. She has been a member of TYM Fund since 2008. Before joining the fund, her family's income mainly relied from selling plastic bags. After joining the fund, her family has invested in a plastic recycling machine to supply plastics for local manufacturers. Currently, her growing business brings a stable income of 5,000,000 VND/ month. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in more scrap plastic to recycle.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.
Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Anatolia vende medicina natural que ella misma prepara dependiendo del pedido de sus clientes, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Nery garcía y también a domicilio.
Anatolia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas variadas.
Los sueños de Anatolia son tener una tienda naturista en un local estable, comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Anatolia is a member of the Amor Divino community bank. Anatolia is married, 42 years old and has six children. Anatolia sells natural medicine which she prepares herself at the request of her customers. She sells her medecines from the Nery García market as well as from home. Anatolia needs a loan of 2,000 soles to invest in a variety of herbs. Anatolia dreams of having her own store to sell her natural medecines from a stable location and of buying a plot of land to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of herbs.

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Koch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan consists of 17 people who live in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Each loan member will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Pao K. is a grocer in the local marK.. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children who all attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chan Saroeun, is a fisherman. Although they try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor condition. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Pao K. is asking for a loan for zinc to use as a roof for her house.

loans.use: To purchase zinc to use as a roof for her house.

loans.name: Wofunira Development (C) Group

texts.en: Margaret has had her poultry business for 15 years.  She has 500 broiler chickens and 500 laying chickens.  Broiler chickens are raised for between 2 to 6 months before being sold for food.  Laying chickens can be kept for years, laying eggs that are then sold.  Margaret makes 5000 USH per broiler chicken and 5,000 per tray of eggs that she sells.  She is able to collect 10 trays of eggs each day for her laying chickens.  Margaret sells the majority of her broiler chickens wholesale to restaurants in her area.  She explains that the loans are critical to her success in securing these regular customers.  Margaret is able to keep her chickens for 6 months, unlike others who sell sooner, because she can finance her daily expenses during this time with her loans and her sales from her laying chickens.  The loans also allow her to purchase food in bulk, and that reduces the cost.  Margaret has 10 kids.  Four of these children are still in need of help with school fees; in addition, she is helping with seven grandchildren. She is requesting a loan of 900,000 USH to buy more feed for her 1,000 chickens.

loans.use: Food for the chickens.

loans.name: Leonorilda

texts.es:
Leonorilda  inició el negocio  porqué no quizo seguir estudiando una carrera universitaria y  quería sentirse útil  y no depender de mis padres.
Comenzó el negocio En Marzo de 1995 como sus padres vieron que no deseaba seguir estudiando, su papá le dio dinero para poner su tiendita y de esta manera tener un medio para vivir. 

Desde que inicié le ha ido muy bien ya que fue la primera tiendita que se abrió en la calle y ha ido ganando sus propios clientes aunque ahora tiene más competencia pero de cualquier forma ha podido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000 con este crédito va a comprar abarrotes para surtir mejor su tienda y de esta forma poder darle un mejor servicio a los clientes y no se vayan con la competencia.
texts.en:
Leonorilda started her business because she didn't want to continue studying for a university degree and wanted to feel useful and not depend on her parents. She starter her business in March 1995 as her parents saw she didn't want to keep studying. Her father gave her money to set up a little shop and in this way she had a means to make a living. Since she started, it has gone very well because it was the first store opened on her street and she has gone on to get her own clients. Now there is more competition, but whatever the case she has been able to make headway. She is requesting a loan of MXN $3,000, and with this credit she will purchase groceries to better stock her shop so she will be able to provide a better service to her customers and they don't go to the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A. is 36 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a hardworking farmer. Julieta lives with her family in Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. Her children go to school, so she works hard for their education.

Julieta is involved in the buying and selling of bananas and rice in their place. Through this, she is able to supply the needs of the people in their village in exchange for money. Due to excessive demand from her customers, Julieta plans to improve her business. She's in need of extra income for her to realize her plans.

Julieta now is seeking from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00 for the improvement of her business. Her assessment is that if she could gain a higher income, she will be able to support fully the needs of her family and have extra money to pay their electric bill. Julieta is looking forward to the positive response from the organization.

loans.use: Money will be used to procure additional stock

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maltra

texts.en:
Since 1992, Maltra G. has worked as a seamstress, sewing and selling fabric in Cape Coast.

Maltra is single with three children and has received an education through senior high school. She is responsible for paying rent, school fees and utility bills.

Maltra's loan will be used to purchase more material for sewing and selling and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more material for sewing and selling

loans.name: Faridah Musoke‘S Group

texts.en:
Faridah is the leader of four members of a group. She is 45 years old and married with six children aged between 6 and 23 years, all going to school. She resides in, and owns, a three-roomed house where she lives with six people. She takes care of her aged parents. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Faridah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells sweet bananas in Bwaise. She sells to an average of fifteen people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She buys bananas from her place of work and so doesn’t incur any transportation costs. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business premises, school fees and feeding the family, She has been in this business for the last four years. Her main challenge is the rainy season which stops her customers from coming to her.

Faridah has been with MCDT for over eight years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. She is hoping to build a shop in available space so as to work from her home.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou D., 35 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle veut renforcer sa vente de tissus teintés, de légumes et de mil. Cette activité lui a permis de réaliser l'achat de bétail pour améliorer ses revenus et les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Aissatou D., 35, is married with 4 children for whom she is responsible. She wants to bolster her little business selling hand-dyed cloth, vegetables and millet. This business has allowed her to purchase livestock to improve her income and the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of dyed cloth, vegetables and millet

loans.name: Yensi

texts.es:
Yensi  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Yensi es casada tiene 40 años, tres hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Yensi estudio computación no la ejerció por qué no conseguía quien le de trabajo como practicante, se puso a trabajar, en ventas por muchos años, consiguió un trabajo en wong como impulsadora, y se dedica a vender ropa  por pedidos.    
Desde que Yensi está en Finca aprendió a trabajar y ser responsable con los préstamos.  
Yensi necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de ropa.
El sueño de Yensi es poder alquilar un puesto para venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Yensi is a member of the Las Luciérnagas Community Bank. Yensi is 40, married, and has three children. The children are 15, 13, and 7; and they go to the state school. Yensi studied computers, but she did not work in that field because she could not find anyone to give her work as an intern. She started working in sales, which she has done for many years. She got work as a sales assistant in Wong’s (a supermarket), and she sells clothes by order. Since Yensi has been in Finca she has learned to work and be responsible with the loans. She needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy clothes. Yensi’s dream is to be able to rent a place to sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar is married and is the father of two small children. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Zafar started his own small venture after his relatives suggested he should try his luck as a market vendor. Today Zafar runs a small business selling junior clothing, primarily selling to teens and young people. His vending facility has a very favorable location and offers a large assortment of merchandise, and this attracts many customers.

Zafar believes that financial support from IMON International has helped him boost his sales and grow his business. He would like a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase inventory wholesale. Zafar believes this loan will help him further develop his business and get additional income to improve his family’s living standards.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase working capital to develop the business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokheng Toch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Slab Ta Aon village in Kandal province have formed a village bank. The bank president, selected by the members, is Mrs. Sokheng T.. All the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sokheng T. owns a small grocery store in the village. Since this business is going well, she plans to expand it by seeking a loan to buy more grocery goods for her current business. She hopes to increase her income in order to provide better living conditions for her family. Her husband, Mr. Kham Sokhom, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sokheng T. is 36-years old and the mother of four children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Jorge Adrian

texts.es: Don Jorge T. tiene 54 años de edad, es casado de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Alimentos”, habita junto  a su esposa, el y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 3 años de vender Alimentos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Choatzam Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida

loans.use: Servicos (Venta de alimentos)

loans.name: Wessam

texts.en:
Wessam is 31 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He has owned a gym since 2004. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Wessam first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the necessary machines. He decided to set up the business because his father used to be a trainer and he learned about the business from him.

Wessam has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a running machine for his gym. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his gym by purchasing new machines. In the future, he plans on further improvements.

loans.use: To purchase a running machine for his gym

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora V. is from the village of Libertad Alto,sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Leonora is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 33 years and earns approximately 3,200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Leonora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ma. Antoniette

texts.en:
Ma. Antoniette C. is from the village of Barangay Santiago in Iligan City. She is 28 years old. Ma. Antoniette is separated from spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ma. Antoniette owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Ma. Antoniette has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Antoniette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Antoniette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to buy new items to expand her product offering. Ma. Antoniette is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP that she will use to buy additional products to sell. This will be Ma. Antoniette's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
Natalie C., 31 years old, is a young widow living with her two children, both grade school students, in Maricaban, Pasay City. Natalie owns a general store which she opened two years ago. Life was been hard since her husband passed away, as she now stands as both mother and father to her two children. Thanks to her faith and perseverance, her general store is growing steadily despite stiff competition from other stores in the community. Because of high demand, she has also ventured into prepaid electronic load credits for mobile phones. Business is brisk and she usually makes at least P8,000.00 a month.

Natalie devotes much of her time attending to her business to help her in her grief over the passing of her husband, and she also finds time to attend gatherings for women entrepreneurs organized by the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2007.

She is now applying for a loan in the amount of P10,000.00 to buy more grocery items for her store. Natalie dreams of having a larger grocery store and a house and lot for her and her children. She also hopes to retail rice.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella B. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Estella owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 2,200 PHP a month. In 2005, Estella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Estella is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a mother of three. She is 33 years-old and has been married to her husband Reynaldo for 15 years. Her oldest child is fourteen. She is a farmer and cultivates her land for rice crops. Work at the farm is exhausting but Flordeliza finds a way to find it enjoyable. Being the only source of income, she ensures her farm’s good condition.

Flordeliza joined Kiva partner CEVI in May 2009. She used her previous loan to finance her farm. Now she needs additional capital. She is applying for a loan of Php 8,000 and will use this loan to buy needed farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa A. de 36 años de edad, vive en un sector de escasos servicios básicos ubicado en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de ladrillos y no esta el camino pavimentado, Rosa comenzó hace 10 años atrás con una canasta vendiendo legumbres y frutas recorriendo varios sectores cercanos de su casa, después con sus pocos ingresos y esfuerzo pudo comprar una carreta que le ayudaría a emprender el negocio que le aseguraría el futuro de su familia.

Hace ya 5 años atrás pudo poner en su casa  una tienda pequeña de víveres en la que puede vender lentejas, fréjol, frutas, arroz, etc. Una de las mayores dificultades de Rosa es cuidar las frutas que no se empolven y por ende traer los víveres de distancias lejanas, con la ayuda de su esposo siendo guardia puede mantener a sus dos hijos de 7 y de 9 años de edad que están en escuelas fiscales cercanas a donde viven.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas aceites, jabones, atún, sardinas, para así agrandar mas la tienda, en el futuro quiere surtir la tienda con útiles escolares y así adecuarla mejor a las necesidades de las personas para poder asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa A. is 36. She lives in an area with scant basic services, which is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has a brick house, and the road is not paved. Ten years ago Rosa started selling fruits and vegetables from a basket by traveling to various areas near her house. Later, with her small income and her effort, she was able to buy a cart. The cart would help her establish the business that would assure her family’s future. Five years ago she was able to set up a small grocery store in her house. She sells lentils, kidney beans, fruit, and rice, etc. One of the biggest difficulties Rosa has is taking care of the fruit so that it does not get covered in dust so that she can bring the food from long distances. With help from her husband, a guard, she is able to support her two children. They are seven and nine, and they attend public school near their house. She wants to use the loan to buy more oil, soap, tuna, and sardines to expand her store. In the future she wants to stock her store with school supplies. That way she will better equip it with necessities in order to be able to assure her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more oil, soap, tuna, and sardines

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years old and a married mother with two children. Both of her children are in school. Esther is an enthusiastic business woman who works to provide for her children. She does not relax when it comes to business as she claims it is the only source of income for the family. She is a trader and sells lingerie like bras and panties, assorted soaps and baby diapers, etc. She sells her goods through hawking (that is house-to-house selling). She takes delivery of stock from Accra and sells the stock through hawking in smaller quantities. She wants to use the loan to buy bales of lingerie, soaps, and diapers in bulk to increase her inventory and sales for good income as we celebrate Christmas. She believes this loan would help her save some money to start paying part of the children’s school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie, soaps and diapers

loans.name: Virginia De

texts.es: Virginia tiene 36 años de edad, es casada cuenta con dos hijos, vive en su domicilio propio. Virginia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de desayunos cuenta con amplia experiencia vende desde hace 13 años, es muy conocida en el sector donde es su mercado (pasaje en el centro de la ciudad) y además de preparar sándwiches, el conyugue es maestro albañil contratista se dedica a la construcción. Virginia no tiene competencia es la única persona que vende en el pasaje de la alcaldía. Virginia solicito el crédito para realizar compras de bienes para su hogar. En Agrocapital cuenta con muy buen comportamiento de pagos por lo que la misma tiene crédito paralelo el mismo que se le otorgo para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Virginia is 36 years old, married, has two children and lives in her own home. She makes a living selling all kinds of breakfast items and has 13 years of experience. She is very well known in the area where she sells her products (on a street in the city center) and also prepares sandwiches. Her husband is a construction worker. Virginia does not have any competition since she is the only person who sells products on her street. She is requesting the loan to purchase goods for her home. Kiva partner Agrocapital has a very good history of payments and approved this credit to Virginia to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for her home

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine T. is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Sampaguita Brgy Camugao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and pig-fattening businesses.

Josephine’s husband, Antonio, who is 50 years old, is a policeman.  They have four children between the ages of 4 and 16. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Josephine joined the Kiva field partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in their general store and pig-fattening businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of $315 from her business activities.

Josephine is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP was used to fund operations for her general store and pig-fattening businesses which had a positive impact on both businesses as well as on the family’s living conditions. Now, in her 21st loan cycle, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital. Josephine is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Milagro Jamileth

texts.es:
la sra. Milagro Jamileth R. es una señora de 38 años de edad, esta casada con el señor
Carlos Espinoza Rivera quien labora para la policia nacional.
 
es madre de tres hijos jovenes los cuales estan estudiando.
Milagro  se dedica a la venta de refrescos, agua, jugos y tambien hace golosinas en la glorieta que arrienda en el interior de las instalaciones de la policia Nacional desde hace 2 años.
su trabajo es todos los dias y vende de contado y crédito a los miembros de la policia.

esta solicitando el credito para comprar refrescos, jugos y agua, ya que la zona de San Lorenzo es muy caliente y estos productos se venden bien rapido. las ganancias las necesita para el sustento de su hogar. Su deseo es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Milagro Jamileth R. is 38 years old and is married to Carlos Espinoza Rivera, who works for the National Police. She is the mother of three young children who are in school. Milagro makes a living selling soft drinks, water, juices, and candies at the stand that she has rented inside the National Police installation for the last 2 years. She works every day and sells her products to members of the police force for cash and credit. Milagro is requesting this loan so that she can purchase soft drinks, juices, and water, since the San Lorenzo area has very hot weather and these products sell very quickly. She needs the earnings so that she can maintain her home. Milagro's wish is that her children will be able to graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, juices, and water

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina A. is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Hda. San Ramon, Brgy. Poblacion, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by fruit vending. Agustina’s husband Fortunato, who is 70 years old, has a hog-raising business. Because they have no children, they are saving up their earnings so that they can support themselves in their old age.

Agustina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fruit vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 18,000 from her business activities.

Agustina is a member in good standing. In her previous loan cycle, she only borrowed Php 3,000 to augment her working capital for her fruit vending business,  but now that summer is here and fruit is abundant, she is borrowing (for her 14th loan) the amount of Php 15,000, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her fruit vending business. Agustina is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family--to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for the business

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mr. Mut P. is a 41-year-old married father who currently lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is skilled in cooking food and uses his knowledge to earn a living. He is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties or ceremonies, while his wife is a sewing worker in industry. This couple is blessed with three teenage children who attend school.

Mr. Mut P. is taking out a loan in order to pay to connect electricity for his family's use.

loans.use: To pay for connecting electricity for his family's use

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina E. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Fermina owns a general  alteration and tailoring services business. Fermina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fermina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fermina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fermina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans,  4 enfants et vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Par des relations de voisinages et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et pratiquent le commerce de condiments alimentaires, d’huile de palme (tels Fanta Kanté) et de céréales. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter le volume de leurs achats, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Madame Fanta Kanté fait le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis 8 ans. Elle s’approvisionne en huile de palme en république de Guinée Conakry auprès des grossistes. 
Avec ce prêt Fanta Kanté compte acheter, 250litres d’huile de palme qui sera vendue en gros, en détail et au comptant dans la ville de Bougouni, à une clientèle  composée essentiellement  de femmes. 
Elle compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leur activité.
texts.en:
The women of the Dembagnouma group are all married. They average 28 years of age, have an average of four children and live in nuclear families with their children and husbands. These women live in the Torakabougou district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women met through neighbors and business, and they run businesses buying and selling condiments, palm oil (as is the case for Fanta Kanté) and cereals. With the aim of increasing the volume of their purchases, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their second group loan; all previous loans have been repaid in full. Mrs. Fanta Kanté has been buying and selling palm oil for the past eight years. She gets her supplies of palm oil from wholesalers in the Republic of Guinea. With this loan, Mrs. Kanté is planning on buying 250 liters of palm oil which will be sold wholesale, retail and for cash in the town on Bougouni, to a customer base made up essentially of women. She is planning on making an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, while the other members of the group expect to make a monthly profit of 20,000FCFA each, which will be used for their various activities.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of palm oil

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana H., 35, is making sure that her family members have enough to fulfill their daily needs. She is married to Joseph H., a taxi driver, and the couple is blessed with three children. Ana helps her husband earn a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own ice cream business while selling sticky rice cakes as a sideline.

Ana has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the group's weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow several times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is able to pay her dues consistently because she used her previous loans to expand and improve her ice cream and sticky rice business.

To ensure the success of her business, Ana would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This will be used as added capital for her expanding business so that she can buy ingredients needed to continue production of her sticky rice cakes. She also will invest some of the loan to purchase more quantities of ice cream to replenish her current stock.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she and her family will have a comfortable and well -off life.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for sticky rice cakes

loans.name: Alfred

texts.fr:
Alfred N. est née dans un des districts de la province du nord du Rwanda et pour le moment il habite à Kigali ou il exerce son travail, il est célibataire âgée de 27 ans, ses parents sont restés à Nyaruguru ou ils font des activités d’agricultures et élevage des vaches et des chèvres de  leur fils Alfred son niveau d’étude est primaire.

Son activité est le transport de moto (au lieu de prendre le taxi voiture on peut prendre la moto comme taxi à Kigali et c’est un moyen de transport très rapide pour les gens pressés à Kigali).Son expérience est de 4 ans dans cette activité, il a commencé cette activité en 2006 avec la moto loué journalièrement , jusqu'à ce qu’il entre dans une coopérative des transporteurs des motos , il a pu sollicité un prêt d’ACB, qu’il a déjà soldé et maintenant il a sa propre moto.

Avec ACB il a contracté quatre prêts et soldé trois, avec lesquels il devient économiquement indépendant car il a déjà sa moto. Aujourd’hui il  prend un prêt de quatre cent mille francs Rwandais (400000 FRW) pour réparer sa moto en achetant des pièces de rechange un réservoir, deux pneus, deux amortisseurs, un segment et les frais de retrait du nouveau permit de conduire afin de continuer aisément son travail comme il le dit ses ambitions sont de mieux rembourser son prêt pour que la Banque lui accorde un prêt d’ un gros montant pour acheter un taxi voiture.

Dans l’avenir, il compte avoir sa propre maison car il loue sa maison actuellement, avoir aussi sa propre voiture, ainsi se marier, pour avoir les enfants.
texts.en:
Alfred N. was born in one of the districts of the northern province of Rwanda and for the moment he lives in Kigali, where he has his work. He is single and 27, and his parents remained in Nyaruguru where they are farmers and raise cattle and their son Alfred's goats. Alfred finished primary level in school. His business is motorcycle transport. Instead of taking a car as a taxi, people in a hurry in Kigali take a motorcycle taxi which is a very rapid means of transport. He has four years of experience in this business. He began in 2006, renting a motorcycle on a daily basis. When he joined a motorcycle drivers' cooperative, he was able to ask for an ACB loan which he has already paid off, and now he owns his own motorcycle. With ACB he has entered into four loans and has paid off three, which enabled him to become economically independent, as he already has his own motorcycle. Today he is taking out a loan for 400,000 Rwandan Francs to repair his motorcycle by buying spare parts for it: a tank, two tires, two springs, and a piston ring, and paying the cost of a new driving license so that he can comfortably continue his work. His ambition is to reimburse his loan in a timely manner so that the Bank will accord him a big loan to buy a car to use as a taxi. In the future, he intends to have his own house since he is presently renting, and also have his own car as well as getting married so as to have children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying spare parts to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a retail shop, selling all types of merchandise like sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil.  

She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise, including one bag of sugar, two boxes of soap, three cartons of salt and a jerrycan of cooking oil.   She has been in this business for seven years. She doesn’t have a side business. She works seven days a week. 

Teo buys her merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city center and uses public transport to and from shopping for her merchandise. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Teo aspires to see her business grow larger and to start selling on a wholesale basis only. She joined MCDT to acquire more capital for her business. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

Teo resides in and rents a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: To buy one bag of sugar, two boxes of soap, three cartons of salt and a jerrycan of cooking oil

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith U. is from the city of Sta Cruz Tangub City. She is 47 years old. Edith is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Edith owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Edith has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Edith is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Edith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Mrs. Alma L. is from the barangay (district) of Bongbong, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married to Jimmy L., a tricycle driver.  She is blessed with 2 children who are now school-aged. She is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She also receives support from her husband from his income as a driver. Alma has been involved in this business for 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma, as an active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program, has successfully repaid a loan of 14,900 PHP. She is now requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP (her 5th loan) to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, the children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansions. 

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Armenia

texts.es:
Armenia de 60 años, vive en una zona periurbana del Fortín de Guayaquil, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida en el mercado del Fortín. 

Empezó con el negocio de comida desde hace años cuando se cambio de casa, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar sillas y mesas. Ahora ella tiene un puesto en el mercado del Fortín, vende platos típicos del Ecuador, como arroz con pollo, arroz con menestra etc. 

Ella comprar con el préstamo plátanos, arroz y aceite para hacer mas comidas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa que ahora es de caña para ubicar hay un local de comida.
texts.en:
Armenia, 60, lives in a periurban area of Fortín, Guayaquil. She has a small food vending stand in Fortín’s market. She started with her food business several years ago when she changed her place of residence. Gradually ,with effort, she was able to buy tables and chairs. Now, she has a small stand in Fortín’s market where she sells typical Ecuadorean dishes like chicken with rice, rice with vegetables, etc. She will use the loan to buy bananas, rice and cooking oil to make more meals. In the future she’d like to finish building her house, which is currently made of sugar cane, so that she can install an eatery.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bananas, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj D. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his young son and daughter, aged 7 and 8, attend a local secondary school. His wife is currently unemployed and helps out in her husband's business.

Batdorj operates a used clothing and shoes trading business out of a stall at the local market in his town. He started his business in 2007 and, in this short time, has made a lot of progress in growing his business. His wife works in his stall as a salesperson.

Batdorj used to rent a small stall but, since then, his business has expanded and he rents larger stall. He has many years of business experience and he is a hardworking person who hopes to continue to grow his business.

Batdorj is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to increase his inventory by purchasing more used clothes and shoes from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco A. L., se acaba de casar y quiere construir su propia casa. 
El vive en Hernández de Alajuela, con su  esposa aun en casa de su familia. El se dedica a la producción  de leche y sus derivados, y a pesar de que le va bien asegura que necesita un préstamo de ¢599,000 (quinientos noventa y nueve  mil colones) para  comprar más vacas y así aumentar sus ingresos, esto le permitirá construir su propia casita y seguir ayudando a su familia también.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y agradece a Kiva por pensar en personas humildes y trabajadoras como él.
texts.en:
Francisco A. L. has just gotten married and wants to build his own house. He still lives with his wife in her family's house in Hernández de Alajuela. He earns his living producing milk and dairy products. Although things are going well, he maintains that he needs a loan for 599,000 colones to buy more cows so he can increase his income, which will allow him to build his own little house and continue helping out his family, too. Francisco belongs to the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo [United for Development Local Credit Enterprise], one of EDESA's one hundred member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he is very grateful to Kiva for thinking about humble, hard-working people like him.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Ganado Lechero

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Ii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de mujeres con iniciativa, valores y buenas propuestas de cómo hacer negocio hoy en día, son las mujeres del grupo llamado Micaela Batidas II,  conformado por 8 socias con interés de desarrollo. Este grupo comienza a dar marcha hace ya 2 años y 8 meses, llevan el nombre de Micaela Bastidas II debido a que todas viven en el mismo barrio.
  Mujeres que con esfuerzo y dedicación salen a delante sin importar las adversidades y problemas que vengan en el camino. Un caso particular es el de la señora María Elena Sánchez A. la presidenta del grupo Micaela Bastida II, de 45 años de edad soltera y con un hijo menor de edad, sale adelante cada día que pasa dándole empeño y esmero a la sastrería que tiene como fuente de ingresos. Ella comenzó con este negocio propio a raíz de que no tenía con quien dejar al cuidado a su menor hijo, es así como surge este pequeña sastrería en su casa, que día a día crese cada vez mas. El presente préstamo lo invertirá en mercadería nueva (telas e instrumentos para su negocio). María Elena Sánchez es solo una de las 8 integrantes que con esfuerzo y entusiasmo salen adelante para el bienestar de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
A group of women with initiative, values and good business proposals for today form the Micaela Bastidas II group.  It has 8 members interested in development.  The group started operating 2 years and 8 months ago.  They are called Micaela Bastidas II because they all reside in that same neighborhood. They are women who get ahead through effort and dedication despite adversities and problems that might arise along the way.

A particular case is Mrs. María Elena Sánchez A., group President.  She is 45 years old, single and has a minor son.  She gets ahead every day working hard and with dedication in her tailor shop which is her source of income. She started the business because she didn’t have anyone to leave her son with so she started a shop in her own home which every day grows more.

The current loan will be used to buy new merchandise (fabrics and tools for her business).

María Elena Sánchez is just one of the 8 group members who, through their own efforts and enthusiasm, get ahead seeking their and their families’ wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Mr. Ret R. has been selling jars for more than three years. His wife, Mrs. Thary Hong, raises pigs at home. They live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have been married since 2004. 

In the past, Ret bought jars from his village. Now he operates a business producing jars by himself at his home. He asked for a Kiva loan one time already. He now is requesting another loan for $500 to produce jars for sale.

Mr. Ret R. was not available for the picture so his wife is pictured.

loans.use: To produce jars for sale.

loans.name: Harrison  Mwangi

texts.en:
Harrison is single and hardworking, He joined KADET LTD  through his contacts to existing clients. He is servicing his sixth loan with KADET  and he has repaid the previous loans successfully.


Harrison has no history with any other MFI. He plans to use the loan to add more stock. He has been in the hardware shop business for four years. He will  use the anticipated profits to open another small hardware shop.

Harrison hopes later to be able to own a big hardware store in town.

loans.use: purchase more stock

loans.name: Lhagvadulam

texts.en:
Lhagvadulam C. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four daughters in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter attends university and her three other daughters attend school. Lhagvadulam’s husband is currently unemployed although he works in the construction field during summer months. Lhagvadulam operates a meat and dairy retail business in her town. Since beginning her business in 1997 she has gained significant experience and has been able to build a stable organization. Lhagvadulam is able to pay her daughter's tuition fees. 

Lhagvadulam is a modest person. In the future, she would like to expand her business and own her own workplace but her dream is to work in any company in any occupation. Lhagvadulam is requesting a 395,000 MNT loan to purchase meat at wholesale prices to sell in her retail business.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale meat

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 48 years old.  She is married and has six children between the ages of 4 and 15 years old.  Her husband works as a teacher.  Beatrice has a business selling bedding items such as sheets and pillowcases.  Her store is well-organized and open from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. during the week.  

Beatrice will use this loan to purchase more sheets and other bedding items.  She is a determined woman who hopes to use the profits from this business to reinvest in more stock to improve her store.

loans.use: To purchase more bedding items to sell

loans.name: Badam

texts.en: Badam S. is 57 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His son attends university and works part time while his wife operates a sewing business out of her home. Badam owns his own car and is a taxi driver in the local community. He began his business in 2000 and has gained a lot of business experience over the years. After many years of owning this business, he was able to improve his car several times and his earnings have enabled him to buy a car for his son. By operating his business, he provides for his family and has been improving his family's standard of living. Badam is a hardworking man and says, "All I want is to provide a higher education for my son and help him to live on his own." He is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order for him to repair his car.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs and replace parts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon, living with her parents. She has been working as an esthetician since 2003. She has been involved in the beauty field for 10 years.  Because of her reputation, she has been able to attract a good number of customers who are very satisfied with her work. She cooperates with her family in supporting the household. 

She has obtained a first Kiva loan and today, she is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase merchandise (make-up and other cosmetic products) to be able to satisfy her clients when they ask her to offer them such services.  In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her salon

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro.Los largos días de trabajo que Robert realiza en su chacra, le han servido para obtener los ingresos económicos que necesita para mantenerse, y  todas las mañanas sale en dirección a sus cultivos, para cuidarlos y trabajarlos, ya que sabe que así obtendrá una cosecha de plátanos y café de buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos, fertilizando mejor sus tierras.Este es el segundo préstamo de Robert con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo.Con los mil soles solicitados, contratara peones, para que limpien y trabajen sus tierras, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Robert is 21 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working young man who lives in his own home.  What he most wants is to make a good future for himself.

Robert's long workdays on his farm have helped him to make the income he needs to support himself.  Every morning he goes out in the direction of his crops to care for them and work on them since he knows that this is how he will obtain a good quality banana and coffee harvest.  What Robert most likes about his work is harvesting his land.  He has been in this business for 6 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land.  Over time, he would like to improve the quality of his products, better fertilizing his land.

This is Robert's second loan with MFP and he knows that he must make his repayments on time if he wants to be able to access another loan in the future.  Robert is a very well-liked member of his community bank since he is the youngest in the group.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to hire laborers to weed and work on his land.  In this way, he hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To pay laborers to help him with his crops

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosaly C. H. vive en casa familiar en la que comparte los gastos de servicios. La clienta es madre soltera de la cual percibe una mensualidad por parte del padre de su hijo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa hace un año aproximadamente y no cuenta con un local propio. Realiza dicha labor dado que necesita mas tiempo para el cuidado de su menor hijo.
Requiere del préstamo para invertir mas en su negocio y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y cuenta con capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosaly C. H. lives in her family home, where she shares the expenses. She is a single mother, and receives a monthly contribution from her son's father. She has been working in clothing sales for about one year, but does not have her own locale. She does this work because she needs more time to care for her son. 
She needs this loan to invest more in her business, and achieve a better quality of life for her family.
She has good personal references, and the ability to repay.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABALI sont toutes  mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de fruits et légumes tels les oranges à travers de SITAN M.. 
SITAN M. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 sacs de  d’oranges. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO. La vente est faite en famille et au marché de HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes? au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the SABALI group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age and 2 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a neighborhood in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. This group of women sells fruits and vegetables, such as oranges, as does SITAN M..

SITAN M. intends to use her loan to buy 25 sacks of oranges. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Sikasso. She sells for cash, at her home and at the HAMDALLAYE market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 70'000 (ca US$ 140), to be used to pay for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy oranges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gunjilmaa

texts.en:
Gunjilmaa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children, aged from 7 to 21 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Her son works as a driver at a local company, while both of her daughters attend public school.

She supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, with help from her husband.

She began her business in 2000. Her business has grown so that today she has 2,500,000 Mongollian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She sells clothes imported from Ereen, a border city of China, as well as her handmade coats in her stall.

She has been successfully expanding her business and was able to improve her living conditions. She said "I want to grow my business with this loan and I would like to be able to build my own house in the future." in order to increase her variety of products for spring, she is requesting a loan 1,500,000 MNT.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring.

loans.name: Bubirayho

texts.ru: Нарзуллоева Бубирайхо жительница Яванского района. Ей 60 лет. Вдова, имеет 8 детей. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи, для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Bubirayho N. lives in the Yavan district.  She is 60 years old, a widow and has 8 children.  She has a secondary education.  She is involved in agriculture.  Bubirayho has a large plot of land at her house, where she grows vegetables for sale.  She has been involved in this type of business for 16 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en: Joanes is 33 years old.  He is married and blessed with three children. He runs a motorbike transport business for a living.  He has been operating his business for two years.  He also sells charcoal and does farming for extra income.  He hopes to add ten more motorbikes to his business and employ more people.  He has requested for 20,000 KES to add stock of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es: Nelson se dedica a un taller de elaboración de ventanas de aluminio y vidrio. Tiene más de 7 años en este negocio, inicio esta actividad porque anteriormente el comenzó vendiendo ventanas de madera, con el paso del tiempo aprendió a elaborar las ventanas de vidrio y aluminio, la mayoría de sus clientes saben de los servicios y la calidad de productos que ofrece. Este crédito es para la compra vidrio, marcos, herramientas, entre otras.
texts.en: Nelson has an aluminum and glass window making shop.  He’s been in business for over 7 years.  He started the activity because he used to sell wooden windows and in time learned how to make them out of glass and aluminum.  Most of his customers are aware of the service and quality of products he offers.  This loan is to buy glass, frames and tools, among others.

loans.use: to buy glass, frames and tools, among others.

loans.name: Pilar Jesus

texts.es:
Pilar Jesús nació en la ciudad de Arequipa, Perú. Ella tiene 44 años edad y tiene cinco hijos. Actualmente, Pilar Jesús vive en la ciudad Taray y ella nos cuenta en el mes de febrero del año 2010 en la ciudad de Taray sufrió un desastre natural pues el rio se desbordo y los pobladores perdieron sus negocios y se cayeron sus casas. (Taray se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco y se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola).

Su actividad económica principal de Pilar Jesús es la venta de verduras y frutas como por ejemplo papas, cebolla y otras cosas más.  En esta oportunidad Pilar Jesús requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas como por ejemplo papas, maíz, cebollas, plátanos, duraznos y otras cosas más. 

Pilar Jesús pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el cuarto y medio de año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Pilar Jesús was born in the town of Arequipa, Peru.  She is 44 years old and has four children.  Currently, Pilar Jesús lives in the city of Taray and she tells us that in February 2010, the city of Taray suffered a natural disaster.  The river burst its banks, residents lost their businesses and their houses collapsed.  (Taray is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and is noted for its beautiful landscapes and the fact that its people work in tourism, livestock raising and agriculture).

Pilar Jesús' main business activity is selling fruit and vegetables such as potatoes, onions, etc.  On this occasion, Pilar Jesús needs a loan to buy fruit and vegetables such as potatoes, corn, onions, bananas, peaches, etc.

Pilar Jesús is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Señor de la Agonía de Taray” community bank which has been going for four and a half years and is doing very well.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables such as potatoes, onions, bananas, peaches, etc.

loans.name: Consentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONSENTIDAS” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Lidia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 
 
La señora Lidia indica que hace doce años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de bayetas que viene trabajando hace doce años, empezando el mismo con el primer préstamo.
 
El crédito que sacará ahora es para comprar tela polar, para la elaboración de sus productos. Este material lo adquirirá de la Plaza La Paz (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y lo comercializará en las ferias del deparetamento de La Paz y su mamá lo vende en el departamento de Santa Cruz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The nonprofit, “The Spoiled Ones” will begin their ninth loan with Pro Mujer as a part of Germán Busch’s focal group. The communal bank is made up of ten members and it is run by a board headed by Mrs. Lidia. The businesses that the members of the bank have are all different as they are in the market, production and service fields.

Mrs. Lidia has been a member of a communal bank with Pro Mujer for over twelve years since she was invited by a friend. At present, she makes baize, work that she has being doing for twelve years and started with her first loan.

The loan that Mrs. Lidia needs will be used to buy polar fleece to make her products. This material will be bought at Plaza La Paz (a marketplace in the city of El Alto) she will sell her items in the markets of the La Paz department and her mother will sell them in the Santa Cruz department. Her job allows her to have enough resources to support her family as much as possible since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she enjoys of Pro Mujer she says that she likes the space and the resources.

loans.use: buy polar fleece.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy jewelry and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a 39 year old farmer. She and her husband Bedan are blessed with two children ages 13 and 8. She has been a mixed crop and dairy farmer for the past two years, with an income of Kenya shillings 8,000 per month, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Rahab will use the loan to buy farm manure, seedlings and animal feed. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her dairy farming activities. Her future dreams are to venture into large scale dairy farming and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm manure, seedlings and animal feeds

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Myra has been in this business for 10 years now, and she also earns additional income from food vending.

Myra requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

In the future, Myra would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.She

loans.name: Surn

texts.en:
Surn is a house wife and stays home with her husband.  They have 5 children, one is studying in school and the other 4 are working in the factory earning $2 per day each.  The payment of all expenses in the family is dependent on all of her children. 

Every month, the expenses in the family are about $50.  She would like to request a loan of $600 to repair her house.  The repayment will be the responsibility of all of her children.  She expects to get a good place to stay and will push her last child to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Marta Corina

texts.es:
Marta, es una mujer trabajadora, vive con su esposo, una hija y dos nietos, ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, con este negocio ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, posee mucha clientela, pues da un buen servicio, venD. D. lunes a sábado, este negocio lo heredo D. su madre.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. leña, ya que por la época del invierno necesita comprar y almacenarla para que este seca, pues ella trabaja solamente con leña para el cocimiento D. las tortillas, esta compra le ayudara mucho porque tendrá una buena cantidad hasta que finalice en invierno.  
Su propósito es fortalecer el negocio, trabajar ordenadamente con los préstamos y sacar adelante sus ventas, generando mayores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, a daughter, and two grandchildren. Marta sells tortillas so that her family can get ahead. She has many customers to whom she provides good service. Marta sells from Monday to Saturday. She inherited this business from her mother.

Marta is requesting a loan to buy firewood. During the winter season, she needs to buy and store the wood so that it will remain dry. She only uses wood when cooking the tortillas. This purchase will be a great help because she will have enough wood to last her through the winter.

Her goals are to strengthen her business, work with the loans in an orderly fashion, succeed with her sales, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for cooking tortillas.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has two children. She graduated from senior high school.

For the past five years Efua has sold cooked rice with tomato sauce in Abura. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in feeding, clothing and educating their children.

Efua will use her loan of 730 GHS to purchase bags of rice and the ingredients for her tomato sauce. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and the ingredients for her tomato sauce.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has been selling clothes for the last five years in Makueni town. She is 34 years old and married to Jones. They have two children.
