She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. She has been loaned KES 50,000. She intends to use the loan to add more stock of trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and stock all varieties of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more trousers, blouses, skirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Las Flores 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is a borrower who lives in Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Las Flores 1, 2 & 3, (The Flowers). This group is composed of 15 businesswomen, all dedicated to doing business around their community and in other neighborhoods in the city.

Lourdes and her long-term partner have two children and live in a simple home in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are very overcrowded. Lourdes sells Avon products, showing the catalog, and then her clients order them. She also operates a food stall where she sells 'Riky' (a meatball sandwich, very popular on the north coast of the country). She sells this in the morning and at night. With her business profits she will be able to reinvest in her food stall. She wants to expand the menu.

This is Lourdes’ fourth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve the home life of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, juice and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anne Lyn

texts.en:
Anne Lyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Anne Lyn has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON.
Anne Lyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anne Lyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: La Incansable 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Justina es L. coordinadora del Grupo L. Incansable 1 & 2. Este grupo está compuesto por 10 mujeres dedicadas a las ventas D. ropas, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros, algunos D. modo ambulante y algunos tienen sus negocios en sus casas. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. L. capital D. L. República Dominicana. Su familia está compuesta por 2 hijos y su pareja sentimental, dice que su reto más difícil es establecer su negocio y poder lograr sus metas, una D. elL. es poder ahorrar para comprar un vehículo, en el cual pueda moverse fácilmente para comprar las mercancías D. su negocio. 

Justina está muy emocionada D. recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, el cual invertirá en su fantasia (L. cual es una pequeña tienda, donD. se venD. ropas, cosméticos, prendas, y cosas especialmente para el uso D. L. mujer). Sus planes para el futuro es poder aumentar sus ventas y tener un gran negocio, con muchas variedades D. productos. Su actividad favorita es negociar, por eso se ha dedicado a L. venta, ya que interactúa con sus clientes. Piensa seguir invirtiendo L. mayoría D. sus ganancias en su negocio, mientras ayuda a los ingresos D. su hogar. Sus sueños es tener un negocio prospero y sostenible.
texts.en:
Justina is the coordinator of the 'L. Incansable 1 & 2' group.  This group has ten [female] members whose businesses incluD. selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics.  Some sell their products as street vendors and others have their businesses at home.  The group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic.  Theirs is a poor community to the north of the city.  Justina's family is maD. up of her two children and her partner.  She says that her biggest challenge is establishing her business and achieving her goals.  One of her goals is to save up to buy a vehicle so that she can move about easily to buy merchandise for her business.

Justina is very excited to be receiving her third loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She will invest her loan in her small store where she sells clothes, cosmetics, jewelry and women's personal care products.  Her plans for the future are to increase her sales and to have a good business with a large variety of products.  Her favorite activity is negotiating which is why she decided to work in sales as she gets to interact with her customers.  She plans to continue investing most of her profits back into her business whilst helping contribute towards her household income.  Her dream is to have a thriving and sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Imelda

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza de oficio conserje con mas de seis años, laborando en la misma empresa, tambien tiene su pequeño negocio de tortilla, en casa, quien lo ve un familiar, y que ambas se apoyan ya que ella le da, donde vivir, y asi no depender solo de su salario, ya que como objetivo es hacer las mejoras  a su casa. y es madre soltera.
Esperanza con el credito anterior,iva hacer la construccion de un muro, pero decidio comenzar un cuarto, para poder tener mas espacio, lo que abanzo bastante, y que con este otro financiamiento podra seguir levantando paredes, poner techo, y puertas, si le alcanza, lo que para ella es de gran sastifaccion poder culminar esta obra. 
Hoy en dia, esta dando educacion a su hijo menor, el cual esta en el ultino año de secundaria. Como planes es poder dar una carrera universitaria, a su hijo, asi como poner una venta en su casa, a corto plazo, ya que hay dia, muy cansado en su trabajo, la viajadera en las rutas de tarde. Y que espera contar siempre con Afodenic, para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Esperanza has been working as a janitor for more than six years, for the same company.  She also has a small business making tortillas at home which a family member looks after.  They both support each other.  Esperanza gives her somewhere to live and, in turn, she doesn't have to depend on her salary alone.  Her goal is to make improvements to her home.  Esperanza is a single mother.

Esperanza was going to use her previous loan to build a wall but she decided to start building a room so that she could have more space.  She made a lot of progress and she will use this new loan to continue building the walls, adding a roof and also doors if the money stretches far enough.  She will be very happy to complete this work.

Esperanza is currently providing her youngest son with an education.  He is in his last year of high school.  She plans to be able to send him to university and also plans, in the short term, to set up a store in her home, as there are days when she comes home very tired from work because the trip home is very long.  She hopes that she will always be able to count on Afodenic, so that she can continue growing.

loans.use: to finish building some walls, a roof and a door so that she can complete another room which will give her more space and privacy

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en: Sonnie is 32 years old and lives in Barnersville. She is married to a police officer. They have two children, 1 and11 years old. One is currently in  school, while the younger is look after by his mother. Both children live at home. Sonnie is a high school graduates. For the past five years she has been selling charcoal in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal  for her business. She like the ways people respond to her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Madame

texts.es: Madame, de 21 años es una madre ejemplar. Vive en compañía de Raúl, su esposo desde hace 2 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas: Angeli y Ferchi a las que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito del Tambo. Su esposo hace poco viajó al país de Argentina, donde encontró una mejor oportunidad laboral; ahí confecciona diversas prendas de vestir en un fábrica de ropa. Con su esfuerzo cada mes manda a Madame, dinero para el hogar. Pero como ella es una mujer luchadora; trabaja desde hace algunos años confección de gorros, ponchos, vestidos y demás prendas a base de lana. Con su propias manos elabora de 15 a 20 prendas por mes; donde recibe buenas ganancias por ello, ya que sus clientes le solicitan constantemente. Le gusta lo que realiza, pues se siente realizada; por ello desea en esta campaña navideña incursionar en la venta de ropa en la feria que todos los años se realiza en el Perú. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Madame de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ropa variada para su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Madame, 21, is an exemplary mother. She lives with Raul, her husband of two years. They have two daughters, Angeli y Ferchi, whom they care for in their own house, located in Tambo district.

Madame’s husband recently went to Argentina where he found a better work opportunity; there he makes various kinds of clothing in a clothing factory. Through this endeavor he sends Madame household money every month. However, since she is a hardworking woman, she had been working for several years making caps, ponchos, dresses and other woolen items. With her own hands she makes 15-20 clothing items a month and earns a good income, since her customers continually place orders. She enjoys her work because she feels realized as a person. Moreover, this Christmas season, she wants to venture into the sale of clothing at the holiday fair held every year in Peru.

This will be her second loan with MFP and she awaits their assistance so that she can concretize her plans. She promises to meet all her payments on time As well, she is grateful to be a member of the association because all of the members are responsible and very supportive persons. Upon receiving the loan, she will invest the money in purchasing various clothing items for her new business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en: Sokhun is 42, and married. She resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokhun and her husband are farmers. She also produces traditional baskets to resell. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. Sokhun is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Genese

texts.en: Genese is 41 years old and married with two children. She is from San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. Genese has been farming for over 15 years; she earns 15800 PHP a month. In 2008, Genese joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genese is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Gilberth

texts.es: Gilberth, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está casado y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los materiales para renovar y crear unos nuevos invernaderos. El cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento ya en producción de hortalizas y el quiere incrementar su pequeño proyecto por lo cual le hará otras  camas mas para la siembra y ademas techara una parte más del terreno. El tiene la idea de poder venderle al mercado de la localidad sus productos y además hay unos supermercados de la zona que están interesados en su producto por lo cual es que agrandara su local para mayor producción. El tiene como meta poder lograr vender sus hortalizas a los supermercados interesados y así generar una mejor estabilidad económica y poder irle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gilberth, is 42 years of age, married, and lives with his four children and wife who are his top priority. With the loan he hopes to purchase materials for renovating greenhouses and creating some new greenhouses. He is owner of a small establishment that is already producing garden produce and wishes to expand his small project, and so will make additional seedbeds and add a roof to another part of the land. He has the idea of being able to sell his products at the local market, and furthermore there are some supermarkets in the area that are interested in his products. Thus he will expand his business in order to increase production. 

He has as his goal to sell his produce to interested supermarkets and thus generate greater economic stability, and be able to create a better quality of life for his family in the future. This is his first loan from Fudecosur. He has not taken out any loans previously from state banks; nevertheless, Feducosur has provided him the loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a greenhouse.

loans.name: 06.05.09-Đông Vệ Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Bào operates a retail business selling groceries and a variety of household goods.  She is requesting a loan to purchase groceries to sell.

Bào is 46 years old and she is married with two children.  Bào is the group leader of the 06.05.09-Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.  Bào lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Bào joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women in order to improve her business.  Bào has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  Bào has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Bào faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Bào hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en: Chanthoeurn, 26, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are garment workers. Chanthoeurn is requesting a loan of USD $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build her house. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Benjamin is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Benjamin hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Nada'a

texts.en: Nada'a is a 42 year old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy materials for making traditional food dishes. She plans on opening a shop selling these foods. She would like to help improve her family's economic situation in this way.

loans.use: to buy materials for making traditional foods

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
A senhora Sonia de 31 anos de idade é comerciante, casado mae de 2 filhos  a estudar  vive na casa própria sustenta um sobrinho e uma irma que vive com ela.
Com valor do empréstimo irá comprar sabao, oleo, massas, farinha para reforcar o seu negocio que e feito em casa. 
Tem como projectos e sonhos terminar  a sua obra,  fazer murro de vedacao de seu quintal e adiquirir uma viatura para facilicitar suas deslocacoes para o negocio.
Diz que os principais desafios que tem enfrentado sao os financeiros, e  que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar seu plano.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia is 31 years old, a trader and a married mother of 2 children who are in school. She lives in a house she owns and also supports a nephew and a sister who live with her.

With this loan she will buy soap, oil, pasta and flour to reinforce her business which she carries out from her home.

Her projects are to finish the construction work on her house, build a wall around her garden and buy a vehicle to facilitate her travel to her place of business.
She says her main challenges are financial ones and she will be asking for further loans to carry out her plans.

loans.use: buy soap, oil, pasta and flour to reinforce her business

loans.name: Mawuklo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUKLO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la  même zone. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agossi Sehoué (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 50 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Agossi Sehoué est mariée a un chauffeur du nom de Jules. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Agossi Sehoué vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison Agossi Sehoué vend des balais depuis vingt ans. Agossi Sehoué s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Agossi Sehoué ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAWUKLO sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des balais.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is 43 years old. She is married with eight children between eight and 26 years old. They all go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in this business for the past four years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy items such as sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 100,000 RFW per month.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Osatohanmwen

texts.en: Mrs. Osatohanmwen U. is married with children. She sells beverages to people in her environment. She needs $500 to boost her business in order to meet her customer’s demands.

loans.use: To buy more beverages for sale

loans.name: Ahoissi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ahoissi L. is a homemaker in Agbanakin in the prefecture of Lacs with her family. Widowed as of three years ago, she takes care of seven people, of whom three are in school, two are apprentices, and two are unemployed. At 60 years old, she has as an income-generating activity the production and marketing of coconut oil. It is with the meagre revenue she collects from her business that she is able to meet the household expenses. The development of her business is such that she needs more significant means which she does not currently have.

Today, she needs a loan of $600 which will allow her to reinstall ovens, stock coconuts, and buy cans to package the oil. This reorganization will make her business much more competitive and will allow her to earn a more sizable income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Ahoissi L. est domiciliée à Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs avec sa famille. Veuve depuis trois ans, elle prend en charge sept personnes dont trois scolarisés, deux apprentis et deux désoeuvrés. Avec ses 60 ans d’âge, elle a comme activité génératrice de revenu la production et la commercialisation de l’huile de coco. C’est avec les maigres recettes qu’elle réalise avec cette activité qu’elle supporte les charges de sa famille. L’évolution de son activité est telle qu’elle a besoin de moyens plus importants dont elle ne dispose pas.

Aujourd’hui, elle nécessite un crédit de $600 qui lui permettra de réinstaller les fours, de stocker des noix de coco et d’acheter des bidons pour conditionner l’huile. Cette réorganisation rendra son activité beaucoup plus compétitive et lui fera dégager de revenus importants.

loans.use: To install new ovens, to buy cans, and to stock coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of cereals for his business

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs Hai T. is 41 and lives in Kampong Cham in Cambodia. She sells porridge and other products in her area. Her husband is 45 and is a farmer. Together, they earn 12 dollars a day and have 2 children. 
Mrs Hai T. would like to purchase more products to expand her business. In the future, she would like to sell a wider range of products to meet the needs of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Ebtissam

texts.en:
Ebtissam A. H. sells all kinds of goods. You can find perfumes, make up, deodorants, creams, everything related to cosmetics. To support her family and her 5 children she started her business 3 years ago from home in Ard jalloul. 
Now that the academic year is about to begin she wants to buy clothing for children at school: pants, shirts etc. 1000$ is the amount that can help her expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
After struggling for a long time in Veracruz, Reyna H. and her husband decided to move to Reynosa for a better future for themselves and their four children. With all of their hearts, they wanted to bring up their children to be good people. In the outskirts of the city, Reyna bought used clothing from the USA to resell in Reynosa. She initially bought few articles of clothing by pounds, but after seeing the business was profitable, she started to buy merchandise in bulk. However, she had to attend to her children, which threw her business off-balance.

Currently, she needs more capital to stock up on clothing. She is seeking a loan of $750, which she will repay in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy clothing for the upcoming cold season, which is when she has the most sales. With your help, Reyna will be able to buy the necessary merchandise to stock up and celebrate the Christmas festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de luchar largo tiempo en Veracruz, Reyna H. y su esposo decidieron mudarse a Reynosa para buscar un mejor futuro para ellos y sus cuatro hijos que desean de todo corazón se conviertan en unos hombres de bien. Por la cercanía de la frontera de Reyna comenzó a comprar ropa usada en USA para revenderla en Reynosa, comprando por libras, después en la medida en que el negocio le estaba dando ganancias empezaron a comprar su mercancía en pacas de ropa, sin embargo las necesidades de sus hijos han desequilibrado el negocio.

Hoy en día necesitan más capital para surtir su mercancía que les hace falta por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $750 para pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dinero poder comprar mercancía de temporada ya que muy pronto se acerca el frió y es cuando tienen más venta. Con tu ayuda Reyna podrá comprar lo necesario para surtirse y con ese dinero celebrar unas fiestas navideñas felices.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Aun is a widow with 3 children - two sons and one daughter. She began her business of selling household tools in 2003. All of her children are working; one daughter works in a garment factory, and two sons are construction workers. She expects that with the existing business and receiving a loan from MAXIMA, their living conditions will be better in the future.

She is borrowing money from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of US$1,000. She will use this loan to purchase household tools for expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase household tools for reselling in her village

loans.name: Hadija's Group

texts.en: We are Hadija H., Sarah S., Habiba N., Rehema M., Suzan N., Zakaria N., and Mary S., the seven members who make up Msanvu Group. We are organized, up-and-coming entrepreneurs who are engaged in various businesses to earn a living. Our businesses include grocery stores, small restaurants, and kiosks. We are each in need of a loan of US$ 400, a total of US$ 2800, to expand our businesses so that our families may flourish.

loans.use: expand our individual businesses so that our families may prosper

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en: Lilis, 40, is the mother of 3 children. Her husband, U., is a laborer who has only irregular income, so to support her family's needs she opened a food stall in front of her house where she sells noodles, Indonesian salad called 'gado-gado', beverages, etc., earning about $18 a day. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of $125 to add to her business capital so she will be able to increase her income to provide tuition for her children. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Munnawer's Group

texts.en:
My name is Munnawer B. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of seven children, of which three are married. I work in a public institute and one of my sons is a rickshaw driver. He needs a loan to fix his rickshaw and purchase new tires for it.

My other group members would use the loan as follows: Shahnaz A. wants to purchase wood; Maqboola B. sells cloth and would like to purchase additional inventory. I volunteered to become their leader so that I could help them get loans for their businesses.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw and purchase tires

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is a 65-year-old married mother of six and grandmother of five living in Offinsu, Ghana. For most of her life, Rose has farmed the land, but now her age and health prevents her from performing such hard labor. That's why she has applied for a loan of $725 U.S. dollars to purchase groceries, such as fresh yams, to sell. She also wants to rent a permanent store to protect her products from theft.

Rose is member of a group called St. Anthony. The group guarantees that each member pays off her loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams, tin fish, carton of tomatoes, dried mud fish, onions, crates of eggs,etc.

loans.name: Hilda Maurina

texts.es:
Hilda has been a member of the Pure Life Communal Bank for three years. What she likes most about her communal bank is the training she receives.

Hilda is 45-years-old, married, and has four children. On Sundays, Hilda sells typical regional dishes in her home and sells beverages during the rest of the week. Hilda and her husband also travel to different regional fairs where they buy dairy cattle and later sell them in the city of Lima.

Hilda needs a $900 loan to purchase of cattle, beer, sugar, and rice.

Hilda's dreams are to have a big general store, to build a house, and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Amani R., Kiva volunteer.

Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida, hace 3 años. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que recibe.

Hilda es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Hilda vende comida típica en su casa solo los días domingos y los demás días venden bebidas. Además Hilda junto a su esposo viajan a las diferentes ferias de la región donde compran ganado vacuno y luego lo comercializan en la ciudad de Lima.

Hilda necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado vacuno, cerveza, azúcar y arroz.

Los sueños de Hilda son tener una bodega grande, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Hilda needs a $900 loan to purchase cattle, beer, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia is asking for a 4th refinancing to invest in improving her home (constructing a kitchen). She has worked as an elementary teacher for 16 years at the Rafaela Herrera school in the Fonseca neighborhood located 30 km from Nueva Guinea.

Herminia is a hardworking, honest, and very responsible woman. She has 3 children, the oldest is 17 and in his 5th year of secondary school, another is 15 and in 3rd year of secondary school and the youngest child is 11 years old and in 6th grade of primary. In spite of being a single mother this teacher has enabled her children to be successful. In addition Herminia is in charge of her mother’s care. Her dream is that her children continue studying, have a beautiful home and steady work in order to help her family, as they are a family of scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Herminia está solicitando un 4to refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construccón de una cocina), desde hace 16 años trabaja como docente de educación primaria de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera en colonia la Fonseca a 30 km de Nueva Guinea.

La profesora Herninia es una mujer trabajadora honesta y muy responsable, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 17 años estudia su quinto año de educación secundaria, otra 14 años estudia su 3er año de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 11 años estudia 6to grado, a pesar que es madre soltera esta docente ha sacado a sus hijos adelante, además doña Herminia se encarga del cuido de su mamá, su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, tener una vivienda mas bonita y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos.

loans.use: Construct a kitchen in her home

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is a merchant who sells chicharrón (dried pork skin). She wanders the streets, as she does not have a permanent position. She is married and has five children. All of her children have their own businesses and expenses; they unfortunately cannot help their parents with their humble economic situation. Her home is located in the area Irpavi II, and she strives to pay rent without delay.

Irene is an enthusiastic person and consequently has access to credit. Moreover, this is the fifth time she is asking Impro for credit (and the second time with Kiva). The amount will be used to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Irene se dedica al comercio, venD. chicharrón D. cuero D. chancho seco (deambula por las calles ya que no tiene un puesto fijo), ella es casada, tiene 5 hijos (pero todos cuentan con negocios propios, tienen sus propios gastos y desafortunadamente no pueden ayudar a sus padres por su humilD. situación económica). Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. Irpavi II (se esfuerza por pagar los alquileres sin demorarse)

Irene es un persona entusiasta, por eso tuvo acceso al crédito, además, es la quinta vez que solicita crédito en Impro (en Kiva es la segunda). El monto será destinado para comprar mercadería.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for dried pork skin

loans.name: Khodr

texts.en:
Khodr is a 30-year-old single man. He lives in Saida, in the southern part of Lebanon. For his living, Khodr sells coffee and tea.

One year ago, Khodr requested a loan from Al Majmoua for $700 to build a room next to his parents' home. He successfully repaid his debt on-time. Khodr recently got engaged and needs $1000 to prepare his wedding. Khodr is a serious entrepreneur and we have no problem financing him so he can offer a beautiful ceremony for his bride.

loans.use: To pay for his wedding

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en:
Fatimon A. is 26-years-old and married with one child. The family lives in Illogbo, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells beverages and provisions in her community. Her products include toothpaste, tomatoes paste, butter, milk and sugar. She started this business in 2005. Fatimon is hardworking; she opens her business at 8AM and closes for the day by 6:30PM. She loves her business and family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more beverages and provisions for resale. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and beverages for resale

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo en el Barrio Constitución de la ciudad de Caaguazú, donde viven muchas personas con deseo de progresar y ser útiles a sus familias. La Sra. María E. es una de ellas, ella tiene 24 años, esta acompañada con el Sr. Carlos González tiene 2 Hijos, y es la Directora General del Grupo “KUÑA KATUPYRY”, quien fue elegida por el grupo de señoras por ser una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, dinámica y muy activa.

El grupo es formado por mujeres sencillas que tienen una alegría contagiante, demuestran que pueden llegar a lo que quieren porque conocen lo que es el trabajo, saben la responsabilidad que asumieron como grupo; que es una oportunidad de cambio en sus vidas y de sus familiares, una forma de progreso que se les da a través el crédito-ahorro y unirse para trabajar en grupo por un objetivo único, la de servir a sus familias a través del trabajo conjunto.

Las integrantes con la especificación de sus actividades se detalla a continuación: María E.. Vendedora Ambulante

Mercedes M.. Vendedora Ambulante de frutas.compra de frutas

Ana P.. Almacén

Evangélista O.. Macatera

Felicia V..Macatera

Hilaría Brítez. Macatera

-Carmen O..Macatera

-Genara Peredes.Comedor en el Mercado

-Zunilda Cáceres. Almacén

-Dora V..Almacén

-Vilma L..Vendedora Ambulante

-María C..Vendedora ambulante

-Tividad Veláquez. Vendedora Ambulante

-María Monzón. Venta de ropas

-Antonia F.. Venta de comidas
texts.en:
This group was formed in the Constitution neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú, where lots of people who want progress and to be useful to their families live. Sra. María E. is one of these people. She is 24 years old, accompanied by Sr. Carlos González, and has two children. She is the director of the group "KUÑA KATUPYRY." She was elected by the group of women because she is very hard-working, responsible, dynamic and active. This group was formed by women who have a contagious enthusiasm, show that they can get to their goals because they know how to work hard, and know the responsibilities involved in forming a group. They know this is their opportunity to change their lives and the lives of their families, something they will do through loans and savings and by uniting for a common goal. The members of the group with their specific activities are as follows: - María E.. Peddler. - Mercedes M.. Fruit peddler. - Ana P.. Warehouse. - Evangélista O.. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Felicia V.. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Hilaría Brítez. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Carmen O.. Vegetable and clothing sales. - Genara Peredes. Food stand in the market. - Zunilda Cáceres. Warehouse. - Dora V.. Warehouse. - Vilma L.. Peddler. - María C.. Peddler. - Tividad Veláquez. Peddler. - María Monzón. Clothing sales. - Antonia F.. Food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fruits, vegetables, bread, ropes, household goods, canned goods, soda, meat, etc.

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en: Mrs. Thoem N. is a villager in On Doung Thmor village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhem Sak, are farmers and they do not earn enough money to make a good living. Thus, Mrs. Thoem N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy zinc to repair her house and she also wants to buy a cow to feed. She hopes to increase her family’s income. She is 32-years-old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other three children are too young. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy zinc to repair her house and to buy a cow

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Dul K., 20, is married and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has been raising pigs to earn a living, making US$4 per day, while her husband, growing rice crops and selling them to the local market, earns approximately US$4.5 per day. 
Currently, Dul K. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a generator to start a battery charging business. She believes that the new business will provide her family with additional income.

loans.use: Purchase of a generator

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Alondras Village Bank. She is 54 and married with six children, most of who are now adults. Isabel is an artisan; she does embroidery and sews costumes and clothing. She used to have a store in a large crafts market in Ayacucho, but it was no longer profitable, so now she sells her work from home. She has been doing embroidery since she was 15 years old, and today she has many regular clients and receives orders from Lima. She pays seven workers to embroider blouses that she sews. She sells long-sleeved blouses for 25 soles and short-sleeved blouses for 20 soles; she earns 13.50 soles in profits per blouse. She is currently sewing costumes for a local dance troupe.

Isabel is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles to buy more fabric and to pay her embroiderers. Her goal for the future is to open a store in central Ayacucho to sell clothing and rent out the costumes she makes. She thinks this could be a very profitable business, because just one rental covers the cost of making the costumes, so any future rental is 100% profit.

loans.use: Buy fabric and pay embroiderers

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en: Ulviyya M. is a 22-year-old woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the small village of Saatli, Azerbaijan. Three years ago, Ulviyya`s husband offered to help her start a business, since it was hard for a woman with a small child to find any job. Ulviyya accepted his offer and the same day went to the local livestock bazaar to purchase her first head of cattle. Since she is at home all day with her child, it is easy to look after calves and she really enjoys it. That’s why she has applied for a loan to purchase more calves and increase her income. She wants to expand her business in order to provide the best education possible for her lovely daughter. Ulviyya and her family thank you for your help.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Yuly Evelin

texts.es:
Evelyn es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela.
Evelyn es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, Evelyn vende cosméticos por catalogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Evelyn estudia sistemas en un instituto y tiene una moto que alquila.
Evelyn necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una mototaxi.
Los sueños de Evelyn son terminar su carrera, trabajar y mantener a sus padres.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the Marcela Community Bank. She is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents. She sells cosmetics via catalog that she offers on credit to friends and relatives. Evelyn studies systems at a local institute and has a motorcycle that she rents. She is requesting a loan of 750 soles, which she plans to use as part of her payment for her motortaxi service. Her dreams are to finish her degree, work and provide for her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part of payment for her motortaxi

loans.name: Jonervin

texts.en:
“Working hard is the best solution in order to earn more for the welfare of your family” says Jonervin A., 24 years old and a village operator from San Manuel, Isabela.  He is married to Clarita, his business partner.  The couple is quite sad because they do not have a child to inspire them more.  

Their sari-sari store (community-based store) is situated in front of their house. They earn a weekly income of PHP 1,800 that they budget for their immediate needs and a rolling capital.  Jonervin wants to improve his business and for him to fulfill his plans, he is asking for financial assistance of PHP 5,000.00.  He will use the capital to purchase more inventory for the store.  

He hopes to have a stable living with his wife through his community store. His business investment will be a big help in providing a better life for his future children, said Jonervin.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Uldosh

texts.ru: Худойкулов Юлдош житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Образование средне-техническое. Но зарабатывает деньги путем животноводства. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить дополнительного бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Uldosh H. lives in Tursun-Zoda. He is 39 years old, is married and has five children. Uldosh has a secondary-technical education, but he earns money via raising livestock. He raises cattle. Uldosh plans to take out a loan to purchase an additional calf. He will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is twenty–three years old. She is single and lives independently. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Afia says it is important for her to work hard to make income to support herself and to be financially prepared before she enters into marriage. Afia is a trader. She deals in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She procures the goods from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in her community. She owns a shop by the roadside from which she sells her goods.

Afia has been in this business for just one year and wants a loan to procure more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married. She owns a small business selling children’s clothing in a local mall in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. The favorable location of Angela’s venture adds to her good sales rates. Angela has been in the trade for five years. Presently, she has about 60,000 Hryvnia in merchandise. Her income amounts to 6,000 Hryvnia.

Some of the major characteristics of Angela’s business are stability and consistency. Partly this is due to financial assistance she received in previous years. This time Angela is requesting a loan of 11,000 Hryvnia to stock a new vending location she has just opened. Angela is very optimistic and cheerful which has helped her fulfill her dreams in the past. We believe these characteristics will help her implement her plans now, too.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes
Martina es casada tiene 35 años, dos hijos de 11 y 3 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Martina estudio cosmetología, trabajo por mucho tiempo en una peluquería donde aprendió sobre el negocio,  con los ahorros juntados decidió abrir una peluquería que lleva por nombre “Martica” 
Martina necesita  un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de sillones y líquidos para la peluquería.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió  a invertir, ha podido implementar su peluquería, aprendió a ser solidaria.
El sueño de Martina es  terminar su casa
texts.en:
Martina is a member of the "Mujeres Independientes" (Independent Women) Community Bank. She is married, is 35 years old and has two children who are 11 and three years old and who are in public school. Martina studied cosmetology. She worked for a long time in a salon where she learned about the business. With her savings, she decided to open a salon that carries the name "Martica." Martina needs a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of chairs and liquids for the salon. Since joining FINCA, she has learned how to invest. She has been able to start her salon and learned to be supportive. Martina's dream is to finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Martina needs a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of chairs and liquids for the salon.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 33 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Jihad has owned an accessory shop since 1991. He sells perfums, nail varnish and other beauty products. Jihad requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the summer season. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan. 
Jihad is special in his work because he sells a big variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Jihad decided on doing his business because he likes trading. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Jihad will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N. is married and has four dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. His wife is a petty trader who earns a little for a living.

Joseph sells small fishing accessories to fisherman in Abotoase near Hohoe. Joseph uses all his income in the payment of his dependents’ school fees and other utility bills of the entire family.

Joseph will use the loan to purchase a fishing net and a bigger boat to go fishing. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and a bigger boat to go fishing

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia  es socia del Bancomunal 24 de Octubre.  
Sonia es casada tiene 37 años, un hijo de  10 años que estudia en al escuela estatal.
Sonia   estudio psicología en la universidad termino su carrera cuando empezó a trabajar quedo embarazada, cuando nació su hija dejo de trabajar y se dedico a cuidarla , puso en su casa una librería y sus vecinos le pedían cosas de bodega y ella empezó comprando cosas   comestibles para la  bodega, su pequeña hija también le ayuda.      
Desde que Sonia esta en finca  ha crecido su capital se ha duplicado, tuvo que mandar a romper una pared de su casa para ampliar su negocio.  
 Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para  la comprar de cerveza  y gaseosa para su bodega 
El sueño de Sonia es  crecer más en el negocio y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a partner at the October 24th Village Bank. Sonia is married, 37 years old, and has a 10-year-old daughter who studies at the state school. Sonia studied psychology at a university and finished her degree. When she began to work she got pregnant. When her daughter was born she stopped working in order to take care of her and she put a bookstore in her house. Her neighbors asked her for grocery items so she began buying edible goods for her shop. Her little daughter also helps her with the work. Since Sonia has been with FINCA she has doubled her capital. She had to order for a wall to be torn down in her house to make her shop bigger. Sonia needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase beer and sodas for her grocery store. Sonia’s dream is to grow her business and to finish the construction on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer and sodas for grocery shop

loans.name: Саломат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ёкубова Саломат 1960 года рождения, замужем имеет четверых детей. Саломат занимается торговлей продуктами питание. Она закупает товар на оптовых рынках города Худжанда и возит продавать в районы области. В этом ей помогает муж. Торговля идет успешно так как сейчас сезон свадеб. Поэтому она хочет, разнообразить свой ассортимент. На запрашиваемый займ Саломат закупит печенье и разных видов конфет.

loans.use: на закупку печенье, разных видов конфет

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta H. makes a living selling bread and charcoal, and has applied for a loan to buy fish to sell. She is 47 years old and married. Her husband is a clerk in the United Nation Developement Programe (UNDP), Southern Sudan, Juba HQs. They have three children who attend school St.Bakhita Primary School, Kator Parish.  With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to build a hotel and a retail shop  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Leonarda es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Leonarda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos, carne, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Leonarda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y queso.
Los sueños de Leonarda son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar mas sus negocios.

loans.use: Para la compra de cereales y queso.

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en: Yinka is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She has a salon where she styles hair for her customers and she also sells hair extensions within her community in Warri, Delta State. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise R. B. is 29, single, and she takes care of two children aged between 7 and 13. She lives in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she has operated her business since 2000. She opens her store every day from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Before starting this clothes business, she was a full-time housewife and could not provide all the needs of her family.

With this new loan requested from Vision Finance Company, she hopes to earn more profit which will help her to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell. Diana is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia M. G., reside en el pueblo de Santiago Nonualco del departamento de La Paz. Marta es madre soltera, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos menores de edad y estudiantes. El no haber cursado sus estudios hacen para Marta una tarea mas difícil de buscar empleo, ya que El Salvador es un país muy pequeño al igual que sus oportunidades de empleo, es por ello que la única alternativa que Marta visualizo para sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyar a su madre, fue iniciar su propio negocio una venta de comida y pupusas,  por el cual ahora solicita de un crédito que le permita aumentar su producción por medio de insumos, que comprara gracias a tu préstamo.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia M. G. lives in the town of Santiago Nonualco in the La Paz department. Marta, 48, is a single mother. She lives with her mother and her two minor children. Her children go to school. Marta has a difficult time looking for work because she does not have an education. El Salvador is a very small country, and its employment opportunities are also small. That is why the only alternative that Marta saw to get her children ahead and support her mother was to start her own business. She sells food and “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables). She is now asking for a loan that will allow her to increase her production. She will buy supplies thanks to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is 62 years old, is married, and has ten adult children.

Nena owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Nena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Nena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 39 years old and married with five children aged between10 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three roomed house where she is staying with eight people. Harriet takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs to and from shopping in Nakawa market to her retails shop in Naguru Godown Zone. She rents her business premise sat 100000/= per monthly. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala  She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 40 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children and rent for her business premise. Her major business challenges are defaulters and rainy season which hinders her ability to to reach her customers. She has been in this business for eighteen years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her seventeenth loan, working with the same group mates. Harriet joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop like boxes of soap, cartons of salt, bags of sugar and cooking oil. She is aspiring of seeing her business grower bigger and start selling on wholesale only and also getting a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of salt, bags of sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Aurora Cuarite necesita el préstamo para comprar una máquina de costura ya que ella sabe confeccionar pantalones,  Betty H. necesita comprar lana para tejer buzos, chompas o el pedido que tenga, Marta P. cuenta con una máquina de tejer y necesita comprar lana. Como se describe la mayoría de las integrantes del grupo Milagrosa se dedican a la producción de ropa todas son madres de familia con un promedio de 3 a 4 hijos. 
El nombre del grupo es porque todas ellas viven alrededor de la Iglesia que llama Virgen Milagrosa, de la zona Pedro Domingo.
texts.en:
Aurora Cuarite needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, now that she knows how to make pants. Betty H. needs to buy material to sew sweatshirts, sweaters, or other requests she may receive. Marta P. has her own sewing machine but needs wool.

As described here, the majority of the members of the Miraculous Group are dedicated to the production of clothing. They are all mothers of families averaging 3 to 4 children.

The group name results from the fact that they all live around the church named Miraculous Virgin in the Pedro Domingo Zone.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SEWING MACHINES AND PRIME MATERIALS FOR SEWING GARMENTS TO SELL

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita K. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Shiva Dev K., is an electrician. They have two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 9. Her older son is studying in grade 8 and her younger son is studying in grade 5.

Mrs. Sarita K. is a farmer. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening.

Sarita is requesting a 20,000 NPR loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kakounding

texts.fr: Kankounding est une femme de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KADIOR depuis 8 ans et a été 8 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêts. Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité de vente de bouillie de mil, une bouillie qu'elle sert sous forme de repas tous les soirs. Avec ses bénéfices elle assure partiellement la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Kakounding, 51, is married and the mother of 3 children who are all enrolled in school. She has been a member of the Village Bank of KADIOR for 8 years and has received 8 consecutive loans. Her goal is to expand her little business selling millet porridge, which she serves up at dinnertime every evening. With her earnings, she helps support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en: Sleiman is a 40-year-old married man and has 3 children. He has owned a small shop in his village for the past 8 years. He sells a limited number of products and is concerned about satisfying his clients needs. He is raising his three unemployed children on his own and works hard to make a good income. Today, Sleiman is requesting a loan of $1,200 to expand his market inventory and present a wider variety of products to attract more clients.

loans.use: To expand his market inventory and present a wider variety of products

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 31-year-old father of four children who are in school.  He had a shop, which he operated for one year before he started a water kiosk. He is employed with KK security services in Nairobi, where he earns 12,000 Kenyan shillings per month while his wife assists him in his business.  

He has become an active member of Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, by saving money in the MFI (microfinance institution). He plans to buy a water tank at 40,000 shillings and a water booster at 10,000 shillings; hence, he has requested a loan of 50,000 shillings. He hopes to become financially stable by making more savings and generating more income. His dream is to have his own company in the future.

loans.use: Buy water tank and water booster

loans.name: Víctor Antonio

texts.es: En la comarca el caimito municipio de somotillo el señor Víctor Antonio G. Días, se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias dentro de las cuales destaca la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino, aviar y equino también establece cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo con los cuales mantiene a su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su esposa y dos niños los que tienen 4 y 6 años respectivamente, el señor Víctor Antonio G. D.realiza jornadas de trabajo de 6 a 4 de la tarde dentro de las principales actividades que ejecuta esta el pastoreo de su ganado y las actividades de sus cultivos, ha tenido tres créditos con los cuales ha mejorado su sistema productivo ya que realizo la compra de un molino de quebrar maíz con el cual esta diversificando sus ingresos y mejorando su estilo de vida y la mantención de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Antonio G. Días has spent most of his life as a farmer and cattleman in El Caimito, Somotillo. He raises cattle, pigs, fowl and horses; he also farms corn, sesame and sorghum with which he supports his family, which is composed of his wife and two children, who are 4 and 6 years of age respectively. Víctor Antonio G. D.s work day is from 6am to 4pm. Among his main chores is taking the cattle to forage and caring for his crops. He has had 3 loans that have improved his production system in that he bought a mill to grind corn which is diversifying his source of income and improved his life style and support of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Khet

texts.en:
Khet S. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has a fifteen-year-old child.

S. is engaged in growing rice on her own plot of farmland, earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover her family expenses. Her husband buys bananas from the local farmers to stock for sale, earning a gross income of USD 13.30 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses.

S. is requesting a loan of 900 USD to buy bananas to stock for sale when the price is good. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her husband's business

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en: Miraluna M., is from the village of Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Miraluna owns and operates a general store. This is not the only means for generating revenue, as the main source of income for the family comes primarily from the income of her husband who is a fisherman. Miraluna has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Miraluna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Miraluna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa D. R. is from the village of Pagalungan, Wao Lanao D. Sur. She is forty-eight years old. Nimfa is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Nimfa owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dry goods, including children's toys and other items, in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Nimfa's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Perlina

texts.en:
Perlina S., 55, is making sure that her family is provided with enough for their daily needs. Married to Jess S., a chef, they are blessed with five children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn S. that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own food stall for quite some time now.

Perlina S. has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her food business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy the raw ingredients needed to continue the production of her recipes, mainly her breakfast fare.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow S. that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed to continue the production of her recipes, mainly her breakfast fare

loans.name: Bakadde Tusuubira Development Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
He is a past master with a decade’s experience in lucrative general merchandise retail businesses in both Kirindi and Kyampisi. As is the case with any competitive business environment, 53 year old M. Clement cites his relatively low prices as his winning stock in trade. In a week, Clement says he makes profits to the tune of 50,000.

This married father of eight children has evidently worked hard to take firm root as seen in the array of goods he has on offer in contrast to what his competitors have. His two flourishing retail outlets have boosted his family’s welfare and his children, too, have been benefactors.

Clement’s future plans are to establish more retail shops within his district. And the first step towards achieving this, he says, is with the acquisition of this loan. With this loan, he says he wants to buy more retail items in high favor such as salt, sugar, soap, candles, bread, milk, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items such as sugar, soap, salt, etc.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen D. is currently in the business of selling fish and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell.  Hellen is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed as a cleaner at a shopping center for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 4 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with five daughters and three sons; two are adults while six attend school. She has been operating her tailoring business for over twenty years, selling in a shop and to her neighbors. With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of materials and sewing thread. 

Grace faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to operate her own stall in future and earn more profit. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and expand her business. Grace rents a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She cites school fees as her greatest monthly expense.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Eduardo Simon

texts.es:
Eduardo de 40 años, tiene una tienda de vivieres compartida con algo de papelería, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil (lugar con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Su esposa le ayuda en la tienda, tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años. Debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, y a la falta de oportunidades, el decidió invertir sus ahorros hace 3 años y comprar víveres para tener su propio negocio, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h15pm. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz y cuadernos en el futuro quiere comprar un carro e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 40, has a grocery store with a bit of paper goods as well. He lives on the outskirts of a city in the El Fortín high-rise of Guayaquil (a place with dirt roads and hills). His wife helps him in the store. They have two children, a 4-year-old and a 2-year-old. Three years ago, due to their low income and lack of opportunity, he decided to invest his savings to purchase groceries in order to have his own business. Little by little he worked till he was able to have a small store in the front part of his house. He works from 6 a.m. until 9:15 p.m. To better stock his business he wants to use the loan to buy rice and notebooks. In the future he would like to buy a car and expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, notebooks

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa G., 36, lives with her husband and two children in Mongolia’s Huvsgul province. Her husband works at a "Just Oil" gasoline station. She used to work at a "Tes" supermarket as a salesperson. She is a very modest and open-minded person.

Amarsanaa began her taxi service in 2004 in her local town. It is a difficult business for a woman, but she works hard every day for her children’s future. Amarsanaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to fix up her car which is used as her taxi.

loans.use: To fix up her car

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año tiene su tienda, instalada en su misma casa, negocio del cual atiende todos los días y cuando su esposo tiene días libres la ayuda a realizar estas tareas. Siempre esta al tanto de que su tienda esté abastecida con variados productos, que en su mayoría tienen mucha demanda en el mercado y con el suficiente stock puede que posee puede complacer el pedido de sus clientes, además un valor agregado que ha mejorado sus ventas es cuando instaló un teléfono público en su tienda.  Disfruta cada día estar en su negocio, porque esta muy cerca de su familia, además tiene entradas económicas cada día por lo que su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda bien amplia. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería y mejorar el servicio de locutorio telefónico.
texts.en:
Elsa is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She has been operating a store out of her home for the past year. Elsa attends to her business every day and her husband helps with the duties on his days off from work. She is always mindful of keeping her store stocked with different products, most of which are in great demand in the marketplace. By having adequate stock available, Elsa is able to fulfill her customers’ requests. Something of value that has helped improve her sales was the installation of a phone booth in her store. Elsa enjoys being at her business every day because she gets to be near her family and still have a way of generating an income. Her wish for the future is to have a larger store.

This is her second loan with MFP. Elsa is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support. She has demonstrated responsibility with her payments. Elsa is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. In addition, she thanks those responsible for approving this loan request because the funds will be helpful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and improvements to her phone services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & make improvements to her phone services

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Lucia del Carmen A. F. es comerciante, riega ropa al crédito casa por casa, esta vez solicito crédito para compra de unos medicamentos de su mama ya que está bien señora y solo ella vive con su mama.
Es acompañada tiene una niña de meses, la cual se la mira su mama ha tenido ya 5 créditos y ha pagado en tiempo y forma, es muy responsable con sus pagos
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia del Carmen A. F. is a saleperson.  She sells clothes on credit by going house to house.  This time she is requesting a loan to buy medicine for her mother since she is elderly and Lucia del Carmen is the only one who lives with her.
She has an infant that her mother cares for.  She has had 5 loans and has paid them on time and correctly. She is very responsible with her payments.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine F. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Josephine is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $100 when she sells her raised pig.

In 2009, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Josephine is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Cleotilde G. se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas especialmente la venta de papayas que lleva a cabo en su localidad. Es una dama muy trabajadora que ha sabido administrar muy bien su negocio y ha logrado salir adelante mejorando sus condiciones.

Hoy en día solicita el crédito para la compra de las papayas para la venta. Es importante destacar que las papayas se han estado vendiendo mucho por lo que requiere tener dicho perecedero para lograr satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes y así continuar proyectándose como una gran comerciante.
texts.en:
At the Wholesale Market Sra. Cleotilde G. sells fruit, especially papayas that are shipped in to her area. She is a hardworking woman who knows how to manage her business well and improve its conditions.
