Today she is requesting a loan to buy papayas to sell. It is important to know that papayas have been selling well, so she needs more of these perishable products to satisfy the demands of her customers and maintain her great reputation as a merchant.

loans.use: Acquire papayas to sell

loans.name: Unathan

texts.en: Unathan T. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her two sons both attend a local secondary school. Her husband and Unathan operate a clothing trade business in the two different local markets in their town. They sell a variety of clothing items that are imported from China. They started their business in 2000 and have since built a stable and successful operation. After many years, they were able to buy a small plot of land where they built a house. Next year, they plan to improve their car and fix the ceiling of their house. Unathan is a clever and hard-working woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothes from China in order to increase their volume.

loans.use: To import more clothes

loans.name: Elisa Aurelio

texts.pt:
Elisa Aurélio N. nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 5 filhos de idades entre 1 a 17 anos, os mais velhos continuam a estudar. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido ao casamento pré maturo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo devido a problemas sociais, trabalha como operaria agrícola numa empresa de produção agrícola ha mais de 8 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salario de 1.830.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e não consegue poupar quase nada devido ao elevado custo de vida.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Elisa Aurélio N. was born in the District of Manjacaze in Gaza Province, located in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of 5 children, who range in age from 1 to 17 years old.  The oldest continue to go to school.  She only completed 6th grade because she married when she was young.  She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Gaza for Maputo due to social problems.  Elisa has been a worker at an agricultural production company for more than 8 years.  She does not have any of her own employees.  She earns a monthly salary of 1,830 MZN, which she uses to pay for household expenses.  She is not able to save very much due to the high cost of living.

Elisa has never had loans with any other banks.  She found out about Hluvuku through her colleagues who are also clients of the institution.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku.  She is requesting 10,500 MZN, with which she plans to buy construction material (cement, galvanized roofing sheets, sand, etc.) to continue making improvements on her house.

She promises to pay back the loan on time to have access to others in the future.  She plans to request new loans in order to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, galvanized roofing sheets, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Soliya

texts.en:
J. Soliya is a woman who on a daily basis seeks for the bettering of her four children. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build a prominent and promising future. Ever since she was a young girl, she has been dedicated to farming activities. She was raised this way and it has been a stable source of income until this day. For more than 15 years Soliya has raised sheep and she also grows some products on her land. 

In order to continue to work and to obtain a very good quantity and quality, Soliya wants to borrow money for growing vegetables and buying sheep. Let’s show solidarity to this self-less widow mother who looks for what is best for her children.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and sheep

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana just outside  of Kampala.  She is married and has no children. Rose has a business of a small retail shop selling drinks, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, drinks.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Rose hopes to own a whole sell shop. Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and drinks for resale

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry P. is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Samet Heng, is 28 years old and a construction worker.  They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children.  Ry has been a weaver since she was 17 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. sells provisions, drinks and fish at Elmina.  Agnes has received senior high education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Agnes has been selling provisions, drinks and fish for 10 years. She assists her husband in paying her children's school fees and other expenses of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re-invest back into the food selling business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Tolibboy

texts.en:
Farming requires a lot of effort, which is why Tolibboy, from a young age, has dedicated himself to his business. Today, he is seeking a way to expand his farming efforts in order to support his family, which consists of his wife and 5 children. Tilibboy faces lack of capital financing for the production of potatoes, wheat and oats. For this reason, he trustfully approached IMON to ask for a loan for that activity. In this way, he can continue supporting his humble home and develop his business economically.    
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im C. is a 31-year-old who operates a handicraft business whose core activity is making rattan cupboards and wooden beds from home in Kompong Tom province. Im C. sells her finished products to middlemen who come to order directly from her home. She has a partner in her husband, who is good at making rattan and bed products by hand. The couple has two school-aged children who are dependent on their profit. Im has used up all of her raw materials and is requesting a loan to purchase more planks to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to make beds to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La Srta. Blanca nacida en San Matías Provincia de Santa Cruz de la Sierra soltera de 25 años de edad,  la Srta. Blanca administra un taller de conversión a gas recibiendo un porcentaje de los trabajos realizados, le va muy bien en esta actividad, ella es una persona joven y muy trabajadora. El crédito que se le otorgo para el incremento de su capital de trabajo (compra de emulador, variador de avance, fierros, pernos y otros). "manifestó su satisfacción agradeciendo por la rapidez del crédito y la confianza depositada en ella".
texts.en: Blanca was born in San Matías in the province of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She's 25-years-old and single. She runs a gas conversion shop and receives a portion from the work she does. She enjoys this activity. She's a young, hardworking person. This loan is to increase her working capital (purchase of an emulator, advancement variator, metal, bolts, and other things). She's grateful for the speed of the loan and the trust it she has received.

loans.use: to buy an emulator, advancement variator, metal, bolts, and other items.

loans.name: Amarbayasgalan

texts.en:
Amarbayasgalan, 61, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. They have a decent standard of living. Her husband co-works with her and her two children attend a college. 

Amarbayasgalan began selling groceries and vegetables out of a stall in 1995. She started her retail trading business with a working capital of 50,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 410,000 MNT. She supplies vegetables, by custom orders, to cafes and restaurants. She became one of the reliable customers of our bank since 2000. She is a hardworking person who says, "I try to purchase and sell fresh and high quality vegetables." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables.

loans.name: Mrs. Chreang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chreang is the village bank president who has been selected by the thirteen members who make up this village bank loan.  The members will use their portion of this loan for different purposes to improve their family's living. 

Mrs. Chreang was born in 1959. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice and vegetables to sell to earn money to support her family.  To improve her crops, Mrs. Chreang is asking for a loan to buy what she needs to do farming this current year. Her husband, Mr. Sam, is a government worker. Through these activities they support four children, three of whom are working as laborers, and the last one is studying in the local public school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for farming

loans.name: Lidia Maruja

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar.  Tiene grado de instrucción  secundaria. 
Su primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta al por menor de artículos artesanales como chullos, chalinas, chompas, etc.,  todos estos productos los vende en los hoteles.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará 10 conos de lana, cinco libras de lana de alpaca de diferentes colores.  Lidia trabaja sola ya que su esposo trabaja en construcción civil y es chofer en ocasiones.
Su sueño es crecer más en el negocio y tener un restaurante fuera de la ciudad.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y las charlas  educativas.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of Las Retamas communal bank, located in the Puno district, Puno province and department.  She is 44, married, and has 3 school-aged children.  She herself studied through secondary school.

Her first loan with the Manuela Ramos Movement was for 200 new sols which she used for her retail handicrafts business.  She makes wool hats,     stoles, sweaters, etc which are sold in hotels.  With this loan of 1000 new sols, she will buy 10 cones of wool, and five pounds of alpaca wool in different colors. Lidia works by herself since her husband works in civil construction,  and at times he is a driver.

Her dream is to have her business grow and to have a restaurant outside the city. What she likes most about the communal bank is the punctual meetings and the educational talks.

loans.use: To buy 10 cones of wool and five pounds of alpaca wool in different colors

loans.name: Armandio Goncalves

texts.pt:
Amandio gonsalves M. nasceu no distrito de namaacha, provincia de maputo, sul de mocambique, e orfao de pai e mae cresceu na companhia dos tios. Fez a 6 classe nao concluiu devido a falta de condicoes, e pai de 2 filhos destes 1 e que vao a escola. Vive na casa propria com sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem para alem dos seus filhos.


Nunca saiu do distrito, tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade em sua residencia. Exerce esta actividade ha mais de 4 anos. Nao possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas dispesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a hluvuku atraves de seus vizinhos que sao clientes desta instituicao. Este e seu pimeiro emprestimo na hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria( sardinha, oleo, bolachas  massas e mais) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Compromente se a pagar devidamente para acedr a outros emprestimos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos emprestimos para a construcao de uma esplanada dando mais conforto aos clientes.
texts.en:
Amandio M. Gonsalves was born in the Namaacha district, of the province of Maputo, in southern Mozambique. Orphaned by his mother and father, he grew up with uncles. He completed grade 6 but did not continue due to lack of funds. He is the father of two sons, one whom goes to school. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone besides his children.

He has never been out of the district. He has his own business selling basic goods from his home. He has been doing this for more than four years. He does not have any employees and has monthly earnings of 4,000 MT which he applies to household expenses and manages to save some to his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks.  He knew of Hluvuku through his neighbors who are clients of the institution. This is his first Hluvuku loan for the amount of 10,000 MT with which he would buy goods (sardines, oil, crackers, pasta and more) to increase the amount of his inventory.

He is committed to paying promptly in order to have access to other loans in the future.  He intends to apply for a new loan to build an awning to provide more comfort to his customers.

loans.use: buy goods (sardines, oil, crackers, pasta and more) for resale

loans.name: Aliou Sitoe Diatta Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité  est créé le 19 décembre 2001. Les femmes qui composent se groupe habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame MAREME est à droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est Mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en charge trois autres enfants confié par ses frères.

Elle s'active dans la vente de tissu teinté. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 19, 2001. The women who make up the group live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is selling various small items. 

Mrs. MAREME, on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 58, married, and the mother of six children. She is also raising three other children confided to her by her brothers. 

She sells dyed cloth. She has a lot of experience in this field. She has been working in this business for more than 10 years. 

This loan will allow her to develop her business so that she can help improve living conditions for her family and support herself.

loans.use: to buy dyed cloth.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Savin (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. She also buys finished silk from the local villagers and sells it in other provinces far from her house. She is requesting another loan of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

Savin lives on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two sons and one daughter. Both of her children are in school.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has been engaged in mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband Julius.

She got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff members in Ndunyu Njeru town. This will be her fourth loan, and she repaid her most recent previous loan of KES 75,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy one cow, fertilizers, and seedlings, and to pay for necessary farm labor.

In the future, Nancy aspires to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy one cow, fertilizers, and seedlings, and to pay for necessary farm labor

loans.name: Vannakk

texts.en:
Vannakk (in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband sells kitchenware and electrical goods. He hopes to expand his business by buying additional kitchenware and electrical goods to sell. Hence, Vannak is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help increase her husband’s business capital. 

This couple has been married since 2008 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to help increase business capital for her husband to purchase additional kitchenware and electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has run a boutique for two years in Naivasha. She is 19 years old and married to David. She is the mother of one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer. This is her second loan. She intends to use this loan to add more women's clothes like skirts and blouses to her stock.

Her future dream is to enlarge her boutique stock shoes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, vive con su hijo y su esposa, administra un mini taller de costuras, tiene 25 años de dedicarse a la sastrería y aprendió cuando era ayudante de un taller, ha logrado ganar clientela y es de este negocio que cubre las necesidades de su familia.
Actualmente necesita comprar materiales para el taller, por lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en telas, hilos, botones, broches, y ciper, con este préstamo podre tener el inventario surtido de los materiales necesarios para atender cualquier trabajo.
El objetivo de Martin es que su taller de sastrería se mantenga y así continuar en el oficio que tanto aprecia y que hasta el momento le ha dado todo lo necesario para él y su familia, también tiene el deseo de mejorar sus trabajos capacitándose.
texts.en:
Martin lives with his wife and child. He manages a small sewing workshop and has 25 years of experience working as a tailor. Martin learned this trade when he was an assistant at another workshop. He has built up a customer base and his business enables him to provide for the needs of his family.

At the moment, he needs to buy materials for his workshop. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in fabrics, thread, buttons, snaps, and zippers. With this loan, he will be stocked with the necessary materials to perform any job.

Martin’s goal is to maintain his tailoring shop and continue in his trade. He appreciates everything that has been given to him and his family so far. Martin also hopes to improve his work-related knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, snaps, and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant ella trabaja junto con su hermana, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el restaurant como arroz, azúcar, carne y pollo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SAYHUA 3", which is located in the district and province of urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She is 41, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business where she works with her sister from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. preparing breakfast, lunch and dinner.  With the income she earns she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand the restaurant in the future.  She is requesting a loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, mean and chicken for the restaurant.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy restaurant items such as rice, sugar, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 57 years old and married with nine children. She is a hardworking woman who sells charcoal within her village and in nearby villages. Aside from vending charcoal, she also manages her store to have extra income. Five of her children are married, and the rest are still single and working. She is glad because her children are supportive in improving her business.

Victoria would like to ask for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to be used in buying charcoal to sell within her village. She is hoping that she can maintain her business so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, zapatos, plásticos y lozas, vive con su esposo y el negocio lo administra desD. hace 30 años, está ubicado en el mercado municipal, su esposo la apoya mucho.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, sal, estos para la tienda, la inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y atender mejor a los clientes.
El propósito D. ella es mantener el negocio estable, ya que trabaja junto a su esposo y dependen D. estas ganancias.
texts.en:
Josepha sells articles of primary necessity. including shoes,, plastic items and crockery. She lives with her husband and has administered the business for some 30 years. It is located in the municipal market. Her husband helps her a great deal.

At present, Josefa is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and other items for her store. This investment will improve the business and help her better attend to customers needs.

Josefa's proposal is to maintain a stable business. She works in the store with her husband and depends on this source of income.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to restock her business.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 37 years old, married and her husband works in a brick furnace, making bricks. His duty hours are very long but his income is very low. Their poor financial situation is why Sajida couldn’t provide an education for her son. 
She is a housewife and fulfils her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her duties very well. 
Her only son operates a grocery store where he sells daily-use items such as spices, sugar, rice, cooking oil and lentils at reasonable rates. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store. That will allow him to meet customer demand and make more profit. 
Sajida is hopeful that an investment will help him in establishing his business and increasing his profits.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Saúl Uriel

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Saúl Uriel   se dedica   a laborar como ayudante fontanero   en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace Ocho años. Es casado y con una persona a su cargo, es una persona con buenos valores morales. 

El señor Saúl Uriel  ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como bloque, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra, para hacer un anexo de un cuarto en su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Saúl Uriel works in the Managua municipality as an assistant plumber in a state institution.  He has been doing this work for eight years.  He is married and has one person under his care.  He is a person with good moral values.

Saúl Uriel has come to Ceprodel in order to request a loan to improve the condition of his house.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials like concrete blocks, cement, and sand.  He will also pay for the labor to build an addition to a room in his house.  Through this work he will give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, viven en Salcedo que está ubicado a 20 minuto de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Se describe como una persona buena, tranquila, amistosa y cariñosa.

Trabaja con su familia en la compra, crianza y venta de animales como son los cerdos, pollos. Es el primer crédito solicitado a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de crías de cerdos, pollos para su engorde y posteriormente para su venta que generará buenos ingresos lo cual le ayudará a que sus hijos acaben de estudiar y mejoraran su calidad de vida.

Su sueño principal es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and married with two children. They live in Salcedo, which is located 20 minutes from Latacunga in the Central Sierra area of Ecuador. She is described as a good person, quiet, friendly and caring.

She works with her family in the buying, breeding and selling of animals such as pigs and chickens. 

This is her first loan with Fodemi. She will use the loan to buy piglets to fatten, along with some chickens for later resale. The income she earns will help her children finish their education and improve their quality of life. 

Her biggest dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten, along with some chickens for later resale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 48 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children. For the past three years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small retail shop, which sells sugar, soap etc.

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, soap and cooking oil for her shop, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to build another residential house. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and cooking oil  for her shop

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta D. 61 años, es una mujer valiente. Enviudó hace 3 años D. Oscar, su esposo. Ambos tuvieron 8 hijos a los que cuidaron con amor. Ahora ella vive en casa D. su hija Sara, ubicada en la ciudad D. Tambo. Ella se siente sola, pues su eterno compañero, murió. A raíz D. ello comenzó a vivir con su hija, a la que quiere mucho. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, continua en ganándose la vida como cocinera en una mina, donD. prepara 30 platos D. comida casera, le va muy bien en su negocio, pues la comida por esa zona es escasa y le brinda mayor demanda. Además gracias a su dedicación la contrataron como cocinera en el cafetín D. la mina, ahí le pagan 25 soles diarios, los que suman a la pensión mensual que recibe por la muerte D. su esposo. Eso la llena D. tranquilidad y alegría, “esperaré en paz, pues el resto que me queD. D. vida, no preocuparé a mi familia”, comenta tranquila. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jacinta D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. víveres, trucha y cuy para la preparación D. sus platos D. comida.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 61, is a courageous woman.  She was widowed three years ago by Oscar, her husband.  Together they had eight children whom they cared for lovingly.  Now she lives in her daughter Sara's house, located in the city of Tambo.  She feels alone because her eternal companion died.  Because of this she began to live with her daughter, whom she loves very much.

But since she is a hardworking woman, she continues earning a living as a cook in a mine, where she makes 30 dishes of homestyle food.  Her business is going very well for her since food is scarce in that area and that creates greater demand for her.  Also, thanks to her dedication they hired her as the cook in the cafe in the mine, where they pay her 25 PEN daily, which she adds to the monthly pension she receives for the death of her husband.

This fills her with peace and happiness: "I will wait peacefully, since for the rest of my life I will not be a worry to my family," she comments quietly.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  She is pleased to be part of her association because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

When she receives the support, she will invest the money requested in buying supplies, trout, and guinea pigs to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, trout, and guinea pigs to prepare food.

loans.name: Tungatar

texts.en: Tungatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and six kids in a ger(Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii Province, Mongolia. His kids are all in school. He started his carpenting and plumbing business in 1996. His service is very popular around the neighborhood, but his tools and equipment are very old. He is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy new tools and equipment. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says "I have many children and I have to do everything I can in order to support them and educate them."

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Soveat

texts.en:
Soveat, 30, resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Soveat is a traditional musician. 

Soveat is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase new musical instruments for her band to perform in wedding parties. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. 

This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy new musical instruments to perform in wedding parties.

loans.name: María Olgita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Emprendedora De Los Cerezos,  esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada.
 
En este lugar conocimos a La señora María, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual procreo 8 hijos que en la actualidad ya todos son mayores e independientes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende productos naturales, exotéricos y medicinales, tiene un puesto en el centro de la ciudad, sitio donde vende todos estos productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00 y lo que más vende son productos medicinales para los riñones y el hígado, tiene productos de muchas marcas los mismos que recibe en su local. Lleva más de 20 años dedicada al comercio.

Este crédito es para comprar inciensos, medicinas y otros productos naturales que ella vende. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local más grande y de su propiedad ya que el que tiene es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Emprendedora De Los Cerezos” communal bank meet every two weeks in the town of Los Cerezos.  This zone is urban very populated.

María is 54 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has eight adult children who are all on their own.  Her life partner is a merchant.

Aside from her being a great house keeper, she also sells natural products, both exotic and medicinal.  She has a point of sale in the city center, where she sells all of her products.  She works every day from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm and her medicinal products for the kidneys and liver are her best sellers.  She carries many different brands and has been in business for 20 years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy incense, medicines and other natural products she sells.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because the loans have been of great help.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old, married and has seven children. Erlinda has managed her farm business of planting of rice for almost 34 years. Her husband is a farmer, her partner in life, and partner in managing their farm business. Last crop season, Erlinda earned minimal income from her crops because they were hit by the previous typhoon.
With her determination to minimize her labor cost in farming, Erlinda and her husband are also doing farm activities to lessen their farm expenses. Erlinda always wishes to get high yield from her crops to uplift her family's living. She is improving her expertise in managing her farm.
With the costly farm inputs (fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides) needed in farming, Erlinda wants to borrow a loan of P40,000 to buy farm inputs to use in her farm.  She hopes to get a high yield from her crops and uplift her family's living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides) to use in her farm.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Vergie has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vergie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married woman. She describes herself as creative, polite and God-fearing. 

She operates a retail business where she sells detergents. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable fast-growing town and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as high bus fare costs when transporting the raw materials. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy raw materials for detergents. Rahab's dream and  business goal is to own a detergent and oil manufacturing company within five years.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making detergent for selling.

loans.name: Gevans  Luyo

texts.en: Gevans was born in Kwisero in Kakamega County. He has a family and supports his siblings from income gained from renting a motorcycle in town. He has been riding a rented bike for two years. At times Gevans gets many customers, especially during the market days, when he has to transport people and produce to the main market. Gevans wants to acquire his own bike in order to support his community and provide for his family. He is well aware of activities of Community Health Workers (CHWs) in his community and will assist in providing transport to CHWs working for a local community organization. Distances between homesteads in Kwisero can be very long and transportation support to CHWS will save time. His family is excited and happy that Gevans can have a motorbike of his own. He hopes to introduce other members of his social club to this program.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to support Community Health Workers and for transport business

loans.name: Muhammad Nur

texts.en:
M. Nur is a student from Cikalong Wetan sub-district. He goes to school at Bina Prestasi Bangsa Vocational High School.

He comes from a poor family, but he has the spirit to change that situation because he believes education can change all.

loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Gs. Apostolico Group

texts.es:
Marcia is the coordinator of her group, GS. Apostolico 1. This group is comprised of four womem entrepreneurs and is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Their community is located in a rural area, surrounded by fields of sugarcane. Marcia sells fruit and natural juices. She will use her part of this loan to increase her inventory. 

Marcia started her business almost 5 years ago, by taking loans and investing the money in her business. She is receiving her 10th loan. Marcia has two children and they live together with her long term partner. Her most important challenges is to have a successful business. She has made her loan repayments punctually, she has been able to increase her sales and expand her business. She will use her business profits to help her partner with their needs as a family. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en:
Mrs M. is a mother and her children are all of school age, because of which she started her business selling covers, bedsheets and new clothing, five years ago.

\"When I began to notice that my husband did not earn enough to pay for my childrens\' education, I decided to undertake opening this business with the small savings we had. Now I have many clients; they order comforters and I buy them for a good price. Now that winter is approaching, my sales could be more if I had more merchandise. For this, I need a loan for $1,400 dollars in order to buy enough winter clothing and bed-sheets to sell to my customers. I am sure that my business will grow and that I will be able to better afford the costs of my childrens\' education.\"

Loan Use: To buy winter clothing and blankets to sell.

La Sra. M. es madre de familia y sus hijos están todos en edad escolar, por lo que inició hace 5 años un negocio de venta de cobertores, sobrecamas, y ropa nueva. “Cuando empecé a notar que lo que ganaba mi esposo no era suficiente para pagar la educación de mis hijos, decidí emprender este negocio con un pequeño ahorro que teníamos. Ya tengo muchos clientes; me encargan los cobertores y los compro por mayoreo a buen precio. Como ya se acerca el invierno mis ventas podrían ser mayores si tuviera más mercancía. Por lo que necesito apoyo de un crédito de 1,400 dlls. para comprar ropa de invierno y suficientes cobijas para vender a mis clientes. Estoy segura de que mi negocio crecerá y podré costear mejor los gastos de educación de mis hijos.”

loans.use: Comprar ropa de invierno y cobijas para vender.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: "Auntie Lizzy" lives in Amanfrom, Kasoah, Ghana, where she sells charcoal to her community. Since this is the main source of fuel in most homes, demand for her product is very high. She is seeking a loan of $950.00 from Kiva to enable her to buy more bags of charcoal in order to serve her customers. She has been trained by Kraban Support Foundation to adopt the TEACH Lending tool in keeping simple records of her financial and business operations.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.en:
Angelica is a 39 year old single mother of 4 children of ages 18, 19, 21, and 23 years of age. She never relied on the support of her husband and has always had to carry on with her children on her own, which has taken a great deal of effort. It has been 8 years since she started doing grocery sales in order to earn a better income that would cover the needs of her family. Fortunately, her store has been growing and continually has an increasing number of customers.

Now, Angelica needs a loan for $925 dollars that she will use to purchase a refrigerator which will allow her to offer a better variety of products, in order to continue growing in her business and to provide for the preferences of her clients. She needs your support, don't doubt it, decide to support her!

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Angélica tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, de 18, 19, 21 y 23 años. Nunca contó con la ayuda de su pareja por lo que tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola, para lo que se ha esforzado mucho. Hace ocho años que inició con la venta de abarrotes para poder obtener un mayor ingreso que cubriera las necesidades de su familia, afortunadamente ha estado creciendo su tienda y cada vez tiene más clientes.

Ahora Angélica necesita de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una nevera que permitirá poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos, para continuar creciendo con su negocio y contar con la preferencia de sus clientes. Ella necesita de tu ayuda, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mwajabu is married with six children. She lives in the Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam. She has been in this business for years now. Mwajabu thanks all her lenders for her first loan with Kiva. She has repaid the loan in full. With the loan money she received, Mwajabu replenished her stock of cosmetics and she has had success selling her products. She hopes to continue to grow her cosmetics business by increasing her stock of cosmetics and introducing women's clothing in her shop. This could help her do more business. When a customer comes for cosmetics, she’ll also have a chance to view some clothes. The new line of business also needs some additional funding. She requests a loan worth USD 750 to increase her stock of cosmetics and purchase the right quantity of clothes.

Mwajabu’s success with cosmetics has stoked her entrepreneurial spirit, and she now also operates a second business in the transportation industry. She has purchased, with the help of her husband, a commuter bus that operates in the Kigamboni neighborhood. The city of Dar es Salaam does not provide bus services; rather, bus services are a private enterprise. Buses (called Dala Dalas) are owned by private individuals who rent them to drivers. The driver pays the owner a certain amount each day and anything he/she makes over that amount is theirs to keep. Mwajabu has purchased a Dala Dala for a route in Kigamboni and makes money renting out the vehicle to service the growing number of residents.

Her income from these ventures helps pay for family expenses and school fees for her children. Her excitement for these businesses was apparent when we talked with her.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Queenett

texts.en: Queenett N. is married and a mother of two children.  She hails from a semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, in Nigeria.  She rents out building tools such as wheelbarrows, shovels, head pans, sledge hammers etc. to builders and individuals in need of these tools. She is seeking a $400 loan to buy more tools for her business.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows, shovels, and head pans to rent out

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Fidelina S.. I have a small restaurant in the small area called El Chile which I have had for 3 years. I make breakfast, lunch and dinner. I have great clientele because there are a few schools near me as well as offices which make up a large part of the orders I get.

At this time, I need three blenders and a small freezer because I would now like to provide my customers with shakes and smoothies.

With the money from my profits I help put my two sons through school, being that I am a single mother. My eldest son is in college and the youngest is in school. I want my children to graduate so they may have a better life. I thank you in advance for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Wendy Wise

Hola, mi nombre es Fidelina S. tengo un pequeño restaurante de venta de comida en la Colonia el Chile hace 3 años. Yo vendo desayunos, almuerzos y cena , tengo una buena cliente porque tengo serca esculas y oficinas y me hacen varios pedidos. En estos momentos necesito comprar 3 licuadoras y un friser pequeño ya que quiero vender tambien licuados de frutas. Con los ingresos que me genera el negocio yo le pago los estudios a mis dos hijos ya que soy madre soltera, mi hijo mayor estudia en el colegio, y el menor esta en la escuela. Yo quiero que mis hijos se graduen para que puedan tener una mejor vida. Les agradesco mucho por su ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase blenders, glasses and a small freezer

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is a 28 year-old mother of three, a resident of Buguruni area. She has been selling newspapers for the past four years. She buys them in large quantities and supplies them to the street vendors and the city's office employees.
Mayasa is in need of US$425 to help her expand her newspaper sales business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Inviolather

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam!  This is 46 year-old Inviolather R..  She is married with two children, aged 16 and 21, and has two other dependents who are her nieces.
 
In 1990, Inviolather established a poultry business.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $600 in order to purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients.  In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku.  Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask.  Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. 

Firstly, they require little start-up capital.  You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally!  

Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound.  

Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.  

I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all that time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rini

texts.id:
Rini has chosen to focus on selling scrap items, daily work that pays weekly dividends. During this rainy season her business has been thriving; because her house is located near a river, it means she does not have to go far in search of scrap items. The elevated water level of the river brings with it a lot of items that she can recover to sell as part of her business. She uses her weekly income of Rp. 350,000 (USD equivalent $38) for her child's education as well as daily necessities. She is involved in this business along with her husband.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva Volunteer.

Rini memilih menekuni usaha Jual Barang Bekas karena ia bekerja setiap hari dengan penghasilan mingguan. Pada musim penghujan ini ia memperoleh banyak keuntungan sehubungan dengan pekerjaannya. Rumah dimana dia tinggal dekat dengan sungai. Hal ini membuat dia tidak perlu jauh – jauh untuk mencari barang – barang bekas. Permukaan air sungai yang naik membawa sejumlah besar sampah yang masih bisa ia kumpulkan untuk usahanya ini. Keuntungan sebesar Rp 350.000,00/ minggu ia pakai untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya Rp 300.000,00/bulan dan keperluan biaya hidup sehari – hari. Ia menekuni usaha ini bersama dengan suaminya.

loans.use: To purchase scrap and sundry items for resale

loans.name: Rahabu's Tupendane. Group

texts.en:
Rahabu is a 38 year old married woman with three children, aged 16, 8 and 5 years. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, aged 62 years. Rahabu owns a small food store that she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 5:45am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Rahabu now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Neema and Emy, who have business dealings in food vending and sales.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the member who fails to pay.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widowed mother of five children (two daughters and three sons).  She prepares pastries and sells plastic containers of all sorts.  She is also expanding into certain popular clothing items such as fancy scarves.  The proceeds of the loan will help her to start building up her inventory of these clothing items. It is her hope that she can begin to save to help pay for her children’s school fees.  

Ama is a member of the trust group Yesu Mo (Thank God).  The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase scarves and other clothing items

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Kheng D. is 23 years old, and lives with his wife and parents. He has one child. Kheng works at a garment factory while his wife provides for the family. At the end of last year, his wife, Oun Man got a bleeding cough which placed an extra strain upon him and the family. Kheng D. would like to start an extra business to earn more money to support his household and help provide the necessary care for his wife. Kheng owns a rice field as well, but unfortunately does not have enough money to purchase cows to sustain his land. The loan would be used to plow his land, and support his wife and family.

loans.use: To buy cows to use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Diana Felicitas

texts.es:
Diana and her husband deliver bread from a bakery. Previously they had their own bakery, but due to the high prices of ingredients, their business failed. Through their work delivering bread every day, they have gained more experience and have been able to adjust to changes and challenges. Now that they have the necessary knowledge, they have decided to work harder so that in a short time they can again start up their own bakery, for the well-being of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Diana y su esposo se dedican a repartir panes de la panadería, ellos anteriormente tenían su propia panadería pero por el alza excesiva de los insumos fracasaron. Con el reparto de panes a diario han ganado más experiencia y han podido convivir con las novedades y dificultades ahora que ya poseen los conocimientos necesarios han decidido esforzarse aún más para que dentro de poco vuelvan a instalar su humilde panadería para alegría y bienestar de los suyos.

loans.use: To improve her capacity buy supplies and to eventually open her own bakery.

loans.name: Burneebat

texts.mn:
Business Description
Mr. Burneebat is forty nine years old, happily married, and has three healthy children.  In 1990 Mr. Burneebat began making clothing and hats out of his home in Ulaanbaatar.  Once his business generated enough profit Mr. Burneebat purchased a working room in the center of the city.  This is Burneebat’s sixth loan with XacBank.  He has a perfect repayment history spanning 1,212 days.  The loan will be used to meet growing demand for wool felt hats made by Mr. Burneebat and his wife.

Бизнесийн тодорхойлолт 
Иргэн Бүрнээбат нь 49 настай, эхнэр 3 хүүхэтэй. Бүрнээбат нь 1990 оноос Улаанбаатар дахь өөрийн гэртээ хувцас болон малгай хийж эхэлсэн. Бүрнээбат бизнесийн ашгаараа Улаанбаатар хотын төвд ажлын өрөө худалдан авсан. Энэ удаагийн зээл нь ХасБанкнаас 6 дахь удаагаа авч байгаа зээл юм. Түүний зээлийн түүх нь маш сайн бөгөөд Банктай 1,212 өдөр харилцжээ. Энэхүү зээл нь Бүрнээбат болон түүний эхнэрийн гараар урлагддаг ноосон малгайны үйлдвэрлэлд зарцуулагдах болно.

loans.use:
Loan Description
Mr. Burneebat requests a micro loan for 1,200,000 MNT to purchase raw materials.  The loan will go towards buying processed sheep’s wool to use in the production of clothing and hats.


Зээлийн тодорхойлолт 
Ирэн Бүрнээбат нь 1,200,000 төгрөгийн бичил зээлийг түүхий эд худалдан авахдаа зориулан хүссэн.  Зээлээр хонины ноос худалдан авч хувцас болон малгай хийнэ.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David P. lives in his own home in the zone of San Pedro in our city [La Paz] with his two children. David works as a clothing maker, and the clothing made in his home is sold in La Paz. He also makes money as a taxi driver.

His home has deteriorations due to leaks which are destroying the walls and ceiling. The requested loan will be used for plumbing refurbishing, as well as for plastering of the walls and ceiling. Being the first time that he has requested a loan, we must say that the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies him very well, and so make him eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

David P. vive en una vivienda de su propiedad en la zona de San Pedro de nuestra ciudad con sus dos hijas. El señor David trabaja como confeccionista, la ropa elaborada en su domicilio es vendida en La Paz, también gana dinero como chofer de transporte público (taxi).

Su vivienda presenta deterioros debido a filtraciones, las cuales están destrozando los muros y el entrepiso. El crédito solicitado será usado para la refacción del sistema sanitario, así como el planchado de muros y el entrepiso. Siendo esta la primera vez que solicita crédito debemos decir que el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica excelentemente, por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Refurbishing of his Home

loans.name: Ifeaka

texts.en:
Ifeaka E. is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. Ifeaka sells eggs in crates and Indomie noodles in cartons. Most families in her neighborhood eat eggs and noodles for breakfast. She has been in this business for a long time.

Ifeaka is requesting a loan of $850 USD to buy more Indomie noodles wholesale, so that she can cut the cost of buying from distributors and thus increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy Indomie noodles wholesale to increase her profit margin.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio se dedica a la actividad de cuidado y venta de planta para jardín , como asi también flores de todo tipo, esta en el oficio hace mas de 20 años.

En el mes de Septiembre comenta el señor Silvio, de que tiene mucho trabajo ya que las florerias de la zona les solicitan anticipadamente gran cantidad de flores especialmente rosa, y clavel, para poder evacuar estos pedidos se requiere trabajar mas hora todos los días, además durante este mes también en la ciudad de Caacupé se realiza el desfiles de las flores, el día 21 de Septiembre, organizado por la municipalidad, para este evento ya tiene una buena cantida de pedidos que fueron realizados por los estudiantes secundarios de la zona.

Gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo invertir en la compra de más semillas, plantas y abonos como asi también gran cantidad de metros de carpa denominado media sombra que sirve para proteger las plantas del intenso calor.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio works at a nursery, caring and selling plants, and flowers of all kinds. He has been doing this for more than 20 years ago.

Mr Silvio tells us that in September he has a lot of work since the florist shops of the area order big quantities of flowers especially roses, and carnations. In order to fulfill these orders, he needs to work extra hours every day, also during this month in the city of Caacupé , the flower parade takes place on September 21th. It 's organized by the municipality, for this event he already has a good number of orders that were made by the secondary school students of the area.

Thanks to the loans by Paraguayan Foundation, he was able buy more seeds, plants and fertilizer, and as well a big quantity of meters of woven black shade cloth used to protect the plants from the intense heat.


Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds, plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema has been selling beans and other raw lentils in Zanzibar for two years. Beans are a staple food in Tanzania because they provide much-needed protein and are less expensive than meat. Rehema is currently able to earn approximately $85 each month. She will be using her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more inventory so that she can increase her sales and profit.

Rehema is 20 years old, married, and has one, 4-month-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Fatma, Mwanaisha, and Salma.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap M., 30, is widowed. Her occupation is as a rice farmer and she also raises pigs for income to support the family’s living. She has one daughter who studies in Grade 9, and they live in Loloksar Commune in Pursat Province.

Sopheap is applying for a $600 loan to purchase more piglets and more food for the pigs, and to buy rice for sale with the rest. The loan will help her to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Fortunée

texts.fr:
Miss Fortunée Y. is a young lady born in 1982. Abandoning the benches very early because of her dad's death, she got involved quickly in midwife's training. Having not found a job of her specialty, she made herself hired in a pharmacy of the place.   
Abandoned by her husband, she is alone facing the need of the family composed of four (04) people. With the delays in the payment of the salary, she arrives with difficulty to survive. To remedy, she wish to buy a taxicab motorcycle.  
The profit morale from this trade will allow him to provide to the family's needs; source of her blossoming.
texts.en:
Miss Fortunée Y. is a young lady born in 1982. Abandoning the benches very early because of her dad's death, she got involved quickly in midwife's training. Having not found a job of her specialty, she made herself hired in a pharmacy of the place.   
Abandoned by her husband, she is alone facing the need of the family composed of four (04) people. With the delays in the payment of the salary, she arrives with difficulty to survive. To remedy, she wish to buy a taxicab motorcycle.  
The profit morale from this trade will allow him to provide to the family's needs; source of her blossoming.

loans.use: Achat  de taxi moto

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul Q. is a 20-year-old woman who has been breeding sheep for the last three years. She is married and has a child. Sheep-breeding is the only source of income for Konul and her husband. Konul looks after the sheep and her husband pastures them and sells them in the livestock bazaar. They have divided their chores equally and they really enjoy their everyday work. Konul's dream is to become an entrepreneur with a big farm consisting of 100-200 sheep.  She believes such a business will provide her child a better life and the opportunity for a good education. She has applied for this loan to purchase nine sheep and fodder. Your generosity can help her approach her dream.

loans.use: Purchase nine sheep and fodder

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilibeth C. is 42 years old. She has 5 children. Three of them are in high school, one is in college and one is at home. Her married life didn’t go well, so when she and her husband decided to separate, her whole family life was affected including her children.

She is into farming. She grows sugarcane and sells it all to some retailers and sugar manufacturing companies. From her harvest, she has been able to provide for the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. Part of the loan will also be used to start other line of business to augment their income. The loan will enable her to get started in a new business so as to pay the tuition of her children.

Lilibeth now enjoys not only the credit assistance that CEVI provides. She also receives training and insurance coverage by joining CEVI's credit program.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a 41-year-old diligent entrepreneur. Her husband Romulo O. is a truck driver for a multi-gas company from whom she got the idea of selling LPG tank. They are blessed with four children. The eldest is Alvin, 19 years old, who stopped during her college studies due to obvious financial crisis. Next to him is Analyn, 18 years old, first year in college, followed by Mae-ann, 16 years old, still in third year high school, and the youngest is John Bryan, 10 years old, who is already in the fourth grade of elementary school. They are living in Barangay (township) Del Pilar, located between the boundaries of Cauayan City and Alicia, Isabela.

Marietta is already confident due to her almost three years of maintaining her LPG tank-selling. She hopes to receive a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional capital for her business and to be able to expand into rice and electronic load retailing in their village. She wants to increase her monthly income of PHP 1,700 out of the business she manages. Marietta said that she will do her best to generate a higher income to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Toshpulot

texts.en:
S. Toshpulot is 35 years old. He has lived for 10 years with the mother of his three children. His parents taught him the art of cultivating the land, and he has always tried to sow his hectares so that he would have a crop in every season.

At this time Toshpulot is sowing potatoes, onions, and carrots. He says that agriculture needs much patience and luck, because there are seasons where there is no profit, and other seasons are very good, but either way he has to keep sowing, profitable or not.

Toshpulot is a client who is now working for the fifth time with IMON International, being very responsible in his payments. He has asked for a loan of 3000 Somoni that will be invested in his crop supplies. Be an important part of the growth of Toshpulot’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia S. is 45 years old single mother of seven children. Four are currently in school while the rest are working. She lives with her children in Moore, in the central region of Ghana.

She is a food vendor and sells Fante Kenkey and maize. Fante Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy Kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. Her major target group is travelers who ply that road to their destination. Those travelers purchased Fante Kenkey in bulk.

Emelia wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. The government is trying to alleviate the poverty rate so that the economically active poor can also provide for their families. Emelia belongs to a village bank called ‘Independence.’

loans.use: Buy maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Hoji

texts.ru: Хочи 51 год. Она замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей мужских сумок и мужской обуви на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда, магазин № 8. Она арендует магазин. Ей помогает её муж. Он поставляет Хочи товар из города Истаравшан. Муж Хочи каждые две недели ездит за товаром. Хочи кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Сначала она продавала  только сумки, потом расширила бизнес и стала продавать мужскую обувь. Теперь Хочи планирует расширить свой ассортимент и закупить партию мужской одежды.
texts.en:
Hoji is 51 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells men’s purses and men’s shoes at the “Panchshanbe” market in Khujand, store #8. She rents the store. Her husband helps her. He supplies Hoji with products from Istaravshan. Hoji’s husband travels for products every two weeks. Hoji has been a borrower with our organization for 1 year. At first she sold only purses, later she grew her business and started to sell men’s shoes. Now Hoji plans to grow her assortments and to purchase a stock of men’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Florencia Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Florencia Sonia C. se individualizo con el credito desde hace dos secuencias, ella trabajaba en grupo CLAVELITOS en diez secuencias, ella se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en la Feria de Ovejuyo, posteriormente, cambio de actividad, ahora se dedica a acomodar, a plazos, sombreros y mantas, también trabaja de empleada de limpieza en la semana, en casas particulares. Ella vive con el esposo que es transportista y sus cuatro hijos, los dos mayores trabajan por horas y continuan estudiando por las tardes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Florencia Sonia C. became independent with the credit she has been on for the past two periods. She worked for the Clavelitos group for ten periods. She used to sell vegetables in the Ovejuyo Fair and then shifted to sell hats and shawls. She also works as a cleaning lady in private homes during the week. She lives with her husband who is a transportation driver and her four children, of which the two older ones work on an hourly basis and study in the afternoons.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hats for the party in the Chasquipampa region

loans.name: Atifa

texts.en:
Atifa is a 56 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Atifa has been working as a sewer since 2006. She sews curtains, clothes and even wedding dresses. Atifa requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing. This is her fourth cycle and she has always on time. 
Her previous loans helped her purchase a new sewing machine and improve her work. Atifa is special in her work because she does it well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Atifa will use the loan to purchase tissue, thread and accessories for her sewing.

loans.name: Kurbonjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Махмудова  Курвонжон  -  женщина  1954  года  рождения,  замужем,  имеет  2-х  детей.  Работает  врачом  в  центральной  больнице  Джаббор-Расуловского  района.  С  малых  лет  она  имеет  опыт  в  сфере  животноводства,  поэтому  она  помогает  мужу  Абдуразакову  Абдугафуру,  который  занимается  куплей-продажей  скота.  Они  обратились  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  На  полученные  деньги  они  планируют  купить  телёнка,  откормив  которого  в  течении  3-4  месяцев,  продадут  по  хорошей  цене.
texts.en:
Kurbonjon M. was born in 1954, is married and has two children. She works as a doctor in the central hospital in the Djabbor-Rasulovski region. Since she was young, she has built experience in the sphere of raising animals, therefore she helps her husband Abdugafur Abdurazakov, who is involved in the purchase-sale of cattle. They applied to MLF Microfinance for a loan. Upon receiving the money, they plan to purchase a calf which, in the course of 3-4 months, will sell at a good price. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 1 hijo, tiene estudios de segundaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Chinchera Sector Miraflores.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para incrementar su capital en su taller de carpintería.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de madera, también comprará lana para elaborar artesanías en miniatura.
 
Su mayor  deseo es mejorar su negocio en su carpintería, al mismo tiempo también en la elaboración de sus tejidos en artesanías.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Communal Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district of the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of 1 child. She has completed secondary school studies and lives in the Miraflores sector of the Chinchera community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 3 years. Her first loan was 300.00 PEN, which she used to increase capital in her carpenter’s workshop.

She now needs a loan of 800.00 PEN to purchase wood. She will also buy wool to make handicrafts in miniature form.

Her biggest dream is to improve business in her carpenter’s workshop, as well as the production of her knitted handicrafts.

She likes the savings and chats among the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and wool for handicrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from N. J.Damascene in Gasabo District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda!  Jean Damascene is 36years old, married with 4 children aged 12, 8, 5, and 5.

Jean owns a small shop where he sells different kinds of products as found on his picture. He has owned the business for 4 years.  He works every day from 6:00am to 10:22pm and earns a profit of approximately 120,000 Rwandan Francs per month.

Jean is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company s.a which will be repaid over 8 months.  With the increased profits that result from his loan, J.Damascene hopes to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Expanding his store

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito Y. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. He is 66 years old. Pedrito is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Pedrito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Pedrito has been engaged in his business for over 40 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pedrito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Pedrito is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Pedrito from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house repair

loans.name: Nyame Sun Sum Group

texts.en:
