The repair tools and items he uses he was slowly able to obtain with his savings, and in this way over time he began to work independently. Today he has his own business with a solid customer base.

He wishes that his children finish their schooling and become successful professionals. He is seeking this loan to buy parts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Isabelino M. de 40 años, casado la señora Ermelinda Melgarejo de 37 años, tienen 2 hijos, una va a la escuela y la otra no esta todavía en edad escolar.

Don Isabelino posee un taller donde repara artículos electrónicos. Se inició en esta profesión como ayudante desde los 15 años, tuvo la ocasión de estudiar y así lo hizo, los elementos de trabajo que el utiliza los pudo conseguir con pequeños ahorros, de este modo empezó a trabajar en forma independiente. Actualmente tiene su local propio y con clientela bien formada.

Desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y llegar a ser profesionales exitosos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos.

loans.use: Purchase parts such as metal plates, compra de repuestos como placas, amplifiers clips, nuts, etc.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon Y., a 34-year-old widow, lives in Kraing Sromo Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, where she operates a restaurant business and sells Khmer noodles in the village. As well, Mrs. Mon Y. is both a subsistence farmer and pig breeder. She has three children, one of whom is a Khmer cake seller while the others assist her on the rice plantation. She would now like to expand her income, so she is seeking a loan to buy a piece of land in order to cultivate rice and to  purchase more pigs. Previously, Mrs. Mon Y. obtained $125 from AMK to buy four piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for rice cultivation as well as more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia started her business because she has always had a penchant for commerce and sales. Furthermore, she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She started out using a room in her home, opening her doors in order to sell sweets to the neighborhood children. With the support of these microloans, she has been able to continue with her business for 4 years.

She needs a loan of $425.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase more merchandise. With your help, she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia inició el negocio ya que siempre ha tenido la inquietud por el comercio y las ventas, además de querer ayudarle a su marido con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en un cuarto de su casa, abrió una puerta para empezar a vender golosinas a los niños de su calle y con el apoyo de los microcréditos ha seguido esta actividad desde hace 4 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancía. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi T. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il est un éléveur de bovins depuis des années à Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce premier crédit augmenter la capacité de son bétail en achetant des bovins. Les gains issus de l’activité permettront à monsieur T. de rembourser le crédit et cet acquis contribuera beaucoup à la qualité de sa vie et de son activité.
texts.en:
Kossi T. is 39 years old, married and the father of three children, all of whom are at school. For years he has raised cattle in Adéta, a village located about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He wants to use this first-time loan to increase his livestock by buying cattle. The earnings from the business will allow Mr. T. to repay the loan, and the experience will contribute greatly towards his quality of life and his business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his livestock

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juany inicio su negocio en su casa con la elaboración y venta de comidas así como la elaboración de empanadas. Ella inicio el negocio para apoyar la economía familiar ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil y no tiene un ingreso fijo; empezó vendiendo entre sus amistades y poco a poco ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para tener materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juany started her business at home. She prepares and sells meals and empanadas (turnovers). She initiated the business to support the family's economy since her husband works as bricklayer and he doesn't have a fixed income. She started selling among her friends and little by little she has managed to make her business.

She needs a loan of $325 which will be repaid over a period of 3 months, she wants tol buy raw materials and be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials.

loans.name: Nikolina

texts.en: Nikolina S. was born in 1986 and comes from the town of Derventa. She is single and works in a local store as a sales person. Nikolina earns 400 KM monthly from her work in the store, and she earns extra income from her business at home. She lives with her mother, and they grow and sell flowers. They like their little business because it provides them with income that helps to improve their living conditions. They want to expand their business by providing more kinds of flowers. So, Nikolina is requesting a loan of 1500 KM ($1000 USD) to buy flower plants. Nikolina and her mother have enough flowers for the clients in their neighborhood, but with more flowers, they will be able to sell flowers in the local market also.

loans.use: To buy flower plants

loans.name: Hairinisso

texts.ru: Дустова Хайриниссо- предприниматель. Пять лет занимается торговлей . Имеет магазин продуктов питания. Привозит товар из города Душанбе.Покупает в оптовых магазинах. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Практически одна обеспечивает свою семью, так как муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Планирует получить кредит с целью покупки  и установки дополнительных стелажей. Кроме того оставшиеся деньги планирует использовать для увеличения товарооборота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hairinisso D. is an entrepreneur. She has been in sales for five years. She has a store where she sells foods. The goods are brought in from the city of Dushanbe, bought from wholesale stores. She is married and has four children. In fact, she raises the children alone, since her husband left for Russia to find work. She decided to request a loan with the goal of buying and installing additional shelving. In addition, the remaining money will be used to increase sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional shelving and increase sales volume

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Agé de 39 ans, Monsieur A. Dovi est marié et père de trois (03) enfants avec à sa charge trois (03) autres personnes. Sa principale activité est l'achat et la vente d'appareils électroniques usagers qui lui rapporte beaucoup. Disposant d’une capacité d’entreprenariat et de bonne gestion, il tire un profit énorme de son commerce qu’il met au service de sa famille, pour son épanouissement. Pour mieux faire, il voudrait renforcer son fonds de commerce par ce financement.
texts.en:
Mr. Dovi A. is 39 years old, married, and the father of three children, plus he has three others in his care. His main work, selling used electronic equipment, brings in a lot. Making use of his entrepreneurial and good management skills, he derives an enormous profit from his business that he puts towards his family members, so that they may thrive. To do better, he would like to boost his working capital through this financing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in used electronic equipment

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Monsieur L. Koffi, né le 02 Mars 1968 à Gamé Kové au Sud du Togo, est père de huit (08) enfants. Il a abandonné ses études et s’est adonné au métier de meunier. Seul meunier dans sa localité,  il ne dispose que d’un seul moulin qui tombe fréquemment en panne et dont les frais de réparation consomme toutes les économies réalisées. Il veut procéder au renouvellement de son moulin et sollicite à cette fin un financement qui va lui permettre de satisfaire ses clients et d’accroître ses revenus.
texts.en:
Koffi L. was born on March 2, 1968 in Gamé Kové in the South of Togo. He has eight children. He left school and became a miller. He is the only miller in his area and has only one mill which often breaks down. Fixing the mill uses up all of his savings. He wants to buy a new mill and is therefore asking for a loan to this end, which will allow him to offer better service to his customers and increase his revenues.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy, install and put a new mill to use.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita T. lives with her family in Barangay Lapogan in Tumauini, Isabela. She is 48 years old and married to a farmer named Eugenio T.. They have five children: Elbino, who is 30 years old but unfortunately wasn't able to finish his college course; Edward, a 28-year-old high school graduate who is now working as a driver; Elizabeth, who is 26 years old, married, a high school graduate, and the only girl among the five children; Ernesto, the fourth child, who is a 23-year-old elementary graduate like the youngest child, Enrico, who is 22 years old. Estelita happily shared that her family is bonded with love and that they live harmoniously.

Estelita wants a loan of $150 to finance their passenger tricycle's daily operation since it is their only daily source of income while they are waiting for the harvest season. Some of the loan will also be used to provide for their needed farming inputs. Their tricycle is being operated alternately by her two sons Ernesto and Enrico.

Estelita is so thankful that her children are very responsible, although they have no interest in pursuing their studies any more. At times, Estelita envies her neighbors whose children were able to finish college and had the chance to seek better jobs, unlike her children, who just settled in their simple life.

Eselita believes in the golden rule, “Don’t do unto others what you do not want others do unto you.” Therefore, Estelita said, she must always be friendly and should maintain her good relationships to her neighbors and fellow men in the village.

loans.use: Finance the daily operation of their passenger tricycle and farming needs

loans.name: Fansat

texts.en: Fansat O. is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells yams, and she is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Аъзам проживает в городе Курган-тюбе. Возраст 41 год, женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Торгует хозяйственными товарами. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент . Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Azam A. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children. He works in sales. He has a shop in the city market. He sells household goods. He wants to take out a loan to improve his selection of goods. It will help him attract new customers and to increase sales. He can repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improve the selection of goods

loans.name: Mayra Yamileth

texts.es: la Sra. Mayra L. se dedica a la venta de calzado para dama, caballero y niños, ella tiene su negocio ubicado en el mercado nacional de la ciudad capital, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, ella tiene gran variedad de zapatos pero quiere invertir mas  por la temporada de verano que se venden mucho las sandalias y chancletas, cabe mensionar que con su negocio ha podido salir adelante y dar el sustento que necesita su familia, los gastos de alimentacion, estudio, medicamentos etc. ella quiere invertir mas para tener mejores ventas y mayores ganancias. su meta es poder tener varias tiendas por toda la ciudad capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra L. F. sells shoes for women, men and children. Her business is located in a large market in the capital city. She has done this for several years. She sells a great variety of shoes, but she wants to buy sandals and flip-flops for the summer, as those sell very well. It's worth mentioning that she has been successful in her business; it has allowed her to support her family by paying for their food, school related expenses, medical expenses, and so on. She wants to invest so that she can have more sales and greater profits. Her goal is to have many stores throughout the capital city.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing shoes

loans.name: Biadolat

texts.ru: Биадолат Хайдарова 1966 года рождения. Замужем имеет 4 детей. Окончила только 8 классов. В селе работы нет, население в основном перепродает скот. Муж  помогает перепродавать скот. В рыночные дни  он выводит на продажу скота. Ее брат получал кредит в одном из банков , он также посоветовал получить кредит. Биадолат послушав советы брата, посоветовалась с мужем получить кредит. Теперь она кредитуется в Микроинвест  почти год.
texts.en:
Biadolat H. was born in 1966. She is married and has 4 children. She only finished 8 grades. There are no jobs in the village, the population mostly resells livestock. Her husband helps to resell livestock. On market days he takes the livestock to sell. Her brother received credit from one of the banks, he also recommended getting credit. Biadolat having listened to her brother’s suggestions also discussed it with her husband. Now she has been a borrower of MicroInvest for almost a year.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resell livestock

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo cdra. 02, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Viviendo cerca a un lugar donde hay mucho movimiento, Erika decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y anticuchos en la Plazuela de su barrio, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y tiene mucha acogida. 
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, nos cuenta que tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio restaurant en un local bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en la implementación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Erika is a member of the communal bank “Las Margaritas II” and lives in the province of San Martin with her partner. She is the mother of 3 dependent children. Erika decided to sell kebabs and prepared foods in her neighborhood's plaza because the area is so well trafficked. She tells us that she sells a lot each day due to the good flavors she prepares her food with and is well received. She will continue with the same business because she is very happy with her job that she begins at 6:00 p.m each day. She attends her clients herself with her customary charisma. She hopes to invest the loan of 2,000.00 soles in purchasing supplies for the daily preparation of her food like: kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, crates of chickens, and also some utensils so she can better serve her clients. Erika is full of life and is still motivated to get ahead. She tells us that she has many dreams and goals for her life like starting her own restaurant in a place with good air conditioning. She is also grateful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to the development of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara insumos para preparar sus comidas (arroz, azúcar, aceite).

loans.name: Camino A La Santidad - Group 2

texts.en:
The members of this group are embarking on their second loan as clients of Esperanza International.

Yane D. L. R., their group representative, is 39 years old and single. She has some high school education.

Yane has a small colmado (convenience store). Her customers generally purchase the food items they need for every meal only when they need them, because they don't have refrigerators in their homes. Due to this daily sale model, she must have her business well stocked.

The best-selling items in the colmado are rice, beans, oil, and candy. Some of her clients have "accounts" and pay her on paydays, which is a challenge for her (collecting payments).

Yane believes that being a client of Esperanza will be a blessing to her life. She also wants to have a car of her own to move around and get her supplies.

Please help us support these entrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy consumer goods to resell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John N. sells stationeries and provisions such as Milo, milk, sugar and other assorted provisions in Abotoase near Hohoe. John has received tertiary education.  He is married and has 5 dependants. His wife is a petty trader who earns little for a living. He is responsible for taking care of the financial needs of the dependant. His loan will be used to buy more stationery and provisions to sell. He hopes to reinvest the new profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy stationery and provisions for resale

loans.name: Presentacion Jesus

texts.es: El Señor Presentación Jesús Álvarez Áreas, tiene  45 años de edad. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, debido a la situación económica que el presenta ninguno de sus hijos estudia. Su actividad económica es el destace y la venta de cerdo. Hace más de seis años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo del negocio y con forme paso el tiempo se fue instruyendo en este tipo de actividad, debido a las circunstancia su mama presento problemas de salud por lo que él se hizo cargo del negocio y toda la popularidad que poseía la obtuvo por medio de su madre,  pesar de las dificultades que enfrento a como es la crisis económica es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo como es la compra de maíz, masa, leña entre otras cosas. El mayor sueño de Presentación  es de ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de él y poder dejarles este medio de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
45-year old Señor Presentación Jesús Álvarez Áreas has four children in his care. Due to his financial situation, not one of the children is in school. He earns his living by butchering pigs and selling pork, a job he has been doing for more than seven years. Beforehand, his mother was in charge of the business, and as time passed she taught her son how to do the work. When she got sick, her son took over the business--its popularity is due to the efforts of his mother. Because of the difficulties that Presentación has faced such as the economic crisis, he is seeking a loan for working capital and to buy corn, masa (corn flour), firewood etc. His greatest dream is to expand and improve his business so that his children can continue this way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Shadrach

texts.en: Shadrach is 44 years old and married with eight children. He sells electrical materials. Shadrach hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more electrical materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Ayovi

texts.fr: Cette femme souhaite avoir un prêt de WAGES pour donner une nouvelle orientation à son commerce de charbon de bois qu’elle exerce  dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé depuis 1992. Avec ce prêt, elle pourra acheter 25 sacs de charbon de bois et couvrir aussi ses frais de transport vers le lieu d'approvisionnement.Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman hopes for a loan from the micro-finance group WAGES, to give a new direction to her business of wood charcoal. This has been her business in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé since 1992. With this loan, she will be able to buy 25 bags of wood charcoal and pay for its transportation to her place of business.

She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood charcoal

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma P. is from the village of Gango Rizal, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Thelma operates a sari-sari (general) store where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Thelma has had the store for over 20 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

Thelma recently joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from GDMPC, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her shop.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her shop.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elise S. is a 34-year-old dedicated mother who aims to help her husband support their family and provide for the future of her two young children, ages one and five years old. She hopes that by providing them with a better education, they will be able to help her and her husband in their old age. 

Elsie and her family live in Hacienda San Jose Baling, Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Her husband buys and sells livestock in neighboring towns. Elsie became engaged in food vending to supplement her husband's income. Grilled food is popular among Filipinos, and Negros in particular is famous for its barbecue chicken. Hence, Elsie decided to offer her clients a wide variety of grilled and barbecued food served hot off the grill. Elsie bought charcoal in bulk for her food business, and now also sells that to her neighbors to make extra money. 

For two years, Elsie has enjoyed tending to her food business and helping her husband support their family. Her business earns an extra PHP6,000 per month. Elsie conscientiously divides her income, setting aside a certain amount for her children's future and to budget for her family's needs. She invests the rest of her money back into her business, and is a good money manager. She paid off her last loan, taken out for PHP15,000, with no problems. 

Now on her seventh loan, Elsie wants to borrow PHP16,000 so that she can purchase livestock, which she intends to raise and sell in the future. The income from this venture will again be saved for her children's education and to make repairs to her house. In this photo, Elsie is posing near her food business with a display of barbecued chicken parts, hot dogs and bread on a stick.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des planches

loans.name: John Bosco's Group

texts.en: K. John Bosco is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a very hardworking and friendly man. He is 38 years old and married with 2 children, both of whom are in primary school; he also takes care of 2 dependants. He has had a retail shop in the Nyarukika trading centre for 15 years, where he is able to make 120,000 as profits a week. This is mostly attributed to the use of the loans that enabled him to have a variety of items in the shop. In the future, John Bosco would want to sell wholesale so that he could sell more and consequently have a happy and united family. He is seeking for a loan to be able buy more products for his shop so as to avoid shortages.

loans.use: restocking his shop

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María vive en la casa de sus padres, no tiene hijos, es soltera y cuenta con 29 años de edad. Cuenta con la actividad de servicio de baño público con 4 años de experiencia en el rubro. Tiene bastante demanda y también cuenta con competencia ya que existen varios baños públicos que quedan ubicados en una avenida troncal de la provincia donde vive. El destino del crédito fue para capital de inversión, es decir para la adquisición de bienes y alimentos que servirán para la apertura del nuevo negocio de Ana María (negocio de comida). Cuenta con experiencia crediticia en Agrocapital y otra entidad financiera, este crédito es el tercero en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Ana Maria lives with her parents; she has no children, is single, and is 29 years old. She services public toilets, and has 4 years of experience in this line of work. There is sufficient demand, but also there is competition, since there are various public toilets that are located in the main avenue in the province where she lives. This loan was used for capital investment; that is, she bought different goods and foods to open another, new business selling food. She has experience with credit from Agrocapital and another financial entity; this loan is her third from our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to open a new business selling food

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: C. Florentine est née en 1950 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Florentine vit depuis sa naissance au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou. Mariée à GOGAN GNANHOUI Boniface, un greffier au Tribunal, Florentine est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Florentine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Florentine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis 4 ans, afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Florentine vend des habits pour enfants et des sacs. Florentine vend ses articles par le système de distribution et s'approvisionne à Lomé, capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. En vue d'agrandir son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Florentine sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
C. Florentine was born in 1950 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Since birth, she has been living in the Gbégamey district in Cotonou. Married to GOGAN GNANHOUI Boniface, a Tribunal clerk, Florentine is the mother of six children, who are all in school. Three of the children are in her care. She lives alone with her children and is the sole support of the family. She halted her studies in secondary school. For four years, to provide for her children, she has been selling bags and clothing for children. She sells her goods through the distribution system. She stocks up in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans. With the aim of expanding her business and satisfying her customers further, she’s requesting another ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for children and some bags

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Rodolfo, tiene aproximadamente 30 años de experiencia con el servicio de torneria, el comenzo teniendo solamente un torno donde actualmente tiene ya 4 tornos. El trabaja realizando muñones para automoviles y accesorios de ese tipo para automoviles grandes y pequeños, gracias a este negocio el logro sacar profesionales a sus dos hijas y una que ya esta por concluir su carrera. El credito destinara a la compra de fierro fundido para la fabricacion de piezas.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo has approximately 30 years of experience in providing lathing services. He started his business with only one machine, but he now has 4 lathes. Most of the items he produces are automobile parts and accessories for both large and small vehicles. Thanks to his business, his two daughters are close to finishing their degrees and able to become professionals. This loan will be used to buy cast iron for making parts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cast iron for making parts

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people in her region. Alice is a trader. She trades in food stuffs such as maize, cassava, etc. She buys from nearby communities and treks to sell in nearby towns. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y a la producción de leche  que comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Sullcataca Baja de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposo, el cual colabora en los trabajos y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Modesta raises cattle and sells the milk to Pil Andina, the leading milk supplier in Bolivia. She lives in Sullcataca Baja, in the Los Andes province, located three hours from the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who helps with the cattle. She will use this loan to purchase a better type of dairy cow and increase her milk production, thus increasing her income. This is her first loan with Impro; her evaluation indicates she qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor D. Kactus II” desD. hace 1 año, vive en el distrito y provincia D. Huancané, departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años D. edad, está casada y  tiene 06 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta D. abarrotes.

Felipa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es ampliar su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Felipa has been a member of the community bank "Cactus Flower II" for one year, she lives in the district and province of Huancane, department of Puno, she is 51 years old, married and has six children. She finished elementary school, she sells groceries. Felipa tells us that with the first loan requested to Manuela Ramos of 500 soles, she was able to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to buy: rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. Her dream for the future is to expand her business and see her children become professionals. What she likes the most about the community bank is having savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna DIATTE est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et a eu une bonne expérience en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. Elle est vendeuse de jus de citron et d'huile de palme. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la santé et scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Anna DIATTE, 55, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for 5 years and has had a great experience with loans and in her field of endeavor. She sells lemon juice and palm oil. Her goal is to participate in paying for her children's schooling and in keeping them healthy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little business

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike has a good relationship with LAPO. She sells daily from 7am until 7pm. She sells drinks and groceries ranging from toothpaste to noodles. She has been in this business for a long time. She uses her experience in business to attract and retain more customers to her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a shopping mall in the future. She is 30 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is seven years old and the youngest is five years old. Her children are making progress in school. Her husband is a pastor and he supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Orquidea Group

texts.es:
El grupo Orquídea está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras provenientes de  Masaya conocida como Ciudad de la Flores. La  coordinadora del grupo es la señora Cándida Paulina Velázquez  quien desde hace 8 años tiene un vivero el cual ha ido creciendo y mejorando. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de rosas, pinos, ciprés, esqueletos, helechos…et. 

Las otras integrantes son María Auxiliadora G. Velázquez quien vende ropa y Ángela de Carmen G. vende cosméticos. Ambas desean que sus negocios crezcan y se desarrollen.
texts.en:
The Orquídea (Orchid) group is made up of three women who are from Masaya, known as the City of Flowers. The group coordinator is Cándida Paulina Velázquez who, for the last 8 years, has had a nursery which has been growing and improving consistently. She will use the funds to buy roses, pines, cipresses, ferns, trellises, etc. The other members are: María Auxiliadora G. Velázquez, who sells clothing and Ángela de Carmen G., who sells cosmetics. Both want their businesses to grow and develop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plants like: roses, cypresses, pine, ferns, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the village of Brgy.Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Erlinda is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Phy

texts.en: Mrs. Phy Y. is a widow who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She earns about $2.50 per day from her rice-farming business. Phy Y. has five children, so she has heavy responsibilities. Two of her children help by doing sewing work in a clothing factory but they find it hard traveling to work because they don't have a vehicle. Because of this problem, Phy Y. is requesting a loan to buy a used motorcycle which will enable her children to commute to their work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en: Krouch T., 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is a farmer and grows rice for an income of about USD 1 per day. Her husband is an electronics repairman, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  T. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 39-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three children. He is the only income provider for his household. He has been working as a construction worker specializing in bricks and stones for the past ten years. He has one person who works with him part-time. He works on a freelance basis, which makes him flexible to serve customers in his region. 

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new tools for his construction work. He estimates that he will increase his profit by 15% after taking this loan. This will be his second loan from Ameen. He was a reliable client for his last loan with only one late payment. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his construction work

loans.name: Hugo Ramón

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo  es soltero y vive aún  con sus padres.
Tiene su local de trabajo en el domicilio de sus padres. 
El consiguió con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo todo lo que tiene.
Con la ayuda de sus padres y toda la familia montó para su propia herrería, en la cual consigue trabajos que le proporcionan buen ingreso y satisfacción por parte de los clientes.
Él trabaja en forma ambulante obteniendo así más clientes, con su eficacia y dedicación, ya que lleva sus herramientas para realizar su labor en los domicilios de sus clientes.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos, por lo que necesita el apoyo de nuestra institución para la compra de hierro que esta necesitando para los pedidos  que tiene.
texts.en:
Hugo is single and lives with his parents. His workshop is located in their home. He has earned all he has through sacrifice and hard work. With the help of his parents and family, he started his own blacksmith shop, and completes jobs that bring a good income for him as well as satisfaction for his customers. He works on the move to get more clients with his effectiveness and dedication, carrying his tools with him so he can work right in his clients' homes. He has shown himself to be a responsible, honest person in his commitments. He needs the help of this institution to purchase the iron he needs to fill his orders.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old woman who is married with four children aged 15, 13, 8 and 6 years. She and her husband combine to make ends meet for their family of six people living in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda.

Rose has a retail shop in which she sells sugar, rice and other domestic items. She started her business with very little capital but it’s growing gradually over time and she hopes to have it grow even bigger. Rent for premises is ever-increasing and that poses one of her biggest challenges as she conducts her business, in addition to hawkers who take their products near to the customers.

Rose is to use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, soap, rice and cooking oil for her shop

loans.name: Dénise

texts.fr:
Mariée , mère de 6 enfants et âgée de 44ans, cette dame exerce la vente du poisson salé comme le faisait sa maman.elle a commencée avec la vente des  divers condiments et assaisonements, oignons, ails ,boites de tomates, poivres,thym, cubes de bouillons.elle a avait un capital de 25000f, son niveau d'étude est moyen.
le prêt actuel  lui permettra de d'agrandir son activité en achétant: 3cartons de thon, 3cartons de capitaine, 3cartons morue.Elle est dans un quartier ou le poisson salé est beaucoup mangé, pour cela , elle compte réaliser beacoup de bénéfice.
Si elle ne tombe pas sur du mauvais poisson salé, elle vend  entre 45000f à 50000f par jour.Son but avec cette institution de micro-finance est d'aller plus loin dans les affaires et aider ses voisines dans la gestion de leurs activités.
Ses rêves  sont ,être grossiste, voyager pour connaitre  d'autres creneaux d'achats de poisson salé,construire une boutique  de vente de poisson sale en gros et  soutenir ses enfants a faire des longues etudes . 
Dans son milieu  , on pense qu'elle est calme, on l' appelle mama tranquile.
texts.en:
Married, the mother of six children and 44 years of age, this woman is in the business of selling salted fish, just as her mother used to do. She started selling different condiments and seasonings, such as onions, garlic, canned tomatoes, peppers, thyme, and bouillon cubes. She had a starting capital of 25000 Central African Francs; she has received secondary education. The current loan will allow her to expand her activities by purchasing three boxes of tuna, three boxes of bream and three boxes of cod. She lives in a neighborhood where salted fish is eaten a lot, and because of this she counts on earning a good income. Unless some of the fish she had purchased turns to be bad, her sales range from 45000 to 50000 Central African francs per day. Her goal in partnering with this microfinance institution is to take her business to the next levels and to help her neighbors with their business. Her dream is to become a wholesaler, travel to discover other good markets for purchasing salted fish, build a shop for selling salted fish wholesale and support upper-level studies for her children. In her neighborhood, she has a reputation for being a calm person; she is nicknamed “the tranquil mama.”

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing boxes of salted fish (tuna, bream, cod)

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 30-year-old young lady who operates a salon and lives in Hoima, Uganda. Jackline is married to a businessman. She takes care of her parents and she is currently residing in a rented house. She says building her own residential home is a dream she is working on. Jackline has been in the salon business for six years now. She says that constant power cutoffs affect her business since there are some clients she can’t handle without electricity. She says in the future, she hopes to sell only braids and cosmetics as her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase hair braids and cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.use: To purchase hair braids and cosmetics

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa M. lives in the village of Biasong. She is 32 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa fishes and sells her catch to people in her local community. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2004, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans from PMPC and is now applying for a new one, for 30,000 PHP, to invest in her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue improving and expanding her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Mario Ruben

texts.es:
Mario Ruben N. V. tiene 30 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Chillanes en la provincia Bolivar. Tiene 3 hijos de 6, 3, y 2 anos. 

Mario es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Jacinto. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Mario se dedica a la agricultura. Al mes gana 140 dolares. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Matilde. 

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el cultivo de cacao. El credito lo ayudara en sacar adelante su negocio. Su sueno es tener una casa, un carro, y un terreo. Se desafia por las cuasas que cae las lanchas en el cacao. 

Le gusta jugar deportes como el boli, el futbol. Su costumbre favorita de su cantón es las fiestas de Recinto Val Paraíso.
texts.en:
Mario Ruben N. V. is 30 years old. He lives in a common-law marrige in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolivar province. He has three children, ages 6, 3, and 2. Mario is a member of the San Jacinto community bank. There are 15 members in all, and the majority work in agriculture. Mario works in agriculture. He earns 140 dollars a month. He makes purchases and sells his products in Matilde. He is applying for the loan to invest in cocoa farming. The loan will help him advance his business. His dream is to have a house, a car, and a piece of land. His greatest challenge is when the cocoa freezes. He likes to play sports like volleyball and football. His favorite custom in his canton is the fiestas in the Val Paraíso. precinct.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant cocoa

loans.name: Tamemsu Rogbaneh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tamemsu Rogbaneh group. They are women with small-scale businesses in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone.

This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and make better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their school fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Marie Father K. (on the left) is the leader of this group. The forty-year-old was born in Makeni. She is married to a painter and they have four children: one is in secondary school, another is in college, and the rest are no longer attending school.

Marie sells groundnuts (peanuts), rice, etc., and has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will add more groundnuts and rice to her stock.

loans.use: To add more groundnuts and rice to her stock

loans.name: Obaldina

texts.es:
Obaldina es socia del Banco Comunal Chaska Lucero.
Obaldina es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Obaldina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, mantas y ropa típica y de las ferias compra cereales que luego comercializa en el mercado Nery, en algunas oportunidades hace papa seca y hace molidos dependiendo de la demanda.
Obaldina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de mandiles.
Obaldina tiene como objetivo mejorar su negocio y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Obaldina is a member of the Chaska Lucero communal bank. Obaldina is married and has 6 children. She travels to different fairs in the region to sell a variety of garments, like ponchos and traditional clothing. At the fairs, she purchases cereals to later sell at the Nery market. On some occasions, she makes dried, ground potato, depending on the demand. Obaldina needs a loan of 1000 PEN ($375 USD) to purchase aprons. Obaldina has as an objective to improve her business and have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase aprons.

loans.name: Maximino

texts.en:
Maximino F. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Maximino owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maximino has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Maximino joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for his rice and other supplies that he needs. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for rice and other supplies

loans.name: Namperi

texts.en:
Namperi S. J. is a married lady with three children aged between 5 and 13 years. Her business is located at a busy market in Mariakani, Mombasa, Kenya, and is well-known by the name Namperi Cereals. 

Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and it is well-known for its many, many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean's white beaches. 

She has been selling such items as maize and french beans for the last 10 years to the local people. She has managed to employ one person. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the slow movement of stock in some seasons. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to diversify her business by buying cabbages and carrots to resell at a profit. She hopes to be the largest supplier of cereals in Mariakani. She also sees herself buying a car to help her transport the cereals in future. She describes herself as focused.

loans.use: Potatoes and carrots

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es: Mirna Patricia desde sus inicios se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Tiene 24 años, Es una mujer muy activa y alegre que le encanta su trabajo. Se dedica a la venta y compra de bananos, desde hace 10 años que tiene este medio de vida. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche pues con la ayuda de su familia que anteriormente tenían a cargo el negocio y ahora le pertenece a ella. Este crédito lo va a emplear en compra de bananos ya que tiene ciertos pedidos y se acercan los meses que mas ventas tiene. El sueño de ella es proporcionarle mejoras a  su casa y mantener activo el negocio.
texts.en: Mirna Patricia has, from the very beginning, been concerned about improving her profits.  She has two young children in her care.  She is 24 years old.  Mirna is a very active and happy woman who loves her work.  She is in the business of buying and selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  She works from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 9 at night with the help of her family who used to run the business which now belongs to her.  This loan will be used to buy bananas since she has existing orders and the months in which she has most sales are approaching.  Her dream is to be able to improve her house and keep her business active.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del barrio Santa Librada  surgió por promoción  realizada en la zona. 
Todas las integrantes se encuentran trabajando y también realizando actividades que puedan generarles ingresos y de esa manera ayudar a sus familias.
Las mujeres de este comité son muy trabajadoras y se sienten muy contentas de formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Evelín quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles y de esa manera obtiene su ingreso diaria. 
Ella todos los días elabora sus comestibles especialmente empanadas que es lo que más se consume y por lo tanto es fácil de vender, también hace sopa y otros. 
Comenta que obtiene buena ganancia, y que desea seguir trabajando, solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne, harina, aceite, verduras, y otros. 
Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser: venta de comidas, venta de mercaderías comestibles, venta de frutas y verduras, Copetín,  venta de ropas, puesto de ventas  de pollos.
texts.en:
This group from the Santa Libraria neighborhood got together following promotional activities conducted in the area. All members work and also carry out revenue-generating activities to help their families. The women in this committee are hard workers and are very happy to be part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs program.

One of the members is Mrs. Evelin. She sells food preparations, which provides her with a daily income. Every day she prepares her food products, especially empanadas, which are what is most consumed and therefore easy to sell. She also makes soup and other preparations.

She comments that her income is good and that she wishes to continue working. She is seeking a loan so she can purchase meat, flour, oil, vegetables, and other items..

All of the women are engaged in productive activities such as : point-of-sale for chickens, fast food stands (copetín), and the sales of food, edible goods, fruit and vegetables, or clothing.

loans.use: Buy meat, flour, oil, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Karina Silvana

texts.es:
Karina Silvana M. A. tiene 21 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y los hijos viven  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS SOMO MAS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Marañon, por la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol. 

Karina se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y ponerse un negocio.
Le gusta ir a misa los domingos.
texts.en:
Karina Silvana M. A. is 21 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she lives with her life-partner and child in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Unidos Somos Más” (United We Are More) Communal Bank are located in the Marañon precinct of the Puerto Pechiche parish belonging to the Pueblo Viejo canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to the short cycle of growing corn, rice, and beans.

Karina has been growing crops, especially corn, rice, and beans, for two years.  She buys the products at the López business in Ventanas, and she sells her products at the Ventanas market in the same precinct.

She is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her  get the necessary supplies.  She faces challenges like pest infestations, illnesses, and climate changes.  Her dream is to buy a house and set up a business.

She likes to go to mass on Sundays.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a tailoring business from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. The major challenge Mercy faces in her business is seasonality. She hopes to establish a big tailoring shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Azucena Margarita

texts.es:
Azucena, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, donde vive con su madre, no tiene hijos ni hermanos, ella tienen 25 años de edad, administra un negocio de frutas y verduras, este negocio es de familia y lo tienen desde hace 10 años, quien al principio lo inicio fue una tía y luego se lo heredo a Azucena.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio comprando frutas y verduras, este préstamo ayudara a que posea diversidad de productos y atienda de una mejor manera la demanda generada por los clientes.
Sueña con ser una gran comerciante, que a través de los préstamo pueda darle el desarrollo deseado al negocio para que este sea reconocido en el lugar y cuente con la preferencia de los clientes, también en el ámbito familiar quiere seguir proveyendo para su madre todo lo necesario para la alimentación y gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Azucena lives with her mother in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She is 25 years old and has no children nor siblings.  She has been operating the family-owned fruit and vegetable business for the last ten years since inheriting it from an aunt.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables and to broaden her product base in order to meet customer demand.

She would like to become an important merchant in the area and use future loans to become well-known among her customers.  She also wants to provide a good income to cover all of her mother's needs and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: David Ruto

texts.en:
David Ruto K., 52 years old, is married to Margaret Ruto and he is a father of three children. David has been farming on his own piece of land for the last fifteen years. 
  
David learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. Maize has proved to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. David plans to use the anticipated profits from the proceeds of this loan to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of maize. His hope and dream is to export maize overseas. David is an industrious man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juntas Si Podemos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Juntas si Podemos inicia su quinto ciclo con 14 socias que tienen diferentes negocios, Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal, tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Paulina tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, solicita un préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, harina para surtir su mercadería.
Paulina está en Finca desD. hace cuatro ciclos, le gusta por las reuniones que tiene con sus compañeras D. banco y por las capacitaciones que reciben.
Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: The communal bank "Juntas si podemos" is beginning its fifth period with fourteen members of various businesses.  Paulina is one of the communal bank's members.  She is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  Paulina has a grocery store in her home and is taking out a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and flour to stock her merchandise.  Paulina has been with Finca for four periods and likes the meetings she has with her companions in the bank as well as the trainings they receive.  Her dream is for her business continue to prosper and for her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Shogher

texts.en:
Shogher D. was born in Azerbaijan and lived there until 1988.  She now  lives in Aghavnavank village in the Ijevan area. Shogher is a widow and has 3 daughters who are all married and live independently. 

Shogher worked as a librarian for the village administration, but she was dismissed last month on the grounds of redundancy.  Since 2003,  Shogher has  been raising cattle and managing a little food and household goods shop located in her home.  These occupations help Shogher finance her living expenses, and paid for her daughters' education as well as organized their weddings. 

Shogher said that the majority of her customers are retirees and can visit her shop twenty-four hours a day because there is no another shop in that area.
   
Shogher needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy more pigs for her farm, to organize the sowing of fodder, and to increase her shop’s assortment of goods.
 
This is Shogher’s second loan from Kiva.  She used her first Kiva loan to buy fodder for her farm animals, some cows, and merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: To buy pigs for her farm, sow fodder, and increase shop’s inventory

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en:
H. Gulom is 28 years old. He is married and has three children. Gulom is a conscientious worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most. Gulom requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of cattle he keeps. His goal is to increase his production and thereby increase his household income in addition to being solvent in order to continue working at buying and selling animals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Darling Aracely

texts.es: Darling Aracely tiene 28 años, esta no es la primera vez que ha solicitado créditos, pues es una persona muy responsable y que disfruta de su actividad. Su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general tiene más 10 años en este negocio, pues la experiencia que ha adquirido con la mayoría de sus clientes ya que le solicitan diferentes productos y ella siempre se esfuerza por complacerlos. Solicita este crédito para la compra de cremas, tratamientos, polvos, calzado y cosméticos. A pesar de los diferentes problemas como es la visita que les realiza a sus clientes a sus diferentes lugares de trabajo y viviendas, pero aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo.
texts.en: Darling Aracely is 28 years old. This is not the first time she has applied for a loan, and thus is a very responsible person who enjoys her work. Her business is the sale of general merchandise. She has more than ten years of experience with this business, and many of her clients have been with her for a long time. They ask for different products and she always works to make her clients happy. She is asking for this loan in order to buy creams, treatments, powders, shoes and cosmetics. Despite the different problems she faces in visiting her clients in the various places where they live and work, she knows that she has to do it.

loans.use: to buy creams, treatments, powders, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Aneth T., who is in her early forties, is married with three children.  She has been running a general store for two years.  She works from 6.00am to 9.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Aneth's sixth loan from Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the shop inventory and to pay school fees. She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to again increase the shop inventory.  Her dream is to one day own a grocery and sell just soft drinks.

Aneth will share this loan with her loan group "Unity", which has a total of fifteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Aneth is first on the right with a dark blouse.

loans.use: to increase her shop inventory.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 27 years old. She lives in the Jacob’s Town Area. She was dropout at seventh grade. She has three children already and her husband's less paid job as a teacher cannot afford them a better living.

Mamie decided to get in the charcoal business so as to generate income for her and her family. To date, she has her own charcoal shop and sells others fruits like pineapple and orange amongst others.

Mamie is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, fruits and even vegetables for her shop. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman who will be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, fruits and vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Rosario Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosario, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 12  años de edad, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. El marido es artesano, él se dedica a elaborar figuras y artesanías con tagua en distintos modelos.

Es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana en sus ventas y los fines de semana se dedica a preparar comida para un centro de eventos de la ciudad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio 7 años y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos como perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y cosméticos. También productos para el negocio de su marido como lijas, tagua y discos para pulir. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Light of America Cooperative Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarind.

Here is where we find Rosario, 39 years of age and in a common-law-marriage that has produced three children ages 18, 17, and 12.  The oldest is studying at university, and the younger ones are in school.  Her husband is an artisan, dedicating himself to making a variety of figurines and carvings from tagua (commonly known as “vegetable ivory”).

She is a great homemaker who dedicates herself to selling products from the Yanbal line (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women).  She sells three days per week, and on the weekend she works making food for an events center in the city.  She delivers her products on credit, collecting every week or fifteen days depending on what her customers want.  She tells us she’s been in business for 7 years and that things are going very well.

This loan is to buy products such as perfumes, creams, jewelry and cosmetics.  She would also like to buy products for her husband’s business such as sandpaper, tagua, and grinding plates.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank for two years, and enjoys it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, jewelry, cosmetics, sandpaper, tagua and grinding plates.

loans.name: Cori Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Cori es socia del banco comunal Shipibas del Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 24 años de edad y un hijo pequeño, su esposo pertenece a la Marina del Perú.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de chanchos (cerdos), que los compra en las chacherías para traerlo a la ciudad y venderlo vivo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,300.00 nuevos soles, comprará  3 chanchos para venderlo en el camal.
A pesar de la edad que tiene ha visto un buen negocio y lo está sabiendo aprovechar muy bien porque la carne de cerdo esta a buen precio.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido tener un capital de trabajo para poder comenzar, de esa manera también ayudar a su esposo y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Cori is a member of the Shipibas community bank in the Calleria District, Ucayali Department. She is 24 years old and has a young son. Her husband belongs to the Peruvian navy.
She has been working for 2 years with loans from Manuela Ramos. She buys and sells hogs, which she buys at the butcher shops to bring to the city and sell live.
With her new loan of 2,300 nuevos soles, she will buy 3 hogs to sell at the slaughterhouse.
Despite her age, she has had a good business and knows how to make the most of it because pork is at a good price.
Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she has been able to get working capital to get started, thus also helping her husband and getting her family ahead.

loans.use: purchase live hogs.

loans.name: Gloria Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Alejandra es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad tres hijos los cuales actual mente están estudiando. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar los gasto D. la titulacion, graduación D. sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para liquidar estos pagos y que se puedan terminar bien los estudios. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe por cuidar y atender a una persona mayor D. edad y limpieza D. la casa. Es la fuente D. ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Doña gloria Alejandra ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Alejandra is a single mother who is responsible for her three school-age children. She is requesting a loan to pay her children’s educational expenses. Her children are being promoted, but she does not have the necessary funds to pay their tuition so that they can successfully complete their studies.

She plans to repay the loan with the salary she receives for taking care of an elderly person and cleaning houses. Doña Gloria Alejandra is the breadwinner of her family. She has had three previous loans with FVP/Credituyo that were repaid on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita  is from Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Esterlita is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Esterlita plants and harvests bananas for sale. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost for farm maintenance. This will be the third loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Beira,  Provincia de Sofalo, centro de Moçambique separada e maê de 2 fillhos de 06 e  11 anos de idade e todos vaõ a Escola. Esta frequentando 12ª classe na Escola comunitaria da polana cimento. Vive na casa propria com os seus filhos e as vezes tem ajudado a sua maê enviando algum dinheiro para as despasas correntes.
Saiu da Beira para Maputo com o seu pai ainda menor  quando este foi transferido pelos serviços. Apos a separação com o seu marido inicia um negocio proprio de venda de carne, o qual faz entrega ao domicilio ha mais de 03 anos. No seu negocio naõ possui empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Ja efectou um emprestimo no NOVO BANCO e fechou sem problemas, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de sua prima que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 17.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mais carne como forma de responder a demanda da sua clientela.
Espera pagar sem problemas e o seu sonho é de ampliar a seu negocio para poder custear as despesas da sua educação e a dos filhos e para tal conta com os proximos emprestimos da Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Olga was born in Beira city, Sofalo Province in central Mozambique. She is separated and has 2 children, 6 and 11 years old, and both go to school. Olga is attending 12th grade at the Polana Cimento community school. She lives in her own house with her children and sometimes helps her mother by sending her some money for her current expenses.

When she was still young, Olga left Beira to move to Maputo with her father when he was transferred for work. After separating from her husband, she began her own business selling meat, and she has been making home deliveries for more than three years. She has no employees for her business and earns around 8,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account.

She has already had a loan from Novo Banco and paid it without problems. She learned about Hluvuku through her cousin, who is also a customer of this institution. This is her first loan, and she is asking for 17,000 meticais. She will use it to buy more meat in order to respond to demand from her customers.

Olga expects to make the payments without any problems, and her dream is to expand her business so she can cover educational expenses for herself and her children. To do so, she is counting on having more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy and sell staple goods.

loans.name: Kimsruon

texts.en:
Kimsruon, 38, sells Cambodian cake and dessert in her village. Her husband Sokhrong, 39, is a construction worker. He also is hired by his fellow villagers to farm and get fees.
