Kimsruon and her husband live along National Road Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have three sons and two daughters. 

Kimsruon is asking for her first loan of $500 to add to her own money to build a new house in which to stay. 

Photo: Kimsruon and her husband.

loans.use: to add to her own money to build a new house in which to stay

loans.name: Two

texts.en:
Two, 56 year old, is a fish seller who earns $4 a day. Her husband is retired. She has two children, all of whom are working and earning $7 a day each. Every month she has to spend $165 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on rent and $30 on other expenses.

Two is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a car for her son’s taxi service. He had a car, but it is old and needs a lot of repairs, which cuts into his profits. Two also wants to repair her house and extend her fish-selling career wH. she has enough money.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son’s taxi service.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y tiene 6 hijos de 30, 27, 26, 21, 18 y 10 años de edad, ella administra una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, la inicio hace 10 años su madre y posteriormente fue heredado, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite y boquitas, este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y mejorar su inventario para poder atender la demanda de los clientes.
Su aspiración es mantener el negocio y que sus hijos terminen las carreras académicas, para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and they have six children (ages 30, 27, 26, 21, 18, and 10). She manages a store where she offers basic necessities. Ana started this business 10 years ago with her mother and later inherited all of the responsibilities. She works every day, Monday through Sunday.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, and snacks. This loan will help strengthen her business and improve her inventory so that she can meet the demand of her customers.

Her aspiration is to maintain her business so that her children can finish their academic degrees and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, and snacks.

loans.name: Dzingenhamo Group

texts.en:
This is Florence from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. This is her second Kiva loan. Florence raises chickens and also runs a flea market business selling pots, clothes, and fruit. She says the main challenge she faces is competition, but recently the business has significantly improved and she now has managed to employ one person. 

Florence has requested a loan of $400 to buy pots from South Africa where she visits regularly for procurement. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to build her own house and have a shop.

loans.use: to buy pots, clothes and fruit

loans.name: Liverpool Group

texts.en:
Subira, who is in her early 30's, is married with one child. She has been running a general store and airtime selling business for four years now. She works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase both businesses, for house expenses and school fees, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her store stock. Her dream is to one day be able to take her child to good schools.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Liverpool", which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase store stock.

loans.name: Laureano

texts.es:
Laureano tiene 68 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Laureano desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona donde vive, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha, contarà con otro ingreso para su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con ambos ingresos podrá pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Laureano es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Laureano, 68, lives with his wife and son in his own house which does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District belonging to Piura Department.  This zone’s activities are farming, raising livestock and crafts making.

For several years now, Laureano has been raising cattle (cows) to sell.  His corral is located in the outside of his house.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses so that they will have good milk production that he sells among the local residents in the area where he lives.  He has a regular clientele because of the good quality of the milk he has and his income allows him to cover family expenses.  He also has fields where he plants lemons and once they are harvested he has an additional source of household income.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer to improve his land and his crops.  With both incomes he will be able to repay the loan and improve his family’s quality of life.  Laureano is a hardworking, very responsible person whose only wish is that his children have better opportunities for schooling.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, age 34, raises hogs. Her husband is a farmer, and they help each other to support themselves and their two school-aged children. Her goal is to provide a good quality of life for her children. She believes that by providing for their educational needs, she can help them to succeed. “Education is the root of success," Wilma tells us, and this is why she is doing her best to see her children through until the end of their schooling. 

Even though she is often exhausted from hard work, Wilma remains strong and determined to work. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her current hogs. She is confident that this will contribute to the further growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for her hogs

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón está ubicado en el departamento de León y es una zona que se ha caracterizado por ser agropecuaria. Acá vive la señora Martha donde tiene una finca en la cual ha invertido mucho porque es un medio que le permite obtener el desarrollo para su vida.

Actualmente  acudió a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para dar lugar al mantenimiento de su finca, dicha reparación es necesaria hacerla lo más apronto posible y requiere la compra de materiales como lo es el  alambre y a su vez requiere el pago de mano de obra. Esto le permitirá obtener un mejor potencial de producción de leche en su inventario ganadero y así podrá continuar comercializándola en su localidad y sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is located in León Department and it’s a zone that’s noted for animal husbandry.  Martha lives here and she has a farm that she’s invested much into because it’s her source of support for her life’s development.

She called upon Ceprodel to request a loan to do some improvements on her farm.  She needs to carry out these repairs as soon as possible and needs to buy materials, like wire, and also to pay labor costs.  This will allow her to increase her potential for milk production from her dairy cattle to continue selling it in her location problem free.

loans.use: to buy wire and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Sandra Marina

texts.es: La Joven Sandra Marina tiene 34 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada clasificada, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, sus ventas las realiza de Lunes a sábado, tiene clientes fijos que viven en colonias aledañas a su casa de habitacion, así mismo sale a vender sus productos a otras colonias,  vende la ropa al crédito y cobra en quince días, cerca de su casa hay un supermercado y las empleadas tambien son clientes de ella, el credito lo utilizara para comprar fardo de ropa usada clasificada, nos cuenta que gracias a los ingresos que ha recibido de su negocio a podido mantener a una sobrina que se la dejaron desde que tenia 6 meses y actualmente tiene 3 años de edad. Tiene muchos planes para su negocio.
texts.en: Sandra Marina is a young woman of 34 who sells used clothing.  She has been in this business for several years.  She makes her sales from Monday to Saturday and has regular customers who live in surrounding neighborhoods.  She also goes out to some neighborhoods to sell her products.  She sells her clothes on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  There is a supermarket near her home and the employees there are also customers of hers.  Sandra will use her loan to buy a bundle of sorted used clothing.  She tells us that, thanks to the income that she has made from her business, she has been able to support a niece who was left with her when she was six months old and is now three years old.  Sandra has many plans for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of sorted used clothing

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es:
Bertha María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, cosméticos y productos escolares. Este negocio lo inicio hace 18 años con un pequeño tramo en el mercado local. Ella está casada su esposo es fontanero y tiene un hijo.
Ella invertirá en camisas, camisetas, bóxer y cuadernos.
texts.en:
Bertha María is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who sells underwear, cosmetics and school supplies.  She started her business 18 years ago with a small stand in the local market.  She is married and her husband is a plumber.  She has one son.

Bertha María will invest in buying shirts, t-shirts, boxer shorts and composition books.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shirts, t-shirts, boxer shorts and composition books)

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is married with one child. Amor is 29 years old and lives in Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City.

Amor is a farmer and grows coconut farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase home construction materials to finish her house. 

Amor has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Amor hopes to expand her coconut farm.

loans.use: to purchase home construction materials.

loans.name: Ma. Hennie

texts.en:
Ma. Hennie is 42 years old and has 10 children, five of whom are in school. Ma. Hennie is married.

Ma. Hennie is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Hennie requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Hennie has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Hennie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace has a shop that sells fish like sardines, mackerel and trout. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old and married with seven children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. 

Elsa has borrowed and reimbursed 18 loans from NWTF prior to this one. She has been running the sari-sari store for 24 years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Elsa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom is 36-years-old with 2 children who are school age. She is running business that focuses on buying and selling scrap products. She has run this kind of business for 5 years and has good  income from this. Participating in our credit program in 2008, she used loans as capital for expanding her purchasing activity. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 4,256,000 Vietnam dong to buy more  scrap products for selling

loans.use: to buy more  scrap products for selling.

loans.name: Thafer

texts.en:
Thafer, who is a 23-year-old young man, is a father to one son. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also has an entertainment store for playing pool and table games located in a good area.  

Thafer wants to expand his store by purchasing extra numbers of pool tables. He also wants to have a fridge for soft drinks so his costumers can enjoy drinking soft drinks while they are playing. 

He needs to take a loan from FATEN to pay for these items. When Thafer gets the loan, he will be able to increase the number of pool tables and offer soft drinks to his customers who are come daily to play. That will increase his income and improve his family's life conditions. Thafer is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase pool tables and a fridge for soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a special sewing machine.

loans.name: Paola Janhette

texts.es:
Paola tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, es una ciudad ubicada en la hermosa selva peruana, se caracteriza por su flora y fauna diversa así como también la generosidad y  amabilidad de sus pobladores. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar vóley con sus vecinas y amigas de su barrio, pero sobre todo le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche.  Paola es madre de un pequeño d e5 años a l quiere muchísimo y por el cual ella se esfuerza cada día con tal de verlo feliz y sobre todo tenga más oportunidades que ella.

Con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo Paola trabaja como profesora de educación inicial, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene mucha paciencia con los niños y porque le encanta lo que hace.

Paola está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y gracias a ello podrá comprar zapatos para el verano como sandalias, con lo cual podrá tener un ingreso extra y así seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y darle una buen calidad de vida a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Paola, 28, lives in the city of Pucallpa, located in the beautiful Peruvian jungle.  It's known for its diverse flora and fauna as well as for the generosity and friendliness of its residents.  When she has some spare time she very much likes to play volleyball with her neighbors and friends in the neighborhood.  Above all, though, she loves to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, a delicious ceviche.

Paola's the mother of a little one, age 5, whom she loves a lot.  She makes the effort every day to see him happy and especially for him to have more opportunities than she had.  Paola works with a lot of effort and enthusiasm as a primary school teacher.  She works around nine hours a day.  She believes it's going well for her in her job because she's very patient with the children and she loves what she does.

Paola's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it's the second time they've given her their great support.  Thanks to this she'll be able to buy summer shoes such as sandals to have an extra income and continue striving every day to be able to make her biggest dream a reality: "To have her own house and give her child a good quality of life."

loans.use: to buy summer shoes

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 21, works as a motorcycle taxi or “boda boda” driver in Kampala, Uganda. Motorcycle taxis are extremely popular in Uganda because they allow passengers to avoid being stuck in traffic and to navigate the country's rough roads. 

John  likes working as a boda boda driver, because he earns enough every day to meet his expenses and save a little money. 

John currently rents his motorcycle, but indefinite renting schemes make it difficult for drivers to build up savings. He is therefore excited to take a loan from Tugende because after paying it off his profits will double, as he will no longer have to pay rent or make loan payments. 

Outside of motorcycles, John likes watching commando movies and occasionally takes side jobs laying bricks. When he owns his own motorcycle he wants to use his extra money to buy land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle instead of renting, doubling his profits

loans.name: Edwin Osmir

texts.es:
Edwin de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es acompañado su esposa se dedica al comercio, son padres de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian.

El cliente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería tiene 20 años y lo aprendió de su tío quien le inculco este trabajo, el cultivo le queda a 10 minutos de su casa viaja a pie y con él se involucran su familia.

El préstamo lo invertirá, para comprar dos novillos para engordar y  luego venderlos, para  mejorar su vida. Desea, que el ganado tenga un buen desarrollo y que en un futuro tenga ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en: Edwin, 42, went to school until second grade. He is married to his wife, who works. They have three children, two of whom are in school. Edwin has worked as a farmer and rancher for twenty years, and he learned from his uncle, who instilled this work in him. His field is located ten minutes from his home. He travels by foot and his family is involved too. He will use the loan to buy two young bulls to fatten and later sell, in order to improve his life. He hopes that the cattle grow, and that in the future he has income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls for fattening up.

loans.name: Faruhjon

texts.en: Faruhjon was born in 1990 year. He is not married and lives with parents. Faruhjon works more than 7 months in a micro-finance organization. He works well. Also he continues his education in the university. He studies for getting master degree. His profession is an economist. Faruhjon’s salary is not enough for paying his tuition. So, he is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Solar Techno Enterprises (U) Ltd

texts.en:
Solar Techno Enterprises (U) Ltd is a clean energy social enterprise, fundamentally and philosophically inspired by the Kyoto Protocol Framework Convention on Climate Change of 1998.	
				 
Solar Techno is a renewable energy business enterprise by incorporation, in operation since 11th December 2011. Mr Floyd is a chairman of the company.  He started business in a small shop at the periphery of the town with not more than ten pieces of Firefly12, Mobiles Gen 2.0 lamps, and four pieces of PowaPack 5 Watts.       
                                                                                            
With a Kiva loan, Solar Techno are most certain to overcome the bottlenecks of this business, as follows:
  
1. A stock boost ensures continuous running capital income as we can engage part of stock to hire-purchase and part to cash sale, without risk of stock out.                                                             
                                                               
2. Wider community out-reach is possible with increased possible sales at boosted stock levels.

loans.use: buy and sell Barefoot Powers Solar Lighting

loans.name: Falilatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Falilatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un soudeur nommé Mousse. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Falilatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Falilatou  assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis sept ans, Falilatou vend des tissus. Falilatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Falilatou et les autres membres de son groupe sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with five children. Furaha keeps pigs.She supplies pork to various bars within her area.Pork has recently gain popularity in her area.It is used as a snack with beers.The demand has risen abruptly.In order to keep goodwill with her customers Furaha purchases some of the pork from other pig keepers.Furaha plans to increase the size of her pig flock. Pigs need a huge amount of working capital to raise.They demand a sufficient stock of feeds and medications.Furaha also plans to employ one assistant to take charge of the increased stock. To implement her plans she is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: INCREASE THE FLOCK OF PIGS AND WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Afi Eva

texts.en:
Ms. Afi Eva Z. was born in 1949 in Lomé, in the Golfe prefecture. She is a married mother of five who also takes care of two other people. Her elderly husband can no longer meet the family's needs, so she must do so alone thanks to her years of experience in selling chickens. She has been in the business for 20 years and is very good at managing credit. As she does not have enough money to go to neighboring villages to buy chickens for resale in Lomé, she is requesting a loan of $600. Ms. Afi Eva Z. needs this loan in order to increase her income and take care of her children, who depend solely on her.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1949 à Lomé dans la préfecture du golfe, Madame Z. Afi Eva est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants avec deux personnes en charge. Son mari très vieux ne répond plus aux besoins de la famille. Grande commerçante de volaille très expérimentée, elle fait face toute seule aux besoins de la famille. Active depuis 20 ans, elle est très douée en gestion de crédit. Pour aller s’approvisionner en volailles dans les villages environnants et venir les revendre à Lomé, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 car ses fonds propres ne suffiront pas à le faire. Madame Z. Afi Eva a besoins de cet appui pour pouvoir améliorer son revenu et s’occuper de ses enfants laissés à sa charge.

loans.use: To buy chickens in neighboring villages and resell them in Lomé

loans.name: Nor Zia

texts.en:
nor zia lives in district 17 of Kabul Afghanistan she is married living with her husband she always wants to support her family and her husband is driver of water tanker he sale water for those peoples to they don’t have water he need for money and his wife’s wants to take a group of loan and her husband wants to make a new body for his car to expand his business and help his family and he would like to thank from AFSG to support them. 
Note; the picture featured in this business profile. Husband of entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur. AFSG only does group loans to woman.

loans.use: to change the body of car

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira lives in G. in Nuevo León. She is a very fast learning and active woman. She is married with 3 children; the youngest is 2 years old. They were her motivation for starting her own business more than a year ago. Her husband is a worker and his salary is not sufficient to cover their household costs. To help him with these costs Rosa started to sell homemade food which she delivers to people’s houses for which she has a lot of clients.

In order to keep her business growing Rosa needs a loan of $250 which she will use to buy ingredients to increase the variety of foods that she offers and to increase her sales. She promises to repay this loan over as period of 3 months. You can be a part of her achievements; she wants to improve the quality of life of her family and thanks to you it can be possible, don’t doubt, just support her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de G., Nuevo León vive Rosa Elvira ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, es casada y tiene tres hijos, el más pequeño es de sólo 2 años de edad, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio desde hace más de un año. Su esposo es obrero y su salario es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, para poder apoyarlo en los gastos Rosa empezó con la venta de comidas, ella elabora estos alimentos en su hogar y realiza entregas a domicilio, esto le ha permitido incrementar su clientela rápidamente.

Para poder continuar creciendo, Rosa necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos para incrementar la variedad de comidas que ofrece a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Forma parte en los logros de Rosa, ella desea poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, gracias a ti puede ser posible, no lo dudes más y apóyala.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe is married and has two children ages 10 and 12. He lives in Chahuira-Pampa two and a half hours from La Paz. He has two sources of income--baking bread and keeping dairy cows. PIL Andina, the local dairy, has recently begun buying more milk in the region so Felipe would like to borrow money to buy an improved-breed cow. This is his first loan from IMPRO. Our research shows he is credit-worthy.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Felipe es productor de leche de vaca mismo que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); también se dedica a la elaboración de pan en la comunidad, ingresos con los cuales mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 2 años. Vive en la Comunidad de Chahuira-Pampa ubicado a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara a la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche, pues la Planta PIL ha incrementado su demanda de leche en la region. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en: Mrs. Nirmala M. lives in Kulashwor with her husband and two daughters. Kulashwor is a very busy business center located in Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this town are engaged in business. Mrs. M.'s husband works at Gutam Finance in Kulashwor. Her older daughter is studying in primary school and her younger daughter is in lower primary school. The income of her husband is not enough to cover the household expenses. So, two years ago Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop. Now she seeks a loan to invest in her shop to buy grocery goods.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun has sold spare parts for 3 years. He is 22 years old and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. This single man needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of his shop and purchase spare parts.

loans.use: to expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Cristobalina

texts.en:
Cristobalina, a forty-three year old woman, owns and operates a general store in Los Alcarrizos, Santo Domingo.  She is a single mother of three children. 
Cristobalina is a living example of a hardworking and never-tiring person.  “Sometimes, you have to sacrifice yourself to achieve your goals,” she says as she explains that she had to leave her job to dedicate herself wholly to her new activity.  After two years of sacrifice and pain, she is experiencing success: well established clientele, a profitable business, and a more comfortable lifestyle for her family and so forth.
She wants to maintain this way of life.  With this loan, she will stock up the store so she can continue to satisfy her customers’ needs and attract new clients.

loans.use: the loan will be used to restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Kilieda

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbozi, Tanzania! This is 28 year old Kilieda K.. She is married with three children, aged 9, 4 and 1. In 1997, Kilieda established a retail shop, and now requires a loan to purchase an additional stock of goods. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed ‘un-creditworthy’ by financial institutions due to a lack of tangible collateral assets. Poor financial support results in poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a ‘sale and leaseback arrangement’.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of goods in bulk.

loans.name: Rooslan

texts.en:
Rooslan is married with a 16-year-old daughter. He and his family live in Uzhgorod, Ukraine. Rooslan rents an office and sells cell phones, accessories and offers cell phone repair services. His merchandise is relatively affordable and good quality. Rooslan provides good service in a timely manner and all his clients are very satisfied with the quality of his work. His wife helps him with the business. Her participation helps him to be mobile and flexible. Rooslan has been in this business for 6 years. Currently, his monthly profit is about $600.

Rooslan is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the loans he has received from Nadiya Ukraine, which have helped him expand his business. Today Rooslan is requesting a loan of $800 so that he can re-supply his inventory and purchase additional items at wholesale prices. The loan will benefit Rooslan’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth in order to continue providing necessary income for him and his family. Also, the profits generated will allow Rooslan to pay his daughter’s college fees, which would otherwise consume a big portion of the family budget.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of his mobile phone store

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz Marina is 33 years old, always proving to be a woman of great strength and great plans for her future and that of her children. With this grand plan for life in mind she is arduously dedicated to selling garments in the different markets in her native city, Juliaca. In her free hours, as not to waste time, she is engaged in the art of fine craftsmanship, knitting beautiful sweaters and vests for her beloved sons and in other opportunities for her relatives and friends, from whom she obtains the needed income for her home. Her loved children feel very proud, content and thankful for the marvelous and exemplary mother that they have and for her they try to make good grades. The desire of this valiant mother is to see her children become successful professionals; it is for this that she wants to increase the stock of her merchandise with the goal of generating more income. Your generous heart will permit her to realize her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz Marina de 33 años de edad, siempre demostró ser una mujer con mucha fortaleza y grandes planes para su vida futura y la de sus hijos, con este gran proyecto de vida en mente se dedica arduamente a la comercialización de prendas de vestir en las distintas ferias de su ciudad natal, Juliaca.En sus horas libres para no desaprovechar el tiempo se desempeña en el bello oficio de la artesanía, tejiendo hermosas chompas y chalecos para sus queridos hijos y en algunas oportunidades para sus familiares y amigos de los que obtiene indispensables ingresos económicos para su hogar.Sus queridos retoños se sienten muy orgullosos, contentos y agradecidos por la maravillosa y ejemplar madre que tienen, es por ello que con sus buenas notas tratan de corresponderle. El deseo de esta valiosa madre es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales de éxito, es por ello que desea aumentar el stock de su mercadería con el fin de generar mayores ingresos económicos. Tu generoso corazón permitirá concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Increase in capital to offer a greater quantity of articles of clothing

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: I am Seema A. M. and I have been married for 25 years. I have lived all my life in Lahore, a famous city of Pakistan.  I have three sons and one daughter.  My elder son completed grade ten and now has a private job, and the younger son to him has run a CD shop named J.S Music Video Center for the last 4 years. My other  two children attend a local school . My husband works in the Pakistan High Court. I do not work but remain at home and complete my household chores. I request a loan for my son, who wants to expand his CD business.

loans.use: Expand the CD Business

loans.name: Misirkhan

texts.en: Misirkhan Q. is a 47-year-old man who has sold women clothes and textiles in the local bazaar of Sabirabad region since 1982. He is married and has three children. Now is the high season for weddings and women are coming to the bazaar to purchase special dresses for weddings and other beautiful clothes. Misirkhan decided to catch this moment and purchase a lot of clothes which are in high demand now. All the money he earns goes to cover family needs and it is not enough to purchase a lot of clothes. So he has applied for 800 USD to expand the number of goods he sells and increase his income.

loans.use: Expand number of women clothes he sells

loans.name: Thi Y

texts.vi:
Mrs. Y Thi N., 31 years old, sells sesame rice crackers as her day job. Besides that she also works the fields and grows colorful flowers to supplement the family’s income. Her husband works in construction, and their average income is 200,000 VND per week. She has 3 children who are still in school. She is requesting 2,006,000 to invest in the business. She hopes to become a long-time participant in the loan program.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Y (MS: 020025), năm nay 31 tuổi. Hàng ngày chị đi bán bánh đa. N.ài ra chị chị còn làm ruộng và chồng hoa màu để tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Chồng chị làm xây dựng, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị là 200.000 VND/ tuần. Chị có ba con hiện đang đi học. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ. Chị rất muốn được tham gia chương trình lâu dài.

loans.use: invest in the crackers business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna has worked four years selling all types of wallets and purses that she offers to her neighbors door to door and in the schools. Little by little, she has increased her capital and her earnings. She is a mother of five, four of whom still live with her.

She hopes to have ample space to exhibit her products. At the moment she is having economic problems, and for this reason her husband had to go to work outside the city. Now, she is asking you for a loan which will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise. Support Reyna in continuing her work for the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Reyna trabaja hace 4 años vendiendo todo tipo de bisutería y carteras que ofrece a sus vecinas, de puerta en puerta y en los colegios, poco a poco ha ido incrementando su capital de trabajo y sus ganancias, es madre de 5 hijos, 4 de ellos aún viven con ella. Desea tener una local amplio donde pueda exhibir estos productos.En este momento está pasando por problemas económicos, por tal motivo su esposo tuvo que irse a trabajar fuera de la ciudad, ahora ella solicita ante ustedes un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de más mercadería. Apoya a Reyna a seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing a larger quantity of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth O. is 45 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Itegbe, Lagos state, Nigeria. Elisabeth has been selling kerosene since 2003. Kerosene is an essential commodity in Nigeria and is in high demand. Elisabeth needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María inició el negocio por necesidades económicas, para contar con mas recursos para los estudios de sus 2 hijas: Ángela de 15 años y Araceli de 14 años, ambas estudiantes. Comenzó hace 8 años vendiendo abarrotes en su domicilio, y poco a poco logre mejor su tienda ofreciendo una mayor cantidad de productos, lo que le permitió ampliarla y brindar un mejor servicio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener más surtido el negocio y hacerlo crecer. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Maria started her business due to economic necessity, to have the resources for her 2 daughters' studies: Angela, who is 15 and Araceli, who is 14 and are both students. Eight years ago she started selling groceries from her home, and bit by bit she improved her store offering a wider quantity of products which allowed her to expand her business and offer a better service.

She needs a loan of $375 USD, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, to buy merchandise and to have a better stocked business and for it to grow. With your help she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/comprar mercancia

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
Khadija has been selling juice and fish in Zanzibar since 2002. She works daily from 8:00am to 9:00pm and earns a profit of approximately $45 each month. She is taking out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more stock for her shop to increase her sales and profit.

Khadija is 50 years old, married, and has two children, aged 18 and 25. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwajuma, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more juice and fish to sell.

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en:
Salomey N. is a 31-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past 8 years, she has been a trader of clothes. Specifically, she runs her business by "hawking," which is door-to-door sales.

Salomey states that she is an overachiever and that her focus is to save enough money so that she can build a shop in which to display her goods. At present, however, she is seeking a loan to purchase additional used clothes in bulk to meet the demands of her customers.

She is a member of the community group known as the Angel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She notes that she does not sell any goods on days when her group meets, and that her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands by purchasing used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
“I believe that through faith and hard work, I will somehow achieve my dreams in life and I am always willing to wait for that right time,” Luciana says with her belief that in God’s time they will be blessed. Luciana C. is 39 years old and married to Hector, a diligent farmer. They have two children: Mark Anthony – 15 years old, a senior high school student and Melvin – 13 years old, a freshman in high school. Her family is living in the urban area of Old San Mariano, Isabela where they need to ride a ferry boat to when their place was being flooded.

She is operating a sari-sari store (a community based store) in their village. She is glad that she is earning a weekly income of PHP1, 000.00. However, this income is not enough to meet all the needs of their family. So Luciana would like to request a loan of PHP10, 000 to purchase more stocks for her store. This amount will definitely improve not only her business but also her income someday. Her business is of great help in their family and with the education of their children. She hopes to have a progressive family and through their diligence and hard work, everything is possible.

loans.use: Luciana would like to purchase more stocks for her store.

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Frisita's Group

texts.en: Frisita N. is the leader of the Victoria group, very hard working, and involved in the bar business. She makes the local brew herself with bananas and sells them both in retail to home customers as well as selling to other bar owners that are not able to make the brew themselves. She makes tonto and waragi, both delicacies of the local communities mostly enjoyed in the evenings after a hard day’s work. This is Frisita’s 34th loan and all of them have been helping her in her business as well as being able to buy other beers like Bell lager, Nile Beer and others made in big factories for increased income. She is also a farmer with matooke, cassava, and sweet potato plantains for home consumption and the excess is sold to cater for home needs.  She is married with children, some of whom are out of school, but care for 3 grand children. Frisita needs a loan to be able to buy more bananas, sorghum, and buying grass for making her brew.

loans.use: More bananas, sorghum and buying grass for making her local brew.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin is single. He lives in Khachmaz town. He is 40 years old. Two years ago he started selling salt and fodder for cattle. His minimum net profit is 500 AZN (Azerbaijani Manat) per month. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy salt and fodder for cattle.

loans.use: To buy salt and fodder for cattle

loans.name: Mulikatu

texts.en: Mulikatu A. is 50 years old and married with 2 children. A. sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of 30,000 NGN to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is divorced and the mother of ten children, but she has lost three through ailments.  She is a 70 year old who trades in charcoal in the neighborhood of Kwahu Da, a suburb of Nkawkaw, where she lives with some of her children.

Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes, obtained from burnt fresh wooden logs.  Through this trade, she has supported her first two children to complete apprenticeship training but the rest are still in school.

Adwoa obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of her town and retails them to her customers to support her family with income.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supply of charcoal to serve her customers.  Adwoa believes the loan would enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children.

Adwoa is a member of a borrowing group called ‘Anigyee” (translated: happiness) Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral and provide support to repay their loans.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 40 años y 7 hijos, Teodosia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales variados, productos que comercializa en el mercado Nery García.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, maíz, cebada.
Los sueños de Teodosia son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Milenio Communal Bank. She is 40 years old and married with 7 children. She travels to various regional fairs to buy grains, which she sells at the Nery García market. Teodosia needs a loan of 1000 sols to buy wheat, maize and barley. She dreams of owning a cart for transporting produce and purchasing a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wheat, maize and barley

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva T. is in the hog fattening business. Eva is thirty-eight years old, married, and blessed with four children. Her husband is a farmer. Eva and her family live in Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Eva started her business with just one piglet and a small amount of money. It has been a lot of hard work, and she doesn’t underestimate the kind of work it will take to maintain it. In order to continue her business, Eva realized that she needs additional capital. Joining the Kiva field partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, is a great opportunity for her to get the financial assistance she needs. Today, she would like to borrow $250 to purchase sacks of feed, and she would like to start raising a few chicks for added income. From the income that she will gain, Eva will be able to pay her loan, and like any other parent, provide her children a good and bright future.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed and chicks

loans.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es:
Maria Nieves es una mujer muy trabajadora y es  socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, es conviviente con 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en la comunidad de Punta Sahuacasi Sector de Acochupa, tiene estudios de 1er grado.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, ella se dedica a la compra venta de ganado menor (ovinos),  su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.
 
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con el que comprará más cabezas de ganado y luego los venderá en las ferias de la zona.
 
Maria nieves nos dice que le gustan mucho las reuniones porque así puede compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Maria Nieves is a very hardworking woman. She is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi Village Bank in the Azangaro Province in the Department of Puno. She is 56-years-old and lives with two children that she is responsible for. She lives in the Punta Sahuacasi Sector of Acochupa, and has a first grade education. Maria has been wokring with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past 3 years. She earns her living buying and selling small livestock (sheep). Her first loan was for 300 soles. She would like an additional loan at this time of 1000 soles, with which she plans to buy more livestock to sell at the fairs in her area. Maria Nieves tells us that she really enjoys the meetings because they allow her to share with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón distante a 15 Km de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se conformó el grupo denominado San José, nombre por el cual han optado por ser miembros del barrio con dicho nombre, quienes luego de interiorizarse sobre el reglamento de Comite de Mujeres Emprendadoras de Fundacion Paraguaya, aceptaron y conformaron dicho comité por los múltiple beneficios que presenta el programa.  El comite está integrada por 16 activas y sacrificadas  mujeres, encontrándose en el sexto ciclo del programa, sacrificándose al máximo para salir adelante.  Pues cada una de ellas han invertido en sus respectivas actividades, gracias a eso han mejorado considerablemente la calidad de vida tanto de ellas como la de sus familias.

Las integrantes y sus actividades son:

Juana S..	Almacén.
Edith M..	Empleada.
Cecilia D..	Venta de carbón.
Rossana C.. 	Venta de comestibles.
Vidalina O..	Venta de comestibles.
Elva V.. 	Venta de frutas y verduras.
Leonida T.. 	Empleada.
Olga Y..	Venta de frutas, verduras y carne.
Elva O..	Costurera.
Amada G..	Cria de cerdo.
Salustiana Orué. 	Kiosko.
Ignacia D..	Vendedora ambulante.
Rocio A..	Venta de comestibles.
Ma. Felisa O..	Costurera.
Gladys C..	Venta de bebidas y carne de cerdo.
Nancy Gómez.	Venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, some 15 km away from the Oficina de Paraguarí, a group called San José was formed, named by the group members who live in the neighborhood with the same name. After familiarizing themselves with the rules and regulations of the Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women) of Fundacion Paraguaya, the accepted the terms and joined this group because of the numerous benefits the program offers. The group is comprised of 16 active and selfless women, who are now in their sixth loan cycle. They make sacrifices so that they can get ahead since they have all invested in their respective businesses. Thanks to those investments, they have considerably improved their and their families’ quality of life.

The group members are: Juana S.: General store Edith M.: Housekeeper Cecilia D.: Charcoal sales Rossana C.: Food sales Vidalina O.: Food sales Elva V.: Fruit and vegetable sales Leonida T.: Housekeeper Olga Y.: Fruit, vegetable, and meat sales Elva O.: Seamstress Amada G.: Pig farmer Salustiana Orué: Kiosk Ignacia D.: Street vendor Rocio A.: Food sales Ma. Felisa O.: Seamstress Gladys C.: Beverage and pork sales Nancy Gómez: Fruit and vegetable sales

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Thread, pig feed, cornmeal, cheese, eggs, fabric, meat, flour, sugar, bread, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, beverages, candy, etc.

loans.name: Estuista

texts.en:
Estuista is 59 years old and a vendor of different vegetables in their village in Minante 2, Cauayan City. According to her, she was married thrice and had four children with her second husband. Now she is happily living with Atendido, her third husband, though she has not been able to bear a child with him. Their village is around two kilometers away from the national highway.

Estuista believes that having her vending business will further support their daily living and give support to her four children, who are now living separately from her. With her desire to have a progressive vending business, Estuista is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 15,000 to use as additional business capital.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela tiene la edad de 53 años, casada con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, reside en el barrio Manuel Fernández en la capital de Managua, su esposo es supervisor industrial. Su negocio es una pulpería que inició hace un año con el propósito de generar ingresos esto lo logro con prestamos que Afodenic presto y ahorros que tenia. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa. Con este préstamo lograra invertir en granos básicos, productos enlatados, cereales, carnes, y otros productos para obtener mejores ventas. Sus metas es poder crecer en inventario para mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela is 53 years old, married with four adult children, and lives in the neighborhood Manuel Fernández in the capital Managua with her husband, an industrial supervisor. Her business is a grocery store she started a year ago to increase her income with the help of a loan from Afodenic and her own savings. Her plan is to make improvements to her home.

With this loan she wants to invest in grains, canned goods, cereals, meat, and other products to obtain better sales. Her goal is to increase inventory to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock for a grocery store

loans.name: Farahiya

texts.en:
Farahiya has owned and run a boutique and a fruit stand for the past nine years. A 29-year-old mother of one, she has requested her first loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to buy stocks of clothes. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to pay school fees for her child and help her start importing clothes from Dubai. One day, Farahiya wants to buy a plot of land and build her own home as well as rental units and educate her children. She describes herself as jovial, faithful, innovative, talkative, and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to her clothing inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila K. is married with two children. She sells women's clothing at the central market.

Ludmila has been in this business for 10 years. Her net income is 2000 UAH per month. She started her business when her family was in need and she made her business a success. It gives her family not only a stable income but also confidence and hope for the future.

Ludmila would like to borrow 4,900 UAH to purchase new inventories for the coming fall season. She would spend the income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new inventories.

loans.name: Las Novatas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Novatas  está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca,  es una ciudad muy hermosa siendo patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y,  la tercera ciudad más importante de Ecuador, su clima es frio  pero  el corazón de nuestra gente es muy cálido  pues son personas  muy amables y hospitalarias con propios y extraños.

Este banco está integrado por siete socias  que  son muy buenas amigas y conocidas de hace  muchos años que   se han  unido para formar su banco comunal  y  buscar la superación  personal y  tener una vida más  digna para ellas y sus familias,  las socias viven en diferentes partes céntricas de la ciudad de Cuenca; a continuación testimonios de la socias.

La señora María Isabel Q.  es  socia del banco comunal Las Novatas, vive dentro de la  zona urbana de la ciudad de Cuenca; María Isabel tiene 40 años de edad y ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 21, 16, 8 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independientemente con su familia, su segundo hijo estudia en el CEDEC y trabaja para sus gastos personales, sus otros dos hijos aun están en primaria y secundaria. El  esposo de María Isabel emigro al exterior  y les envía dinero para solventar en algo los  gastos de la casa, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

María Isabel se dedica  a  la crianza  de pollos, lleva trabajando 2 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien,  nos cuenta que con su negocio paga las deudas y con las pocas ganancias que obtiene incrementa su negocio para así hacerle más fructífero.

Este es su tercer  ciclo trabajando junto a su banco comunal y le agrada mucho todos los beneficios que obtiene. 

Con el préstamo obtenido  va a comprar más crías, comida y vitaminas para  sus pollos e ir incrementando su negocio.

El sueño de María Isabel es tener su casa propia para darles tranquilidad a sus hijos.

La señora Rosa María M. P. es una de las socias más alegres  del banco Comunal las Novatas,  Rosa vive en la zona urbana de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de su amor procreo 6 hijos de 25, 22, 20, 18, 15, 13 años de edad, sus dos  primeros hijos están  casados y formaron su propia familia; sus 4 hijos menores estudian  y trabajan para sus gastos;  su esposo emigro al exterior  y debido a la crisis mundial que existe les envía dinero solo cuando puede, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza de pollos lleva tres años en el negocio y le va muy bien porque tiene entregas a clientes fijos y cuando tiene tiempo trabaja en el taller de tapicería de su hijo.

Es su tercer ciclo junto a la Fundación Espoir, está muy orgullosa de la superación que ha obtenido gracias a los créditos obtenidos. Con el préstamo  que  la fundación le entrega lo va ha invertir en la compra y alimento de pollos por que desea ampliar su negocio.

Su sueño es  tener un negocio de venta de madera y ampliar su negocio de pollos para darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La señora Lourdes  de la Nube Zhispun P. es socia del Bankito Comunal las Novatas, ella vive en  el sector de Medio Ejido una  zona urbana de la Ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra felizmente casada, tiene 29 años de edad y 4, y se encuentra embarazada de tres meses de su quinto hijo, nos cuenta que este embarazo le está dando un poco de complicaciones por lo que tiene que estar un mayor tiempo en repos;  vive arrendando, su esposo trabaja en una tapicería y forman una familia estable.

Lourdes trabaja en un gabinete de belleza de su propiedad, es muy conocedora de los cortes y peinados que se encuentran a la moda, por que trabaja en esta rama de la belleza desde que tenía 14 años de edad, ya son 12 años de experiencia, tiene su propia clientela, trabaja en su negocio propio hace 7 meses por que se compro el local.

 Este es su tercer crédito en la fundación y se encuentra muy contenta porque con el dinero que la fundación le presta paga las letras de su local y adquiere más productos para llenar su vitrina con productos de belleza.

Su meta es de ampliar su local de belleza y abrir otras sucursales.
texts.en:
The Las Novatas Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca. It is a very beautiful city, being the cultural heritage of humanity. It is the third most important city in Ecuador. Its climate is cold, but the heart of our people is very warm. They are kind and hospitable people with their own and with strangers. This bank is make up of seven members who are very good friends. They have known each other for years, and they have united to form a communal bank, look for self improvement, and have a more decent life for themselves and their families. The members live in different central parts of the city of Cuenca. Following are their statements. María Isabel Q. is a member of the Las Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the urban region of the city of Cuenca. María Isabel is 40; and she has four children, 22, 21, 16, and 8. Her first child is married and lives independently with his family. Her second child studies at CEDEC, and he works for his personal expenses. The other two children are in elementary and high school. María Isabel’s husband emigrated to the exterior, and he sends them money to pay some of the household expenses. They do not have their own house; they rent. María Isabel raises chickens. She has been doing this for two years, and it is going very well. She tells us that with her business she pays debts. With the small earnings that she gets, she increases her business to make it more productive. This is her third cycle working with her communal bank. She is very grateful for all of the benefits she has. With the loan received she will buy more chicks, food, and vitamins for her chickens, and increase her business. María Isabel’s dream is to have her own house to give her children tranquility. Rosa María M. P. is one of the happiest members of the Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the urban region of the city of Cuenca. She is 39, married, and has six children. They are 25, 22, 20, 18, 15, and 13. Her first two children are married and have their own families. The four youngest children go to school and work for their expenses. Her husband emigrated to the exterior. Due to the world crisis, he sends them money only when he can. She does not have her own house; she rents. Rosa raises chickens. She has had the business for three years, and it is going very well because she has orders from fixed customers. When she has time, she works in her son’s upholstery shop. This is her third cycle with the Fundación Espor. She is very proud of the improvement she has made thanks to the loans she received. With the loan from the Foundation she will buy food for the chickens because she wants to expand the business. Her dream is to have a business selling wood and to expand her chicken business to give her children a better future. Lourdes de la Nube Zhispun P. is a member of the Novatas Communal Bank. She lives in the Medio Ejido area, an urban region of the city of Cuenca. She is happily married, 29, and she has four children. She is three months pregnant with her fifth child. She tells us that this pregnancy is giving her some complications, and she has to spend more time resting. She lives in a rented house. Her husband works in an upholstery shop. They are a stable family. Lourdes works in her own beauty station. She knows a lot about cuts and styles that are in fashion because she has worked in this area of beauty for 14 years. She has 12 years of experience. She has her own customers. She has worked in her own business for seven months because she bought the place. This is her third loan with the Foundation. She is very happy because the money the Foundation loans her pays for the installments on her place. She also gets more beauty products to put in her showcase. Her goal is to expand her beauty location and open other branches.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, vitamins and food to raise them, and to expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Brigite

texts.en:
Brigite N. is 29 years old and married with one child who is two years old. She lives in Nyarugenge district.

Brigite owns her small general store, which sells everything from clothes and towels to cups and plates. She has owned this shop for just two years and employs one other person. Their working hours are from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. each day.

With this loan, Brigite will have capital to expand her offerings and attract new customers and hopefully earn a greater profit to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Gloria Josefina Bonilla Avilés De Pereira

texts.es: Gloria Josefina B. A. D. P. vive en el municipio D. Colon del departamento D. La Libertad junto esposo y sus dos hijas. Gloria tiene 54 años D. edad, hace siete años ella se dio a la lucha D. emprender su propio negocio, un taller D. costura, el maneja desD. su casa. Gloria es una mujer muy alegre, cada día pone lo mejor D. sí en sus confecciones, ya que ella manifiesta que la costura y el diseño son una gran pasión en su vida y es así como ve el trabajo D. todos los días, con un entusiasmo y espíritu emprendedor en su negocio. Ahora ella solicita D. un crédito para poder comprar nuevos cortes en tela y así seguir elaborando D. sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Gloria Josefina B. A. D. P., 54, lives in the town of Colon, which is in the La Libertad department, with her husband and two daughters. Seven years ago she took on the challenge of running her own business, a sewing workshop, which she operates from her home. Gloria is a cheerful woman who puts her best into each of her creations every day; she states that clothing design and manufacture is her life's great passion and that's how she views her daily work, with enthusiasm and an entrepreneurial spirit. She requests this loan to buy new fabric selections so that she can continue making her dresses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for clothing manufacture.

borrowers.first_name: Gloria Josefina Bonilla Avilés De Pereira

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros R. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Milagros is single. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Milagros joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Milagros from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna K. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lalitpur. She lives with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Sahadev K., is a farmer and her son is studying in grade 7.

Mrs. Jamuna K. owns a cow and sells cow’s milk in her neighborhood. She carries milk containers and sells door to door every day in the morning and evening. To meet her rising demand, she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 loan to purchase a young cow.

loans.use: To buy a calf for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le quartier Fana coura, ville de Fana, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt elles comptent acheter, des trousseaux de tasses, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes et des habillements à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Les produits sont achetés en gros et sont revendus en détail, au  comptant et souvent à crédit au marché, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de  40.000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women with an average age of 26 and on average, 2 children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families and live in the neighborhood of Fana Coura, town of Fana, sub-prefecture of Fana, region of KOULIKORO, Republic of Mali.

They met one another through neighborhood ties and kinship.

These women work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwasa in order to perpetuate their money-making activity.

This is their sixth group loan and all the previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

With this new loan they are planning on buying sets of bowls, a large quantity of different kinds of condiments and clothing in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The products are bought wholesale and sold retail, in cash and often on credit to customers made up of women and men.

They each are planning to make an average monthly profit of 40, 000 FCFA. The profits are reinvested in part in the business and the other part in the daily family’s expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bowls, clothing, and condiments

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo tiene 58 años, y junto a él vive su pareja y su hijo de tres años en su casa propia. Es así que para ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia se dedica desde 20 años a su taller de mecánica de motos y motocarros, ubicado en una parte de su terreno que tiene ya que no hay mejor lugar para trabajar tranquilamente. Paralelo a ello, Adolfo tuvo la oportunidad de comprarse una moto en el que parte de sus ratos libres se dedica al transportes de pasajeros al mismo tiempo ofrece arrendar su moto para que otros personas lo trabajen. Es de esta manera como se gana la vida, siendo su mayor motivación el trabajo de mecánica ya que se relaciona con muchas personas además que le resulta más rentable por tener clientes fijos. Con el tiempo espera construir un local más adecuado para su taller. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y esta dispuesto a ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. El espera invertir con el préstamo que solicita en su taller de mecánica, implementándolo con nuevas herramientas y darle mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 58 years old and lives in a home he shares with his common-law wife and their three-year-old son. They are his inpiration to gain a better life. For the past 20 years, Adolfo has operated a mechanic's shop for motorcycles and moto-cars. His shop is located on a portion of his land because there isn't a better place available for him to work quietly. In addition to his workshop, Adolfo had the opportunity to purchase a moto-taxi for himself, and during his free time he either transports passengers with it or rents it to other taxi drivers who are without access to a moto-taxi. When he rents his moto-taxi, his earnings also increase at the mechanic's shop because he has more time to simply interact with his clients and thus create permanent clients who return to him time after time. Currently, he is hoping to find a different plot of land where he can build his workshop, in order to have it in a more convenient location. This is Adolfo's fourth loan with Micro-Finanzas Prisma, and he is very reliable when it comes to his loan repayments. He plans to invest the loan in his mechanic's workshop by purchasing new tools so that he can take better care of his clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzy Marinkovich, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools and renovation of mechanic's workshop

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie E. is from the village of Omunay, Damulog, Bukidnon. Norie is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Norie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Norie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Norie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. is single and has three children. She has received senior high education.

Cecilia sells jewelry and used clothing at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed by Mrs. Adelaida G., who lives on the 7th kilometer of the Murucuyá neighborhood in Ciudad del Este. She contacted her friends and neighbors to launch a group in their area. The group is called “Mujeres Maravilla” (“Wonder Women”) and is made up of 19 very active women from the same area who show great solidarity with one another. They have different business activities, and some group members were able to start new businesses in order to generate income and thus support their families. For example, Mrs. Ignacia V. did not have a business, but after joining this committee she became enthusiastic and started working as a street vendor selling clothing. She travels around, visiting commercial establishments in remote areas of the city. She earns good money and feels very fulfilled. She is happy to be able to help her family improve their quality of life. She used this loan to buy clothing like jerseys, shirts, pants, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Buy shirts, jerseys and pants

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Ana  se levanta de horas tempranas 4:30am para elaborar los diferentes sabores de comida y refresco para luego trasladarse a las 6am a su puesto de venta en el mercado la estación finalizando a las 10:30 am.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles,  carne, pollo,  y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana wakes up in the early morning hours so that she can begin preparing different flavors of food and beverages by 4:30am. By 6am, she has arrived at her vending post at the market station where she stays until 10:30am.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, meat, chicken, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beans, meat, chicken, and other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 50-year-old single mother of three children aged 32, 30 and 20 years though she currently lives with her three grandchildren in a rented house.

Florence sells cereals and dry foods in Masindi, Uganda, a business she has done for twenty years. She first started working in a hotel (restaurant), then sold bananas, and finally switched to selling cereals and dry foodstuffs.

Florence dreams of constructing her own residential house which he thinks is possible with profits from her business and credit from HOFOKAM.

This is Florence’s first loan from HOFOKAM which she intends to use to buy posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava), beans, and groundnuts (peanuts) for reselling.

loans.use: To buy posho, beans, and groundnuts for reselling

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé de six membres : 3 veuves et 3 mariées dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 57 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent  toutes  Bagadadji, un quartier populaire de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage, de leurs activités commerciales au marché de Ségou Coura  et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle d’entraide des femmes de Bagadadji. 
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya font essentiellement l’achat vente du riz, de l’atiéké et des condiments alimentaires.
Dans le souci  d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités commerciales les femmes du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 10ème  prêt  solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les neuf précédents.
Madame Mariam Koné qui est un des membres du groupe fait l’achat vente de  céréales il y a une vingtaine d’année mais depuis 2005, elle excelle dans la commercialisation du riz. 
Elle s’approvisionne  à la place de Niono sise à Ségou et compte utiliser son prêt   pour acheter une tonne et demi de riz auprès des grossistes. Elle vend en détail et en demi gros à domicile et au marché de Ségou Coura à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Madame compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 43000FCFA qui sera utilisé au remboursement du prêt, à la prise en charge de certains petits besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Djiguiya is composed of six women:  three widowed and three married, in polygamous families.  The women average 57 years of age and six children each.  They all live in Bagadadji, a working-class district of Segou City (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of marriage, community, commercial work at the Segou Coura market, and belonging to the same women's traditional mutual-assistance association of Bagadadji.  The group members essentially buy and sell rice, atiéké (a cassava couscous), and condiments.  Concerned about increasing the volume of their businesses, the women of the group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their tenth solidarity loan after having properly repaid the nine preceding ones.  Ms. Mariam Koné is one of the group members, and she has been buying and selling grains for about twenty years.  But since 2005, she has excelled at selling rice.  She gets her supplies at Niono square located in Segou.  She plans on using her loan for buying a tonne and a half of rice from wholesalers.  She sells retail and wholesale out of her home and at the Segou Coura market.  Her customer base is composed of men and women.   Mariam plans on making a monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to meet certain sundry needs of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice

loans.name: Mrs. Yan Yim Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of nine people who live in Roleang Kaen village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yan Y. is the village bank president, selected by all the members.  They will use the loan for different purposes. She owns a general store in the local village to earn some money to support her family.
